story:
Short Summary

Jericho is a story about a found family forced into a guarded city, a city controlled by the remnants of the military of their civil war-torn country. The city promises safety and security, but their security comes at a high price...

My name is Rachel Mumaw and I am the author of Jericho. I wrote this book because I love gritty, thrilling dystopian fiction and I wanted to write a novel in that genre, and I wanted to write a story that was more inclusive of diverse identities, including race, gender, and sexual identities.

I want this story to help you discover the importance of community, especially as a part of resistance to authoritarianism. I want this book to be an escape into a thrilling adventure that also invites you to observe your own communities. You may see ways in which your neighbors and friends have similar needs to the characters in Jericho.

The story of Jericho begins with Riley Jay, their partner Sergio, and their new-found family Ian and Jen as they travel through a pale desert. It’s all that remains of a thriving city that’s been reduced to rubble through bombs and bullets; ash swirls with every footstep, and what isn’t scorched by fire has been blasted by sand in the ensuing years. It’s a harsh world where supplies are scarce and even the fittest may not survive.

Riley Jay, Sergio, Ian, and Jen are survivors of the Collapse, a violent political takeover that sparked a still-raging civil war. All four resolve to remain independent and impartial from the conflict, but when tragedy strikes they are forced into Jericho, a city controlled by the Command. The remnants of the country’s former military, the Command promises them more safety and stability than their life on the road could ever offer, and at first, the promises seem to be true. That is, until Riley Jay is secretly “recruited” to provide medical care to those who otherwise cannot access it, a service that is firmly illegal within Jericho’s walls. As the Command tightens its grip on dissenters and Riley Jay is asked to take increasingly dangerous tasks, they will have to decide whether the health of their community is worth the safety of their family.

You will love this book if you love gritty, thrilling dystopian fiction and are looking for a novel that is fast-paced yet asks serious questions about the importance of community and the nature of safety and security.

Ultimately, I hope that Jericho inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

What responsibilities do we have to our community?

Do our responsibilities to our families outweigh our responsibilities to our communities?

What does being “safe” and “secure” actually mean?

I really look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. Coming together and discussing family, community, and security will change us all for the better. 

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

- The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2021

- The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)

- The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).

- The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.

- The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this spring.

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

- You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish and a handwritten thank-you note.

- Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).

- You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.

- You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.

- You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

About the Author

Rachel Mumaw is a current Master of Divinity student at Perkins School of Theology. She holds a Bachelor of Science degree in Biology and a Bachelor of Arts in Human Rights, with a concentration in public policy, both from Southern Methodist University. Most of her academic work has focused around the intersection between LGBTQ+ rights and faith, including presenting her senior capstone thesis about the experiences of LGBTQ+ people in the Christian religion at the National Conference on Race in Higher Education.

Ever since Rachel was in elementary school, she would get in trouble for reading when she was supposed to be doing schoolwork. This love of reading, especially for dystopian, sci-fi, and fantasy literature, quickly turned into a love of writing. Then ever since Rachel began her academic career in human rights, she’s been looking for a way to combine her love of fiction with her passion for social justice. Jericho is hopefully the beginning of that journey.

Outside of school and writing, Rachel likes to play tabletop games with her friends, try out whatever new arts and crafts are trending, explore her adopted home state of Texas, and chase around her two cats.

For more information, you can connect with Rachel at rmumaw.author@gmail.com, or on Instagram and Twitter (both @rmumaw_author).
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're just not able contribute because times are tough, I completely understand, and there are other ways you can help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #JerichoNovel and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Rachel Mumaw

story:
Kids in Cuffs: Striving for Equity and Empathy in Education looks at antiquated school codes of conduct that are detrimental to students.

Can you imagine being a student who uses their cell phone in class and then being arrested by school police? Many students across the nation, specifically Black and brown students, experience harsh school discipline that results in suspensions, expulsions, and even arrest. 

My name is Ar’Sheill Monsanto and I am the author of Kids in Cuffs: Striving for Equity and Empathy in Education. I wrote this book because twenty years ago I had a traumatic experience with punitive school discipline practices. Today, many of those practices have been exacerbated and as a parent I believe we can redefine a system that doesn't criminalize students. 

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will learn more about education policies as they relate to school discipline. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for equity and policy change. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to helping you understand policy, systems, and school environments. These will be tools and frameworks you can use to enact change. 

In this book, you'll learn about school discipline and how racism perpetuates gaps in equity. You'll hear...

  • Stories about Black students being suspended from school during virtual learning
  • What role school-based law enforcement plays in school discipline
  • How certain school districts are pioneering new efforts to address student behavior in an equitable way

You will love this book if you are a problem solver looking for innovative solutions that change behavior and instill equity. 

Kids in Cuffs: Striving for Equity and Empathy in Education is a nonfiction book that speaks to parents, educators, school leaders, and policy makers who want to look at school discipline and equity in education in a new way.


Kids in Cuffs: Striving for Equity and Empathy in Education

The book is written in three parts:

Part 1 contains the introduction and chapters 1-3. These chapters look at the history of school discipline policies including the introduction of police into schools. I also share stories of actual students and their experiences with school discipline and even use of force by school-based law enforcement. 

Part 2 contains chapters 5-7 which looks at school districts and education policies that have adopted practices that are more restorative. This section includes research and interviews from school districts that have adopted and implemented restorative justice programs to counteract exclusionary discipline. 

Part 3 contains chapters 8, the final chapter. In this section I share a framework more commonly used in public health to change behaviors. I believe this framework could work to reform school discipline policies in an effort to promote equity for all students. 
 

What I Need & What You'll Get:

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2021.
  • The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this winter.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish and a handwritten thank-you note.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“Special Thanks to”).
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

Campaign Goals

Tier 1: Hit $5,500 and the ebook/softcover editions get published (this is the minimum needed)
Tier 2: Hit $6,500 and the book will get a hardcover edition
Tier 3: Hit $8,500 and we’ll get an audiobook edition.

 

About the Author

Ar’Sheill Monsanto has worked in advocacy, public policy and community organizing for 15 years where she has been responsible for implementing evidence-based strategies to create environmental change through public policy. She currently serves as the Director of Organizing Strategy in Houston for Leadership for Educational Equity. In the past she has spearheaded advocacy campaigns for organizations including the Illinois Dept. of Public Health, American Heart Association, Texans Standing Tall, and Texas State Alliance of YMCAs. Ar’Sheill wrote this book because she is passionate about creating meaningful change through public policy. When Ar’Sheill is not working you can find her bingeing on reality shows, searching for the perfect cupcake, or complaining about exercising.  For more information, you can connect with Ar’Sheill Monsanto via email at arsheill.monsanto@gmail.com, Instagram  or on LinkedIn.

 

International Preorders

For international preorders, please do the following:

Identify the perk that interests you, e.g. 1 or 2 paperbacks

Select the pink "Back it" button to "Make a contribution" for the same amount (this choice bypasses the shipping address page)

Please email me at ArsheillMonsanto@gmail.com to share your mailing address, so I can calculate the international shipping costs and invoice you for that amount via PayPal.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can support, but that doesn't mean you can't get something out of it!
I will reward the top 3 people who refer the most backers at the end of the campaign (30 days). Here's how:
  • At the top of the campaign page, you will see the "share" buttons. Click on the "chain" icon to get a custom link just for you. (Note: don't use the URL in the browser window as it won't work to track referrals and you won't get credit ?)
  • Copy that link and paste it on your social media, email it to a friend, or text a fellow book lover.
  • When someone clicks on that link and backs the book, you get 1 entry! 
  • Please use #KidsinCuffsBook  and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts!

Tag: 
Instagram - @ArSheillMonsanto / @newdegreepress
LinkedIn - ArSheillMonsanto/ @NewDegreePress

I appreciate you all so much for your love and support!

Thanks again,
Ar’Sheill Monsanto 

www.ArSheillMonsanto.com

story:
Updates:

With less than two days left in the campaign, I'm now donating 25% of all pre-order sales to the Hurston/Wright Foundation which discovers, mentors and honors Black writers.  The rest of the funds will be used for my book launch and book tour.   

Note the Special "author champion" perk where you get 5 copies of my book + an hour long consult with me.  This is like a mini financial planning session and normally costs $699.  

The Resiliency Effect was featured on a recent episode of the iSmart Podcast and will be featured on an upcoming episode of Money Savage Podcast and The Thoughtful Entrepreneur Podcast.

Story of My Book

The Resiliency Effect

Behind every strong and powerful woman is a set of adversities she probably doesn’t speak about. Not facing them directly leads to burnout or even stagnation and roadblocks in life. Most people I work with can name several big dreams they have for themselves. Everyone thinks they’ll get to it “one day.” And, everyone thinks there’s a specific productivity, life, or financial hack that will somehow lead to a more fulfilling life.

My name is Cady North and I am the author of The Resiliency Effect. I wrote this book because we often focus on the outward steps we must take to achieve our dreams. The truth is, there are internal steps we must take too. To start, we all have a status quo bias. It feels safe for us to keep the status quo instead of doing the work necessary to live our biggest dreams. Knowing about this bias isn’t enough, we have to actively choose a different path.

My hope in reading this book is you will discover reaching your dreams is not about getting another rung on the career ladder, working harder or finding another life or productivity hack. I hope to instill a passion and excitement for focusing on your inner journey. Ultimately, I want you to see this as a tool to help you launch your biggest dreams.

In this book, you'll learn about how to make sure your inner journey matches your outer journey. The common denominator of the 50+ people I profiled in the book is that they made a big change to live a life more in sync with their purpose and passions. Learn from their stories and insights which unfold over three parts:

  • How to Move From Surviving to Thriving
  • Success Catalysts
  • Launching Your Big Dreams


You will love this book if you are someone who is successful in their careers but aren’t feeling fulfilled. Or if you’ve ever said, I want to start a business, take a sabbatical or retire early “one day” but aren’t quite sure how to get there.

The Resiliency Effect is a non-fiction book that speaks to professional women who are looking at next steps in their careers or desire to find more meaning in their lives.

 

The Book - The Resiliency Effect

The book is written in 3 Parts.

Part 1 contains the introduction + Chapters 1-4. It digs into why we’re so prone to burnout and how to go from surviving to thriving in your life and your career. We also examine how the cycle of trauma, as well as how the health effects of adversity are passed down within families.

Part 2 contains Chapters 5-8. This part reviews success catalysts you can employ to live your biggest dreams. Discover the common ways of finding resilience including how to unlearn coping mechanisms, how being vulnerable can be a catalyst for change, the role cross-functional learning plays in success, and ways to unearth and lean into your passions in life.

Part 3 contains Chapters 9-12 and a conclusion. These chapters help you explore your mindset, motivation and fears behind common dreams. I chose to write about four “big dreams” including taking a sabbatical, changing careers, starting a business and retiring early because they are the dreams most often shared with me by prospects and clients in my work as a financial planner. Each of these chapters ends with a worksheet to help you sort through your thoughts.

What I Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • An editor to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2020
  • The cover design of my book - (the mockups you see currently are a placeholder).
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The copyediting for my book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this winter

I have pre-sold enough copies of the book to publish a paperback version, ebook, hardcover, and audiobook version.   All those who preordered the ebook or paperback by August 15, will get the audiobook version for FREE when it's released in 2021.   

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now depending on the level of support (review the perks to the right for more information):

Insights into the book writing process

  • Early access to excerpts of the book, with the opportunity to review and give me feedback.
  • Be involved in selecting my cover.
  • Receive a signed copy of my book when I publish and a personal thank you note
  • Your name will appear in a special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).
  • I will host a workshop for your group or book club helping you cultivate confidence to achieve your big dreams.
  • And more!

 

About The Author

Cady North is an author, podcast host, speaker, investment advisor and the founder of North Financial Advisors.

After 5 years owning her own financial planning business, Cady realized a common theme among many clients and prospects is that we all can name big dreams we have for ourselves, but very few of us are actually living them. We often find ourselves burned out and wondering what’s next. We easily move on to the next thing rather than doing the inner work necessary to match our outer dreams. Knowing there is a limit to the number of people Cady can reach one-on-one, she wanted to write a book exploring ways which people have overcome their adversities to live their biggest dreams.

Cady’s experience with money and business started young. Her parents were small business owners, and she learned to balance a business checkbook by the age of 13. Following a traditional corporate career path, Cady spent more than a decade advising high-level executives of Fortune 500 companies while working for industry giants such as Bloomberg and Financial Executives International. Then, she took the leap to start her own business helping women and entrepreneurs plan for their futures and grow wealth. Cady works with private clients virtually throughout the country and co-hosts a weekly podcast called Corporate Hostage, No More! Her work is regularly featured in news outlets such as the Washington Post, Business Insider, and Bustle. She was named as a top financial advisor by Expertise.com in 2020. She holds a B.A. from The University of Texas at Austin and an MBA from Georgetown University.

For more information you can connect with Cady at cadynorth@gmail.com and @cadynorth on Twitter and Instagram. Or at her author site cadynorth.com

 

Risks & Challenges

My draft manuscript has been turned into my publisher and green-lit. I have also built-in the shipping costs to each pre-order tier. This takes care of the two biggest risks of a book presale campaign: that I might not finish the book and that shipping costs could hinder getting them out. I’m committed to seeing this book project to completion.

I will be working closely with my publisher, New Degree Press, to make sure we adhere to all the publishing deadlines and get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy out (expected Dec 2020). We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits key milestones, publishes, and is expected to ship.

Thank you so much for your support!

Cady North
story_txt:
Updates:
With less than two days left in the campaign, I'm now donating 25% of all pre-order sales to the Hurston/Wright Foundation which discovers, mentors and honors Black writers.  The rest of the funds will be used for my book launch and book tour.   
Note the Special "author champion" perk where you get 5 copies of my book + an hour long consult with me.  This is like a mini financial planning session and normally costs $699.  
The Resiliency Effect was featured on a recent episode of the iSmart Podcast and will be featured on an upcoming episode of Money Savage Podcast and The Thoughtful Entrepreneur Podcast.
Story of My Book
The Resiliency EffectBehind every strong and powerful woman is a set of adversities she probably doesn’t speak about. Not facing them directly leads to burnout or even stagnation and roadblocks in life. Most people I work with can name several big dreams they have for themselves. Everyone thinks they’ll get to it “one day.” And, everyone thinks there’s a specific productivity, life, or financial hack that will somehow lead to a more fulfilling life.My name is Cady North and I am the author of The Resiliency Effect. I wrote this book because we often focus on the outward steps we must take to achieve our dreams. The truth is, there are internal steps we must take too. To start, we all have a status quo bias. It feels safe for us to keep the status quo instead of doing the work necessary to live our biggest dreams. Knowing about this bias isn’t enough, we have to actively choose a different path.My hope in reading this book is you will discover reaching your dreams is not about getting another rung on the career ladder, working harder or finding another life or productivity hack. I hope to instill a passion and excitement for focusing on your inner journey. Ultimately, I want you to see this as a tool to help you launch your biggest dreams.In this book, you'll learn about how to make sure your inner journey matches your outer journey. The common denominator of the 50+ people I profiled in the book is that they made a big change to live a life more in sync with their purpose and passions. Learn from their stories and insights which unfold over three parts:

How to Move From Surviving to Thriving
Success Catalysts
Launching Your Big Dreams

You will love this book if you are someone who is successful in their careers but aren’t feeling fulfilled. Or if you’ve ever said, I want to start a business, take a sabbatical or retire early “one day” but aren’t quite sure how to get there.The Resiliency Effect is a non-fiction book that speaks to professional women who are looking at next steps in their careers or desire to find more meaning in their lives.
 
The Book - The Resiliency Effect
The book is written in 3 Parts.Part 1 contains the introduction + Chapters 1-4. It digs into why we’re so prone to burnout and how to go from surviving to thriving in your life and your career. We also examine how the cycle of trauma, as well as how the health effects of adversity are passed down within families.Part 2 contains Chapters 5-8. This part reviews success catalysts you can employ to live your biggest dreams. Discover the common ways of finding resilience including how to unlearn coping mechanisms, how being vulnerable can be a catalyst for change, the role cross-functional learning plays in success, and ways to unearth and lean into your passions in life.Part 3 contains Chapters 9-12 and a conclusion. These chapters help you explore your mindset, motivation and fears behind common dreams. I chose to write about four “big dreams” including taking a sabbatical, changing careers, starting a business and retiring early because they are the dreams most often shared with me by prospects and clients in my work as a financial planner. Each of these chapters ends with a worksheet to help you sort through your thoughts.

What I Need & What You Get
This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

An editor to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2020
The cover design of my book - (the mockups you see currently are a placeholder).
The layout design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
The copyediting for my book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
The launch & promotion efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this winter


I have pre-sold enough copies of the book to publish a paperback version, ebook, hardcover, and audiobook version.   All those who preordered the ebook or paperback by August 15, will get the audiobook version for FREE when it's released in 2021.   I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now depending on the level of support (review the perks to the right for more information):
Insights into the book writing process

Early access to excerpts of the book, with the opportunity to review and give me feedback.
Be involved in selecting my cover.
Receive a signed copy of my book when I publish and a personal thank you note
Your name will appear in a special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).
I will host a workshop for your group or book club helping you cultivate confidence to achieve your big dreams.
And more!


 
About The Author
Cady North is an author, podcast host, speaker, investment advisor and the founder of North Financial Advisors.After 5 years owning her own financial planning business, Cady realized a common theme among many clients and prospects is that we all can name big dreams we have for ourselves, but very few of us are actually living them. Her parents were small business owners, and she learned to balance a business checkbook by the age of 13. Following a traditional corporate career path, Cady spent more than a decade advising high-level executives of Fortune 500 companies while working for industry giants such as Bloomberg and Financial Executives International. Then, she took the leap to start her own business helping women and entrepreneurs plan for their futures and grow wealth. Cady works with private clients virtually throughout the country and co-hosts a weekly podcast called Corporate Hostage, No More! Her work is regularly featured in news outlets such as the Washington Post, Business Insider, and Bustle. She was named as a top financial advisor by Expertise.com in 2020. She holds a B.A. from The University of Texas at Austin and an MBA from Georgetown University.For more information you can connect with Cady at cadynorth@gmail.com and @cadynorth on Twitter and Instagram. Or at her author site cadynorth.com

My draft manuscript has been turned into my publisher and green-lit. I have also built-in the shipping costs to each pre-order tier. This takes care of the two biggest risks of a book presale campaign: that I might not finish the book and that shipping costs could hinder getting them out. I’m committed to seeing this book project to completion.I will be working closely with my publisher, New Degree Press, to make sure we adhere to all the publishing deadlines and get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy out (expected Dec 2020). We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits key milestones, publishes, and is expected to ship.
Thank you so much for your support!Cady North

story:
*Update

Thank you for $5000! Stretch goal of $8000!

Thanks to every single person who has helped get this campaign to our goal of $5000 raised! The $5000 will get me to the publication for paperback which is HUGE! Due to your amazing support, you have encouraged me to go for my stretch goal of $8000 which will enable me to publish the book in hardcover and audiobook. I really appreciate all of your support throughout this entire journey!!

Best,

Kaitlyn

 

Story of My Book

The Public Sector Pivot: How Gen Z Will Lead a Public Service Renaissance explores why so few young people work in government and how to fix that. This book explores the intersection of public service, private sector methodologies, and government reform. 

My name is Kaitlyn Rentala and I wrote this book because currently, there is a severe shortage of young people working in government. Only 7.3 percent of federal employees are younger than 30, compared to 23 percent of private sector workers (Office of Personnel Management, 2020). The societal issues we face now and will continue to face in the future are immense. Climate change, healthcare disparities, economic inequality all threaten the very existence of our country and world. But none of these problems can be properly addressed without a strong public sector workforce. The lack of young people in government threatens the very health of our country.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover how this issue came to be and what can be done to fix it. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to think critically about the very structure of the United States government and how we can change it for the better. Ultimately, I want you to think about what a service-driven career looks like and how we can all live mission-oriented lives. 

In this book, you'll learn about why the government hiring process fails young people and how to fix it. You'll hear stories from incredible like...

  • Hillary Shah, a 21- year old first-generation college student committed to social change and public service. 
  • Benjamin Jiang, an accomplished data scientist who encountered massive roadblocks when interviewing for political campaigns 
  • Clare Martorana, Chief Information Officer for the Office for Personnel Management who is determined to bring the next generation of technologists to government
  • Clarice Chan, a Presidential Innovation Fellow who is incredible passionate about the civic tech movement and using tech for good.

You will love this book if you believe in service, are interested in government reform, or want to work in the public sector.

 

Parts of the Book

The book is written in three parts.

Part 1 contains:

  • The Introduction: Gen Z is Civically Enraged
  • Chapter 1: Business Influence in the Public Sector
  • Chapter 2: The Efficiency Perception: Millennials vs. Gen Z.

You will read stories of how businesspeople like Michael Bloomberg, Mitt Romney, and Carly Fiorina have altered what requirement are necessary for a career in politics. You will also learn how millennials and Gen Zers differ when approaching societal change and how the influence of tech has affected the perception of government.

Part 2 contains:

  • Chapter 3: Issues with the Public Sector Talent Pipeline
  • Chapter 4: Issues with the Federal Hiring Process
  • Chapter 5: Let’s Talk About Government Pay

You will read stories of incredible people like Tinisha Agramonte who overcame incredible odds to eventually become the Director of the Office of Civil Rights at the Department of Commerce and Judge Lydia Griggsby who had an illustrious career as a government lawyer and now as a federal judge. And yet, as college students, both had no idea a career in public service was even a possibility. 


Part 3 contains:

  • Chapter 6: A New Public Sector Talent Pipeline 
  • Chapter 7: The Civic Tech Movement 
  • Chapter 8: How COVID-19 Has Changed Public Service 
  • Conclusion: How to Live a Service-Driven Life 

You will read stories of new models of government recruiting and how the COVID-19 pandemic has changed our perception of government. You will also hear stories from people like Reed Shafer who co-founded Lead for America, a fellowship program for talented college graduates to work in local government. Finally, you will learn what it means to live a service-driven life.
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor and I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April, 2021
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this spring.


When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

 

About the Author

Kaitlyn Rentala is a current junior at the University of Pennsylvania studying Philosophy, Politics, Economics (PPE) with a globalization concentration. She hopes to one day pursue a career in public service and foreign policy as a lawyer. Kaitlyn is passionate about exposing students to service-oriented careers and hopes to inspire the next generation of public servants. She is from Rye, New York and is exciting about publishing her first book, The Public Sector Pivot: How Gen Z Will Lead a Renaissance in Public Service. Outside of school and writing, Kaitlyn loves exploring new restaurants, spending time with friends, and watching anything Aaron Sorkin-related. 

For more information, you can contact Kaitlyn at krentala@sas.upenn.edu or reach out on LinkedIn at https://www.linkedin.com/in/kaitlyn-rentala/. 

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #PublicServicePivot and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Kaitlyn Rentala

story:
Meekling Press, into the Future

Meekling has been making and publishing weird and nifty books and objects since 2012. We started with a tiny little 3x5 letterpress, and with the help of our awesome community, we've made more than 20 publications, from hand-sewn chapbooks to floppy disk ebooks, to an accordion book that stretches all the way across the room, and a manifesto in the shape of a trash can. We've also turned our fictional lecture series, Meekling TALKS, into an annual tradition. We love making publications that play with the relationship between form and content and we're hoping to continue doing that while bringing it to a bigger audience. We're starting to travel outside of Chicago and make lots of new friends, and we're also starting to get all Legitimate, doing things like getting ISBN numbers and Forming a Business and getting better Distribution for our Books—stuff that will help us help our authors spread their words farther and wider.

 

Welcome to the Meekling Press 2019-2020 Fundraiser

We've got SEVEN books lined up for the next couple years, and we need your help to take this gosh darn press to the next level and get these dang bloody books printed and out into the world. With lots & lots of wild and woolly "Prizes," we're putting the FUN back in FUNdraiser...

 

The Books

Shit I've Cried About, by Smeyer: A compilation of the first 5 volumes of Smeyer's (aka Sarah Meyer's) zine of the same name. Lists, drawings, things to cry about.

Shit I've Cried About is already out in the world! But only just and since it's a part of this whole generation of books we're including it here. You can get it by donating to this fundraiser, through the subscription package, or in a bookstore, or at the release party on October 21.

Proficiency Badges, by Carrie Olivia Adams: Girl Scouts, the woods, a battle, ice, and fire. This one's gonna be handmade and in a limited edition.

"I think we’d forgotten how red blood can be. How many shades it takes, how many textures. We ran thick, we ran like knit, like spider webs. We gave it by the bag, by the cloth, by the mouthful. I was dirty. We are more blood than water than salt than breath.

I wish I’d never been young."

 

Stan, by Marream Krollos: A breathtaking blast of Lispector-worthy voice, exploring the most primal and ethereal episodes of a woman’s navigation of desire.

“Everything good and everything bad is possible. You can disappear. Your body can be cut up into little pieces, wasted. You can be made to feel as if you are less than the animal you are. Your mind can be taken, used, destroyed. Your pride can be also. Your will can be taken. You can be made to want to die even though as an animal all you want is to live. But all good things can happen still. You can be given things still.”

 

Switch Wish, by Willy Smart: Water striders, spider’s silk, stalks, stems, movement, embodiment and tension. Narrative fiction progressing through associative flow, from stage makeup, to music festivals, to Freudian stages, etc.; an erotic novel in disguise.

"A pause doesn’t reset the scene: pressing pause doesn’t unlatch the play button—both functions are on at once. Let’s pause right there, my analyst says. Water striders are great because they do the pausing for me. It’s easier to do the pausing than it is to get paused. That’s why I’m out here. I’m practicing for getting paused. I hope to get paused. The spacebar, the largest button on my keyboard by far, is the hotkey for pause. It’s the biggest because it’s the one most pleasant to press and because its function is elementary. I need to be reminded that doing the pausing is only the initial waypoint toward the wish of getting softly paused, of being made to go under the sway of that function. I’m practicing because that’s what a pause is: a rehearsal."

 

Girl, Cow and Monk,  by Kate Wyer: Interlinked stories unfold like slowly evolving surreal portraits: a girl and her cow on a journey along the sea, going somewhere far away from here; a monk, a vow of silence, and a rediscovery of voice. Tales united by longing and a deep-seated desire to take care. 

"The cow pulls me some, I pull the cow some. We walk this way, if you call it walking. The easy shelf is gone; we wander the sandbar next to the deep pit of cliffs and caverns. To our right, it is now impossible to see the ocean’s floor.

Cow-cursing; water-hating; rope-hanging; eye-burning; sun-splicing; south-walking.

I’m quick to forget how solid land feels, and even forget the feeling of air on my legs. How to carry my own weight. What it is like to sit, cross-legged, or otherwise on something that supports me.

The water cools off the shelf and fear is cold too. No one ever said we would be safe out here, they just said we wouldn’t drown."

 

ALLTALK, by Suzanne Gold: Truly wacky spaceless conceptual poetry about writing and art and finding meaning in those things. An experiment in figuring out how a book experience can be more like that scene in Labyrinth with the Escher-like staircases and David Bowie in tight pants.

... difficult to excerpt as it's still in development, but imagine prints, illustrations, some kind of labyrinthine book form... "Leave the door ajar and thoughts creep in the night toward a conclusion//Clearly I can’t crave/What would normally tell me/I’m in step"

 

Household Tales, by Rachel Linn: Feral children, a polar bear, scissors and paper, a snowstorm, a disorienting free fall. This one's going to be a pop-up book.

"It wasn’t the bear that had scarred her, but it would do. She even preferred this animal because it was a mythic, previously unknown species—perhaps the only one of its kind. Her hands balled into fists and she punched quietly at the snowy walls of her hiding place, biding her time. She did not want to die, she wanted to kill."

 

Give Us Your Money, Please

We're raising funds to help pay for:

  • Printing these books (that's the bulk of it)
  • ISBN numbers, which will help get the books into more stores, etc
  • Distribution costs (that is, paying a distributor like SPD to get our books out to bookstores)
  • Website hosting

 

The Impact

Like many tiny presses, making books is a labor of love. Our profits from this campaign will allow us to go go to press with our next exciting season of books.

  • Your contribution is integral to our ability to make books that are unique and uncompromising, to continue to publish work that we're truly excited for you to read.
  • With wider distribution we will be able to make our books available to readers far  beyond the city of Chicago, where we're based.
  • ISBNs will allow us to sell books through our distributor, to be placed in bookstores, and to potentially receive more reviews.
  • The last campaign we ran gave us the funds that allowed us to buy a 100-year old platen press central to our operations, and to produce the gorgeous, intricate special edition of Dan Ivec's On the Stairs, as well as of Erin Kautza's fierce lyrical poem Muscles Involved.

 

Risks & Challenges

Our ability to make these seven terrific books is contingent on raising the funds to print and distribute them. We are committed to making and releasing these books with whatever amount we raise, but the more money we raise now the more time we'll have to focus on book making later, and the faster we'll be able to go to print.

  • As a small press, we're just trying to break even with our expenses. However, if we're able to raise more funding than we need, we will invest our profits in future books, our TALKS series, attending book fairs to get word out about Meekling's books, and to help us meet our goal of one day paying Meekling authors in more than books.
  • If we don't meet our needs for the entire season, we will launch another campaign next year for the remaining books.
  • To supplement this campaign, we're also planning to host a fundraising party in Chicago, IL.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you want to help but don't have $ to invest, here's what you can do:

  • Spread word about our books and this campaign across the medias—Twitter, Instagram,  Facebook, whatever suits your fancy. 
  • Tell your friends about Meekling, our books, and our TALKS series. 
  • Don't forget to use those IndieGoGo share tools!
story_txt:
Meekling Press, into the FutureMeekling has been making and publishing weird and nifty books and objects since 2012. We started with a tiny little 3x5 letterpress, and with the help of our awesome community, we've made more than 20 publications, from hand-sewn chapbooks to floppy disk ebooks, to an accordion book that stretches all the way across the room, and a manifesto in the shape of a trash can. We've also turned our fictional lecture series, Meekling TALKS, into an annual tradition. We love making publications that play with the relationship between form and content and we're hoping to continue doing that while bringing it to a bigger audience. We're starting to travel outside of Chicago and make lots of new friends, and we're also starting to get all Legitimate, doing things like getting ISBN numbers and Forming a Business and getting better Distribution for our Books—stuff that will help us help our authors spread their words farther and wider. Welcome to the Meekling Press 2019-2020 FundraiserWe've got SEVEN books lined up for the next couple years, and we need your help to take this gosh darn press to the next level and get these dang bloody books printed and out into the world. With lots & lots of wild and woolly "Prizes," we're putting the FUN back in FUNdraiser... The BooksShit I've Cried About, by Smeyer: A compilation of the first 5 volumes of Smeyer's (aka Sarah Meyer's) zine of the same name. Lists, drawings, things to cry about.Shit I've Cried About is already out in the world! But only just and since it's a part of this whole generation of books we're including it here. You can get it by donating to this fundraiser, through the subscription package, or in a bookstore, or at the release party on October 21.Proficiency Badges, by Carrie Olivia Adams: Girl Scouts, the woods, a battle, ice, and fire. This one's gonna be handmade and in a limited edition."I think we’d forgotten how red blood can be. How many shades it takes, how many textures. We ran thick, we ran like knit, like spider webs. We gave it by the bag, by the cloth, by the mouthful. I was dirty. We are more blood than water than salt than breath.I wish I’d never been young." Stan, by Marream Krollos: A breathtaking blast of Lispector-worthy voice, exploring the most primal and ethereal episodes of a woman’s navigation of desire.“Everything good and everything bad is possible. You can disappear. Your body can be cut up into little pieces, wasted. You can be made to feel as if you are less than the animal you are. Your mind can be taken, used, destroyed. Your pride can be also. Your will can be taken. You can be made to want to die even though as an animal all you want is to live. But all good things can happen still. You can be given things still.” Switch Wish, by Willy Smart: Water striders, spider’s silk, stalks, stems, movement, embodiment and tension. Narrative fiction progressing through associative flow, from stage makeup, to music festivals, to Freudian stages, etc.; an erotic novel in disguise."A pause doesn’t reset the scene: pressing pause doesn’t unlatch the play button—both functions are on at once. Let’s pause right there, my analyst says. Water striders are great because they do the pausing for me. It’s easier to do the pausing than it is to get paused. That’s why I’m out here. I’m practicing for getting paused. I hope to get paused. The spacebar, the largest button on my keyboard by far, is the hotkey for pause. It’s the biggest because it’s the one most pleasant to press and because its function is elementary. I need to be reminded that doing the pausing is only the initial waypoint toward the wish of getting softly paused, of being made to go under the sway of that function. I’m practicing because that’s what a pause is: a rehearsal." Girl, Cow and Monk,  by Kate Wyer: Interlinked stories unfold like slowly evolving surreal portraits: a girl and her cow on a journey along the sea, going somewhere far away from here; a monk, a vow of silence, and a rediscovery of voice. Tales united by longing and a deep-seated desire to take care. "The cow pulls me some, I pull the cow some. We walk this way, if you call it walking. The easy shelf is gone; we wander the sandbar next to the deep pit of cliffs and caverns. To our right, it is now impossible to see the ocean’s floor.Cow-cursing; water-hating; rope-hanging; eye-burning; sun-splicing; south-walking.I’m quick to forget how solid land feels, and even forget the feeling of air on my legs. How to carry my own weight. What it is like to sit, cross-legged, or otherwise on something that supports me.The water cools off the shelf and fear is cold too. No one ever said we would be safe out here, they just said we wouldn’t drown." ALLTALK, by Suzanne Gold: Truly wacky spaceless conceptual poetry about writing and art and finding meaning in those things. An experiment in figuring out how a book experience can be more like that scene in Labyrinth with the Escher-like staircases and David Bowie in tight pants.... difficult to excerpt as it's still in development, but imagine prints, illustrations, some kind of labyrinthine book form... "Leave the door ajar and thoughts creep in the night toward a conclusion//Clearly I can’t crave/What would normally tell me/I’m in step" Household Tales, by Rachel Linn: Feral children, a polar bear, scissors and paper, a snowstorm, a disorienting free fall. This one's going to be a pop-up book."It wasn’t the bear that had scarred her, but it would do. She even preferred this animal because it was a mythic, previously unknown species—perhaps the only one of its kind. Her hands balled into fists and she punched quietly at the snowy walls of her hiding place, biding her time. She did not want to die, she wanted to kill." Give Us Your Money, PleaseWe're raising funds to help pay for:
Printing these books (that's the bulk of it)
ISBN numbers, which will help get the books into more stores, etc
Distribution costs (that is, paying a distributor like SPD to get our books out to bookstores)
Website hosting
 The ImpactLike many tiny presses, making books is a labor of love. Our profits from this campaign will allow us to go go to press with our next exciting season of books.
Your contribution is integral to our ability to make books that are unique and uncompromising, to continue to publish work that we're truly excited for you to read.
With wider distribution we will be able to make our books available to readers far  beyond the city of Chicago, where we're based.
ISBNs will allow us to sell books through our distributor, to be placed in bookstores, and to potentially receive more reviews.
The last campaign we ran gave us the funds that allowed us to buy a 100-year old platen press central to our operations, and to produce the gorgeous, intricate special edition of Dan Ivec's On the Stairs, as well as of Erin Kautza's fierce lyrical poem Muscles Involved.
 Risks & ChallengesOur ability to make these seven terrific books is contingent on raising the funds to print and distribute them. We are committed to making and releasing these books with whatever amount we raise, but the more money we raise now the more time we'll have to focus on book making later, and the faster we'll be able to go to print.
As a small press, we're just trying to break even with our expenses. However, if we're able to raise more funding than we need, we will invest our profits in future books, our TALKS series, attending book fairs to get word out about Meekling's books, and to help us meet our goal of one day paying Meekling authors in more than books.
If we don't meet our needs for the entire season, we will launch another campaign next year for the remaining books.
To supplement this campaign, we're also planning to host a fundraising party in Chicago, IL.
 Other Ways You Can HelpIf you want to help but don't have $ to invest, here's what you can do:
Spread word about our books and this campaign across the medias—Twitter, Instagram,  Facebook, whatever suits your fancy. 
Tell your friends about Meekling, our books, and our TALKS series. 
Don't forget to use those IndieGoGo share tools!

story:
What is the story behind the book?

My name is Ryan Conner, and I am the author of “One Man, One Vote”: Northern Ireland’s Civil Rights Movement, 1963-1972. Using published interviews and video footage, the book examines how Catholic and Protestant civilians, who lived primarily in Belfast and Derry, experienced the movement, which began in the early 1960s in response to the Northern Irish government's discrimination against Catholics in areas such as housing, jobs, and voting. Many grassroots activists aspired to and insisted on using non-violent methods to pursue their goals. Yet violence broke out when the Northern Irish police led baton charges, as is now well-documented, against civil rights activists at their first major demonstration in Derry in autumn 1968.

Civil rights activists continued organizing demonstrations well into 1969. Yet there now was frequent violence among marchers, counter-protesters, and the police. Traditional cultural parades soon became sites of violence in August 1969, and British troops intervened to restore "law and order"--a phrase frequently used by observers in 1969. Many Catholic civilians cautiously welcomed the troops to protect them from the Northern Irish police forces, which were largely Protestant. The troops were supposed to stay only temporarily.

Yet within three years, British snipers shot and killed thirteen civilians at a civil rights protest in Derry in January 1972, turning many previously optimistic Catholics toward the paramilitary Provisional Irish Republican Army. This Bloody Sunday, as it became known, escalated the then-ongoing armed conflict between the Irish paramilitaries and British security forces.

The dynamics of the civil rights movement and the armed conflict are complex: how and why did violence unfold and escalate in the late 1960s and early 1970s? Did structural conditions in Northern Ireland make conflict inevitable? Or was conflict the result of particular decisions made by a variety of political and social actors? What are the legacies today?

I have been developing this book through a popular open program at Georgetown University and with the support of professional editors and publishers at New Degree Press. I selected this topic to explore Northern Ireland’s history, having both traveled to the Republic of Ireland last year and developed research interests in twentieth-century international history. Although the COVID-19 crisis has led many libraries and archives to close and made travel to Northern Ireland impossible, many Northern Irish institutions have resources available online. I have also turned to an outstanding, trans-Atlantic network of independent bookstores and sellers. Both have been invaluable for my research. I intend to travel to Northern Ireland as soon as possible.

Today’s landscape in the United States is beyond the scope of this book, yet it is imperative to acknowledge that the protests and the response have had some remarkable echoes, as I hope you’ll realize, of Northern Ireland’s 1960s civil rights movement and the landscape of memorials there today. There are important similarities, but also very notable differences, as with all historical analogies. Nevertheless, the past can illuminate the present across time and across societies in sometimes unexpected, yet welcome, ways.

So what?

I hope that the book will attune you to the power of the stories that are told about the past not only in Northern Ireland, but anywhere around the world, especially today in the United States. The ultimate purpose of the book is to persuade you that studying history is valuable to making sense of the present, especially in the aftermath of conflict.

Why should you pre-order the book?

I need to pre-sell 120 paperback copies of the book in order to publish it. If you would like to pre-order it, please know that your funds will help cover the following costs:
  • working with a team of editors to revise and publish the manuscript in December 2020;
  • selecting the book’s final cover design and interior layout design for both the physical copy and e-book formats;
  • copy-editing the book for spelling, grammar, punctuation, and consistency; and
  • staging the launch and promotion efforts this winter.

Please refer to the "perks" tabs on this page for the rewards you'll receive if you pre-order the book!

Are there any risks?

The greatest challenge of publishing a book is sending it to you. New Degree Press has built the mailing and shipping costs into the pre-sale campaign in order to reduce any delivery-related risks. These risks fall on the publisher. I will be working carefully with New Degree Press to make sure we ship you the signed copy as soon as possible. We will update you on critical milestones in the publication process. Most importantly, we will notify you when we expect to ship you your copy.

How else can you help?

I appreciate any support you can give. If you decide not to pre-order the book, please feel free to share the link to this Indiegogo page with your friends, family members, and professional contacts. Whichever option you choose, your support would be extremely helpful!


Thank you!


Ryan

 

About the Author

Ryan P. Conner is an early career researcher and writer. He earned a Bachelor of Arts in History & Public Policy, summa cum laude, at William & Mary, with particular interests in historical studies of conflict, diplomacy, and peace in North America, Europe, and Latin America. He has published research on early nineteenth-century U.S. political history in the U.S. Capitol Historical Society's scholarly journal. Aside from writing, he has enjoyed watching "Derry Girls" on Netflix and sharing stories with friends old and new over digital calls.

For more information, you can connect with Ryan:

LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/ryan-p-conner-26675...

email: ryanconner200@gmail.com

story:
The Story of My Book

Michael Brown. Breonna Taylor. Elijah McClain. George Floyd. Philando Castile. Tamir Rice. Six names pulled from a list of thousands of black men and women unjustly murdered at the hands of law enforcement. A list of mothers and fathers. A list of daughters and sons. A list of sisters and brothers. A list of people with their lives ahead of them, with hopes, dreams, and plans for a tomorrow that didn’t come. These are the names that sparked one of the largest global calls for social justice the world has ever seen.

From the bushfires in Australia to the outbreak of the coronavirus and America’s greatest economic crisis since the Great Depression, the events of 2020 underscored the need for a serious assessment of the status quo.

These intersecting crises have laid bare the existing institutional failures that the world has failed to address for decades, arguably centuries. These issues are not new. Healthcare has never been a universal right in the United States. Science has always been political. People of color have been unjustly murdered at the hands of law enforcement for centuries. What is new is the public discourse and open dialogue that this crisis has inspired.

Against this backdrop, should we ever go back to normal? Perhaps normal never quite served us.

I’m Jordan Johnson. My book, It Took a Crisis, takes a multi-disciplinary approach to exploring how the COVID-19 pandemic has exposed wide ranging cracks in our social structures and accelerated a global call to action. This shared experience has unlocked something powerful in us as global citizens, enabling us to reimagine a more equitable world.

Through interviews, research, and storytelling, you will meet:

  • Dr. Robert Patterson, Chair of the African American Studies department at Georgetown University, who shares his perspective on the link between COVID-19 and the social justice movements that culminated during the summer of 2020.
  • Sana Altaf, Innovation Designer at a top management consulting firm, who shares how inclusive innovation can solve many of the problems highlighted by the pandemic from vaccines to economic relief.
  • Maggie Kervick, Corporate Impact Specialist, who describes COVID-19 as a trial run for a much greater climate crisis to come.

I hope this book will be a powerful tool to spark critical conversations about how we might design a more equitable and inclusive society.

You will love this book if you enjoy non-fiction books that tackle topical events or if you are interested in learning more about how COVID-19 intersects with social justice, climate change, innovation, and corporate impact.
 

The Book - It Took a Crisis


It Took a Crisis is a nonfiction book, written in three parts.

Part 1: The first section of my book is dedicated to providing helpful context about COVID-19, what we know about it, how we can (and could have) stopped it, and how countries around the world have responded to the pandemic (for better or for worse).

Part 2: In the second section, I tackle the social justice movements happening around the world the summer of 2020. I provide the historical context around these movements and explore how the pandemic helped to catalyze these events. To conclude this section, I also share my perspective on what we can do to keep this momentum going.

Part 3: From innovation to climate change - the last section of book explores how the pandemic has underscored the need for capitalism to be reimagined to support the common good. After all, COVID-19 was just a trial run for more crises on the horizon.
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

It Took a Crisis will be published with New Degree Press. To help cover the costs for publishing my book, I’ve set up pre-order tiers. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor who’ll help me revise and publish my manuscript in August 2021.
  • The cover designer who’ll replace this mock placeholder with a professional, custom cover design.
  • The layout editor who’ll put together the interior of my book and create my ebook.
  • The copy editor and proof reader who’ll polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts when I publish this summer.


When I reach 120 campaign backers, I will publish my book in paperback and ebook formats. When 150 people back my campaign, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When my campaign reaches 200 backers, I will bring these stories to life in an audiobook.

As a campaign backer, you’re not just buying a copy of a book. You're investing in an opportunity to ride shotgun on my path to publishing. Pre-order my book now to receive an exclusive VIP experience, including:

  • You’ll receive a signed copy of my book when I publish this summer.
  • You’ll see your name in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You’ll be invited to join my Author Community for early access to excerpts from my book.
  • You’ll have an opportunity to share your insight in the selection of my book cover.
  • You'll get a rare glimpse behind the curtain of the publishing process to see what it takes to go from first draft to print.
  • And much more!

 

About the Author


A Private Equity Associate by day, Jordan Johnson has a passion for social justice and corporate social responsibility. By writing this book, Jordan hopes to activate a meaningful dialogue around what we have learned as a result of the COVID-19 pandemic and how we might leverage those lessons to design a more inclusive society.

Jordan lives in New York City with her fiancé, Ethan, and her shih tzu-poodle, Lola. When she’s not working or writing, she can be found in her kitchen, whipping up fresh pasta or homemade sourdough.

To learn more about this project, connect with Jordan at jordanmjohnson.nyc@gmail.com and on Instagram at @jordangreenwritesthings.

 

International Preorders

For international pre-orders, please send me a private message.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers apprised of my anticipated publishing date. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that some people simply cannot contribute to my campaign. If you find yourself in that position, I hope you’ll show your support in other ways. At the top of this page, you’ll find the option to Share my Indiegogo pre-sale campaign. Please copy the link and share it widely.

Share it with your friends, family, and network on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn. If you’ll use #ItTookACrisis and tag me (@jordangreenwritesthings) as well as my publisher (@NewDegreePress), we’ll help amplify your efforts on Instagram.

Share it with five friends, neighbors, colleagues, or classmates who might enjoy my book or the opportunity to join my publishing journey.

Share it via text message. Share it through direct messaging or email. Share it on social media. Share it and know that you’re making a difference.

Thanks for your support!

Stay well,
Jordan Johnson

story:
About the book:  

     Cami Kangaroo loves sweets. She can't stop thinking about them. Even after Mommy catches her locked in the playroom eating out of a bucket of ice cream, she still finds ways to sneak them. What could possibly go wrong? Based on true-life stories of the author's own daughter Cami, this book will have you and your children laughing, as well as learning a valuable lesson. 

My talented illustrator, Rebecca Sinclair, managed to capture my daughter's guilty expression perfectly!

The Story Behind the Story:

      Hi! My name is Stacy C. Bauer. I am a wife, mother and teacher. I have always loved writing and have been sharing funny stories about my own children for years. Last year, I took a leave from my career as a teacher and decided to write this book. This book is based on my daughter Cami and her quest to sneak and eat every treat she could get her hands on. It also tells of the consequences she faced as a result of that. 

     I wrote this book for my daughter. I wrote this book to make people laugh. I wrote this book to encourage children to take care of their teeth. I wrote this book because it's been my dream for a long time and last year, I finally decided to do something about it. My family and I are so grateful for your interest and support! 

 

My kids both love sweets, but my daughter Cami is the one who sneaks them!

 

How will funds raised be used?

Choose the perk you would like in the perk section of this page and follow to pay.

If you choose to support my campaign, your contribution will be used to fund the first run of my book, which includes: printing, shipping, illustrations and editing.  

Risks and challenges

The only possible problems that could arise would be a delay in the deliverables. All of my backers will receive their rewards at the giving level that they chose. Books will be available by June.

I had several local newspapers write articles about me.

I am also excited to be able to donate books to school libraries and the MN Dental Foundation, which I will be able to do with your support. 

Thank you so much! 

Stacy and family

story:
A place in the Heights for Children to learn
and help me write the American Chronicles of Narnia.

WHO I AM AND WHY I AM HERE
I write for and work with children who range in age from 6-10. Almost all of these children are reading above their grade level and there are very few books that are advanced and written for their age group.  Several of these children love and  excel in math and I want them to love and excel in English literature too. I loved the Chronicles of Narnia as a child and have read it several times as an adult.  I am working on a children's series based in New York City called Once Upon a Time in Bohemia. I have several outlines and the goal is to finish these books so that the children in my life can eventually have something I wrote to read as part of their homework.  I ask them their opinions on my writing and I have written two of them into my first book, I noticed once I added them to my book, they become much more interested in what they are reading.

What I have created in ONCE UPON A TIME IN BOHEMIA
My goal is to write an American Version of the Chronicles of Narnia set in New York City. C.S, Lewis was able to address War World II in his home of London, England through the Chronicles of Narnia. Once a Upon a Time in Bohemia is how I am going to address the attack that occurred on 9/11 in my home which is New York City. 
I have started the first book which is called Perigee Scribe. It is about a young girl named Maia. She is adopted as an infant and lives in Inwood, New York. In school, when assigned the homework of tracing her roots, she and her parents learn that she is the descendant of a Royal Egyptian Scribe and a Jewish Queen. Her birth mother visits unannounced and curses her in a jealous rage. Maia instinctively counter-curses her mother to defend herself. Her two adoptive parents and her two best friends race against time to figure out a way to stop both curses. They find that in the curse is the solution. She is a scribe so she just has to tell the story. I have 6 books planned in all which will follow Maia through her life.It is what I envision being an American Chronicles of Narnia.
What I need to make my dreams a reality
My dream is to turn this space into a writing lab for children who speak English and Spanish You can see in the video that it is a wonderful place.
The first 3900 will be used for the deposit
the first month rent and application fees so I can take over the lease 
The remaining 4000 funds will be used to build the workspace and materials for the kids to create and learn. It will also cover internet access for the first 2 month, the various expenses of getting the space functional.
Next step
In addition to writing my own work,  My friend Daniel and I will tutor children in French, English and Spanish in all subjects. Our focus will be on English, Sciences, and Language Arts. The children who want to can read the pages as I write them. We will be ready to go for the first week in February. Perigee Scribe should be ready as a first draft by July 31, 2015

Please spread the word about Once Upon a Time in Bohemia. Thanks so much!

Samantha
