story:
What is Beings magazine?

Beings is an independent print magazine about travel, focussing on the people we meet in new places.

Travel can really broaden your mind. But it’s about more than ticking sites off a list or following a guide book. The truly unique and enriching experiences often come through the local people you meet. People give you an insight to a place which you couldn’t get otherwise.

So Beings is a collection of stories, photos and illustrations exploring this theme. The real-life people in the magazine are funny, serious, heartwarming and heartbreaking. And from all over the world.

In the age of Brexit and travel bans, this is a celebration cultural difference. Going to different places helps us meet people who aren’t like us. Yet there's often something that connects us. And that’s a good thing.

What’s in the magazine?

We have 9 articles about the human side of travel for you to get your teeth into. Here’s a taster:

  • A lying hitchhiker in Cuba
  • An Indian food-lover who never got round to keeping a promise he made to his friend
  • Finding sisterhood on a train across Tanzania 
  • A man in Cambodia who survived the Khmer Rouge and grew up to give a new generation the opportunities he never had
  • The story of meeting both a kindred spirit and a witch by a mystical lake in Ghana

An extract from 'The top five fruits in Cuba': 

"Seven years ago this year, my friend made the somewhat bizarre decision to allow a strange hitchhiker to join us on a road trip in Cuba. 

His name was Ernesto (the Cuban hitchhiker, that is. My friend’s name is Mike. From Stockport). He told us he needed the lift as he was going to collect his dance award. It had to be said, Ernesto didn’t look like a dancer. He was no taller than 5 foot, was a little overweight, wearing an ill fitting tracksuit top and when he smiled he revealed a mouth that boasted only three teeth.

We were on our way from Varadero to the Bay of Pigs – driving across pot-holed roads, slowed down by donkeys pulling carts. I was half asleep in the back when, only 20 minutes into the journey, we drove through a small run of houses and a crossroads and suddenly came to an abrupt stop. The door next to me opened. I was a little surprised as I looked, bleary eyed to my right, as a short, squat Cuban man (slash dancer) sat down next to me and introduced himself. 

My friend returned to the driver’s seat seemingly unaware this was quite a strange thing to do in a foreign country where we knew no one, didn't speak the language and had no way of contacting anyone."

We have more stories too, as well as beautiful photo essays from South Africa, Nepal and Cuba.

Why print?

These are well-written stories from different people who have made a connection with someone from across the world. These are beautiful photos and illustrations that capture the excitement of discovering a new place with the help of a local.

They deserve to be more than content for just another travel blog. They deserve to be more than just something else we scroll past on our social feeds.

And you deserve to hold something physical in your hands which you can enjoy, free from distraction.

Engaging stories, beautiful illustration and eye-catching photography brought together through great design. That’s how Beings will tell the human side of travel.

Is this for me?

Do you like seeing new places with the help of a local? Do you want more than a guidebook can give you? Do you wonder what it would be like to up sticks and live in a different country?

Do you enjoy good writing and beautiful illustration? Are you a fan of independent publishing and stunning photography?  

If so, Beings is for you. 

Who is behind Beings?

I am a writer and editor from Nottingham. I recently left my job to travel for a while and as much as the food, places or experiences, it was the people that left a real impression on me. Now I want to tell the stories of some of those people.

I knew Sophie Gordon and Fiona McKenzie through work and they both got involved as they loved the idea of Beings. 

Sophie is a copywriter by day, specialising in the charity sector. But she loves getting involved with other writing and design projects on the side. She's also an active member of writers' group 26, and is an associate editor for their newsletter.

Fiona is a designer and art director who cut her teeth in the charity sector, before going freelance. She now takes on projects for a range of agencies and clients, and is still particularly passionate about design that can make a real difference.

But it’s not just us. Beings also features writers who have written for the Guardian, Suitcase Magazine and London in Stereo Magazine. We have a famous Mumbai food blogger. And people who just met someone a bit different while traveling.

Our illustrators and photographers have worked with Like the Wind magazine, BBC iWonder and After Nyne Magazine.

They’re all brought together to tell the human side of travel.

The specs

Beings magazine is a brand new publication. By pledging now, you’re helping
to create something fresh – you’re helping to bring our idea to life.

If you’ve read this far, that probably means you like our idea too. But what will
the magazine actually look and feel like? We give you the proposed specs:

A5. So you can take it anywhere you want – on the train, to a cafe or with you
on holiday.
76 pages. Give or take. But it will be a fair few pages, full of engaging stories
and artwork. And no ads.
Perfectly bound.
Cover – uncoated 300gsm.
Inside pages – uncoated 120gsm.
Full colour.  

In short, it will feel good to hold and good to read. 

Just one thing – since this is our very first edition of Beings, some of these
specs may change a little as we iron out the design. Nothing drastic though –
you’re not going to end up with a flimsy 8-page pamphlet and a feeling of
regret.

What we need

We need your help getting into print and making this project a reality.

The crowdfunding campaign will help pay for the printing, distribution, the commission taken by Indiegogo and the website hosting.

If you like quality independent magazines, if you like travel, if you like different people and their stories - pledge and get a copy of Beings.

What you’ll get

You can pay £7 and get the magazine.

This is a magazine about travel, so we’ll ship it to wherever you are in the world. It’ll just cost a little more if you’re outside of the UK, to cover postage.

But we also need one or two heroes to help get this thing off the ground. Pledge a little extra, and you’ll get a little extra.

Those kind enough to pledge just £10 will get a special ‘thank you’ in the pages of the magazine (as well as a copy, of course). Your name will be immortal in print.

We’ve also lined up some beautiful prints featuring artwork in the magazine.

And if you want to make an even bigger impact, pledge a bit more and you'll get an exclusive invite to a Beings supper club in London. 

Full details of rewards in the 'perks' section.

How else can I help?

If you’ve pledged, we thank you hugely. 

We need more people to hear about Beings, so please share this page on social media, or email it to someone you think would enjoy the magazine.

Go to beingsmagazine.com and sign up to our newsletter. 

 

Photos by Sophie Gordon and Tom Hull. Illustration by Matthew Brazier.

story:
Que?

Matrioskas é unha obra acerca da natureza do individuo inmerso na colectividade, sen pretensións pero cunha calidade indiscutible e un poso profundo que anima a ter profundos pensamentos...

A matrioska, a boneca con bonecas no seu interior. Compostela, cidade con moitas cidades no seu interior: a relixiosa, a universitaria, a nocturna, a de barrio, a turística, a política, a traballadora, a funcionaria. E dentro desas outras cidades máis, tantas como persoas, tantas como vidas.

En Matrioskas, novela coral, descubriremos ao longo dun ano, un ano onde caben moitos anos, a Marcial, Lucas, Venceslau, Chloé... medio centenar de habitantes da aldea máis grande do mundo. Medio centenar de vidas, escenas do seu existir. Medio centenar de matrioskas nun mesmo escenario: Compostela.

Quen?

Do Peirao é unha editorial con vontade de cambio, de dar a alternativa a autores que non a atopan noutro lugar, con novas e refrescantes ideas como é o empregar unha campaña preventa para valorar a aceptación e viabilidade de cada título.

Deste xeito es ti, agora que te estás expondo como colaborar, o que decide se a obra que che presentamos verá a luz pasando a formar parte do noso catálogo... porque consideramos ao lector parte fundamental do proceso.

Hoxe presentámoste a Gabriel G. Esteves.

Fillo e neto de emigrantes e de amantes da letra escrita, nacido el mesmo na emigración. Infancia no barrio vigués de Bouzas e na comarca da Paradanta. Cambiou o solpor tras as Cíes pola chuvia compostelá. Diso hai logo vinte anos. Licenciado en Filoloxía Galega e con moitas horas no mundo da hostelaría. 

Profesor, tradutor, corrector, lingüísta, monitor cultural e camareiro durante as últimas dúas décadas. Escritor desde a antiga EXB, nunca gañou a vida co oficio, o que non fixo que deixase de escribir. Novelas, relatos, libros de poemas, obra a súa maior parte inédita, salvo algo por aí ciscado en revistas literarias e recitais e un par de premios literarios, un na época universitaria e o Na Vangarda (actual Xuventude Crea) de 2005, co relato Moçalomihi.

Por que?

Por aquí un fragmento do texto como mostra:

«Levántase do seu asento. Áchase no seu escritorio, no seu apartamento, no corazón de pedra de Compostela. Lembra que o seu primeiro romance, o que a levou alén de Galiza, Pedra sobre pedra, estaba ambientada aquí. Si, lembra o día que chegou á estación de tren, comezando a súa etapa universitaria. Abre a xanela e deixa que o calor de fóra entre na estancia climatizada. Escoita a música que provén da Quintana. Pensa que leva sendo a mesma música do Milladoiro que xa escoitaba nas primeiras lecturas á sombra da Torre do Reloxo, onde descubrira a Ferrín, Pedrallo, Mourullo, Blanco-Amor, Braña, Cunqueiro, Neira Vilas… que mamente albiscara no instituto. Até ela chega tamén o rumorexar que provocan os millóns de turistas que asolagan as rúas da zona vella. Estes días case non sae do apartamento, a non ser para ir ao supermercado ou, á tardiña, tomar unhas cañas con Mateu e Sara»

Como?

Para arrincar o proxecto fixámonos como obxectivo 880€; esta é a cantidade que recadariamos se ao redor de cincuenta mecenas se fixesen, cada cal, cun exemplar desta primeira edición.

  • Tendo acceso ás galeradas de edición.
  • Recibindo un exemplar semanas antes da saída ao mercado da obra.
  • Aínda que, tamén poderías ver o teu nome nos agradecementos achegando un pouco máis.

Os fondos recadados, utilizaranse como axuda para sacar adiante esta primeira edición de Matrioskas que sairía despois á venda.

Ademais...

Sabemos que son tempos difíciles, tamén nós os sufrimos, e é posible que non esteas en disposición de apoiarnos co teu mecenado nestes momentos... pero agardamos que se isto te chegou á alma, mesmo se talvez coñeces en persoa ao autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-orella... ) para que academos a nosa meta e Gabriel G. Esteves vexa publicada a súa obra.

Grazas polo voso tempo.

Profesor, tradutor, corrector, lingüísta, monitor cultural e camareiro durante as últimas dúas décadas. Escritor desde a antiga EXB, nunca gañou a vida co oficio, o que non fixo que deixase de escribir. Novelas, relatos, libros de poemas, obra a súa maior parte inédita, salvo algo por aí ciscado en revistas literarias e recitais e un par de premios literarios, un na época universitaria e o Na Vangarda (actual Xuventude Crea) de 2005, co relato Moçalomihi.
Por que?
Por aquí un fragmento do texto como mostra:
«Levántase do seu asento. Áchase no seu escritorio, no seu apartamento, no corazón de pedra de Compostela. Lembra que o seu primeiro romance, o que a levou alén de Galiza, Pedra sobre pedra, estaba ambientada aquí. Si, lembra o día que chegou á estación de tren, comezando a súa etapa universitaria. Abre a xanela e deixa que o calor de fóra entre na estancia climatizada. Escoita a música que provén da Quintana. Pensa que leva sendo a mesma música do Milladoiro que xa escoitaba nas primeiras lecturas á sombra da Torre do Reloxo, onde descubrira a Ferrín, Pedrallo, Mourullo, Blanco-Amor, Braña, Cunqueiro, Neira Vilas… que mamente albiscara no instituto. Até ela chega tamén o rumorexar que provocan os millóns de turistas que asolagan as rúas da zona vella. Estes días case non sae do apartamento, a non ser para ir ao supermercado ou, á tardiña, tomar unhas cañas con Mateu e Sara»
Como?
Para arrincar o proxecto fixámonos como obxectivo 880€; esta é a cantidade que recadariamos se ao redor de cincuenta mecenas se fixesen, cada cal, cun exemplar desta primeira edición.

Tendo acceso ás galeradas de edición.
Recibindo un exemplar semanas antes da saída ao mercado da obra.
Aínda que, tamén poderías ver o teu nome nos agradecementos achegando un pouco máis.

Os fondos recadados, utilizaranse como axuda para sacar adiante esta primeira edición de Matrioskas que sairía despois á venda.
Ademais...
Sabemos que son tempos difíciles, tamén nós os sufrimos, e é posible que non esteas en disposición de apoiarnos co teu mecenado nestes momentos... pero agardamos que se isto te chegou á alma, mesmo se talvez coñeces en persoa ao autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-orella... ) para que academos a nosa meta e Gabriel G. Esteves vexa publicada a súa obra.
Grazas polo voso tempo.

story:
The Glass Cake: A Summary

"I can't stop writing," Cruickshank says. "I do it every day, and the reason I write is to discover the reason I write, why I'm fascinated by the topics I choose. It's a pleasant, satisfying affliction. I don't have a single point of view; I have several. And of course my points of view have changed markedly over the years and decades. It's as if my writing studio is a hall of mirrors, or my spectacles are kaleidoscopic."

"I love the human landscape -- interior and exterior -- so word and picture portraits are my favorite art forms. And I find the exhilaration, loneliness and rigor of travel is great fuel for creation."

These essays came about when Cruickshank was working full-time as a non-fiction writer. "Well, mostly non-fiction," he says. "I struggle to tell the truth, just like other non-fiction writers and even journalists, but sometimes it gets away from me. As Steinbeck points out in 'Sweet Thursday,' 'Just because something didn't necessarily happen, doesn't necessarily mean it's a lie... There's a hole in reality through which we can look if we wish."

"These are all written pieces of my past," Cruickshank explains. "The most recent was published more than 10 years ago, and the earliest were published almost 30 years ago. I seldom work like this anymore. Nowadays I'm living in a different context physically and intellectually."

What We Need & What You Get

Here's a breakdown of how the funds will be spent:

  • To bring the project to completion will require $15,000. This money will be spent on a small amount of additional design (the book is about 95% designed already and in ready-to-print Creative Suite files). Funds will also be spent on promotion (a 4 city book store tour) and distribution.
  • All donors will receive thank you gifts ("perks" in Indiegogo jargon), these will include having your name on the acknowledgements page (unless you request anonymity), one or more free books depending on your level of giving, participation in a video conference with the author, during which you can ask any questions you like about the work.
  • What if the funding goal is not reached? The project will go ahead and the book will still be published, but it will take considerably longer to complete.

Risks & Challenges

There is little risk involved except what I've mentioned above. If the total funds are not raised, the project will still be completed (I'm determined!) but it will take a bit longer to publish the book.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute, you can still help:

  • Publicize this campaign by posting a link to it on your Facebook page, on Twitter or elsewhere.
  • Don't hesitate to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
A few years ago, in the pub after a poetry workshop, Alex Bell and I started talking about our shared love of David Bowie, and at some point the conversation developed into one of those ‘wouldn’t it be brilliant if’ conversations. Wouldn’t it be brilliant if we could get a room full of people singing karaoke versions of Bowie songs. So with the help of the internet, my laptop, a TV and a slightly bemused pub in Farringdon, Bowieoke was actually happening. It was inevitable that we’d incorporate poems into the evening too, and we commissioned some poets we love and knew to be big Bowie fans to write us brand new poems based on their favourite Bowie album. They were all brilliant. Many of them knocked it out of the park with the karaoke too (Dai George’s TCV15 being especially memorable).

Then, in January this year, the unthinkable happened and Bowie died. Like everyone, we were devastated. I listened to nothing but Blackstar non-stop for a couple of weeks, then branched out into the back catalogue, and I read the poems, and re-read the poems.

A couple of months after that we had a chat with an editorial assistant at The Rialto, who told us they were looking to put some kind of anthology pamphlet together. Fortunately for us, this editorial assistant was Abigail Parry, who had been one of the poets we’d commissioned for Bowieoke, so they asked us if we wanted to make a pamphlet using the poems we already had, and commissioning some new ones. A project which we couldn’t be happier about, particularly given how beautifully designed The Rialto’s pamphlets are.

But of course, in order to get there it’s going to cost some, ahem, Red Money, and that’s where, if you like the sound of this, we’d like your help.

John Canfield

story:
Are you ready for the changes coming to your life? 

Are you willing to move forward without fear

But with love and anticipation? 

Are you able to accept what is coming

As a gift for you and the world?

My Story

My name is Celine Koropchak, and I have been receiving messages for over 25 years from my guides, whom I lovingly refer to as my Tovarysh (pronounced: Toe-Vahsh). Tovarysh is the Slavic word for friends, and these guides have most definitely been my loving friends since I was a child. Even though their messages have always been gentle and loving, for the longest time, I only shared them with my closest friends. I guess I should have known that one day I would be asked to share these words with the world. That request came about four years ago.

Being the private person that I am, my immediate response was, ‘You want me to do what?’ I didn’t know what people would think of me, and besides, how would I even do this? But I could never say no to my Tovarysh, and so I started with a blog, TheTovaryshConnection, to which I posted, and continue to post weekly.

But of course, that wasn’t enough. So about a year later I self-published the first book, One With All of Thee: Growing Your Sacred Connection (See Volume One here), a compilation of postings from the blog. To my surprise, rather than being chastised and ridiculed, I was thanked by many for sharing these words. Although they seem so simple, these words are very powerful, and many have been deeply affected by reading them.

Fast forward to today, in this sea of global change with the expanding atmosphere of fear. I know it’s time to continue with the next installment of messages. To quote someone who read a draft of Sowing the Seeds for Change (Volume Two), ‘The first book was like a primer. This one goes much deeper into the process of making changes in your life.’ And that is so very true. Now that they have your attention, my Tovarysh want to get down to business and gently move you forward on your spiritual path.

Having recently retired from a career in medical research, I am also living my life-long dream of being a farmer, with an acre of blueberries that I harvest in mid-summer. Living on my farm, working with Mother Nature, provides opportunities for me every day to see the interconnection between all living things. I work with the fairies as I tend this wonderful piece of land I call home. I have given talks on The Spiritual Side of Farming, which incorporate so much of what is presented in the written messages of the OWAT series. I’ve been a guest on BlogTalkRadio a few times and teach and speak locally, doing what I can to share the words of wisdom entrusted to me. My growth continues in this role of messenger/teacher/spiritual farmer, as I suspect I was destined to do.

   Though you have no conscious memory of this,

You agreed to be a part of this adventure at this time.

To make a change. To be a part of the process. 

                      So open your wings and soar!

 

What We Need & What You Get

In order to put out Volume Two of the OWAT series, I need the funds for cover design, publication and marketing included in the publishing packet ($3000).  To save on costs, much of the copy-editing and formatting has already been done in preparation for sending the manuscript to the publishing company. I am also anticipating costs for Paypal, Indiegogo processing fees, and perks ($2000). Anything that is raised beyond the $5000 goal will go towards creating a webpage, additional marketing and outreach. In a most perfect world, I would also have enough funds to pay for travel costs for speaking engagements.

Perks offered include:

  • A Sowing the Seeds for Change bookmark or notecard
  • An electronic copy of the book
  • Signed copies of one or both volumes of the OWAT series
  • Your name listed in the Acknowledgment section of the book
  • A personal message from Tovarysh 

 

Every moment presents an opportunity for change.

An opportunity for love.

An opportunity for true vision.

Every moment of your day.

How often do you take those endless opportunities

 

Risks & Challenges

As with any project, there are always unforeseen challenges and opportunities for growth! The manuscript is in its final copy-editing stage and just about ready to send to the publisher. There may be some hidden costs that weren’t considered, the timeline may be too optimistic or some unavoidable delay may occur. Bottom line, I am completely dedicated to getting this book published, so it will happen, one way or another. And if I promise you a perk, you will also get that, as soon as the books are available. The biggest risk might be you stepping out of your comfort zone, like I did, as you move forward on your own spiritual path!  ;-) 

                                           The first step is to recognize the presence of fear.                  

The second step is to replace that fear with love.

And all the remaining steps of your forward movement

Will gently and quickly fall into place.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Contributing money at the suggested perk amount is not the only way you can help with this campaign. You can use the BACK IT button to contribute whatever amount you wish. If you choose to opt out of receiving a perk, just let me know. (Though I am so grateful for your support, I would like to give you one to express my gratitude).

You could also pass this info along to a friend or two, or post on your FB page or other social media platforms. You can support me by liking the One With All of Thee Facebook page or following me on Twitter (@OneTovarysh). You can also help by spreading love and support to the world with each breath that you take. As far as I am concerned, we are all in this together, and by putting out positive thoughts into this world, we are already promoting change.

If there is some other way you want to be involved, feel free to contact me at onewithallofthee@gmail.com.

Consider your vibration to be one string on a Universal harp.
This combined with the vibrations of all others creates the Universal song.
                  The waves of this Universal song play throughout the entire existence of being.
If one string becomes discordant, the others will compensate to continue the song that plays continually throughout existence.
There will be a time that you will be able to hear this song,
If you have not already done so.

 

Thanks so much for reading this far. Whatever you choose to do, please remember that you are part of that beautiful song, the Universal Song of Life, and that your presence does make a difference.

Much love,
Celine

story:
Short Summary

WEBSITE IS HERE: www.elervin.com (Help get it up and running by visiting!)

 My name is E.L. Ervin, a new independent writer who would like to publish my first novel. I am writing this book, the first in its series, because I've always had a love for writing/reading and I want to deliver an epic fantasy story to our world of readers, young and old. My novel is about Michael Hanson, a teen who finds out he has a greater destiny to fulfill in order to save not only his world, but the entire universe. At first he feels overwhelmed by the immense burden of saving everyone and everything, but with the power of friendship, trust and love, he feels he can fulfill his destiny. I would like to send the message, that no matter how hard your life gets, with dedication, you can achieve anything you put your mind to. My goal, is to self-publish my novel in hopes of attracting a major publishing company with your help. So, many thanks for your time and consideration! 
Here is my new Fantasy Book Cover!!!

What We Need & What You Get

    The funds I am requesting, will go towards editing services for multi-round editing, copywriting services for marketing, additional distribution with an LCCN assigned for libraries, customized interior layout and design, different e-reader conversions, designer fee for book cover, illustration fees for chapter pictures, personalized webpage, webpage designer, website registration, professional pic for author bio, and marketing essentials. I will also use some of the funds to host a "kick-off event!" on my release date where a few of my supporters will be VIP.  

      If I do not reach my goal, then I will use the funds to continue  to publish my novel until it is finally out in print, as well as, online. 

      **ALL SUPPORTERS will have exclusive access to updates, promotions and offers in the feedback forum on my webpage. All are encouraged(but is not mandatory) to send a photo and/or name to me so I may include it on my "wall to fame" in the feedback forum. Each new supporter will be featured and thanked individually!

      ***ALL SUPPORTERS will also be entered automatically into a CONTEST! At the end of my campaign, I will randomly choose 5 people who have donated at least $100 to WIN a brand new IPAD AIR w/ smart cover of your choice(a $499 VALUE)     

        The Impact

          I believe my  novel will help give children and many adults in the world encouragement to start or continue in believing they can do 'the impossible' and be successful in anything they want to accomplish. Also, it will give out entertainment!

            My dream job is writing and with your help, I can deliver entertainment as well as encouragement to all who read my novels.

            Your contributions will make a significant impact on my life and my dream career field and you all have my gratitude  and respect for that! 


                Risks & Challenges

                I am a strong-minded person who has a love for writing and succeeding. I work hard for what I want in life and I will continue to strive to be the best that I can .

                I will continue to raise money until my goal is achieved and I have my books on the shelves of bookstores and online selling through major companies.

                  Other Ways You Can Help

                  Everyone can help in some way or another, even if you cannot contribute money, I would like for you to share about this campaign and pass the word of a new and upcoming author to as many as you can. I really do appreciate the thoughtfulness and consideration. Thank you!

story:
Short Summary

I'm about to get very real here, and share something that I used to be ashamed of. Something I used to hide away from, and constantly worry that people will judge me for it. I can't do that anymore. I've found a unique, modern way, through writing a fictional story, to help not only myself, but others too. Learn more below, 

What We Need & What You Get

What I need is $3600 to finish part 3 in my trilogy All I Need. The money is going towards the typesetting, design, printing and publishing of the book. I'm so close to finishing it and with a little more help, I can do just that! 

The costs are as follows:

Typesetting - $2200

Cover- $600

Printing, setup and promotional package - $800

The Impact

When I began the first book in my trilogy "All I Need", I was 16 years old. I saw it as a way to release my emotions, talk about my dreams, my fears and so much more. When I was little, I had so many ideas of what I wanted to be. I loved life, people and I was talented in many things like piano, baseball, singing, acting and so on. That was until I hit Junior high, then kids began to tease me about my looks. I didn't understand any of it, and slowly I started to doubt myself in everything. When I was born, my shoulder blades were fused as one, and my neck cords went out to the edge of my shoulders. I guess it made me look like I had no neck to some people, I was also missing a few vertebras from my neck. I knew I was a little different, but I didn't think it stood out that much. I couldn't believe how mean some people could be and I soon realized how badly words can really hurt you. 

After junior high, entering high school was a nightmare. The teasing continued, no matter how much I tried to ignore it. It didn't matter what great things I was doing, and it didn't matter how many friends I had, I could always hear their voices. The mean kids were always there and I started to feel very lonely. As many of you know, high school is hard, maybe the hardest of all for a young kid. I was betrayed by some close friends, including my boyfriend, and my parents got a divorce too.  I didn't really know how to handle it all, I then began to have nightmares in my sleep and before I knew it, anxiety had suddenly appeared in my life. This went on for quite sometime and I started to pull back from a lot of people. And then something else happened, as weird as it sounds, I had this guy who started to show up in my dreams every night. He would talk to me in simple phrases and help me through horrible situations building in my mind. He was caring, and loving, and I had no idea how I conjured him up. It actually freaked me out very much, believe me, I know how crazy this sounds. :D I had to do something about it, so I did, that mysterious guy soon became the main character in a lot of my stories I was secretly creating, and long after that, he became "Nathan" the guardian angel in my trilogy All I Need.

After high school I moved around a lot, and took on many different jobs, trying to find my place in the world, trying to feel like I belonged, but nothing worked. I still felt lost. That's when I decided to take a bigger leap and go to acting school in Vancouver. It was everything people told me NOT to do, and it made me think about my looks again, did people think I wouldn't make it because of my looks? My past continued to haunt me, but the film/movie world was a dream of mine since I was little. I needed another change, because nothing here was working. My entire 20's were a ball of craziness. I was taking chances thinking I was being brave, trying to figure things out, but I seemed to keep hitting bad luck everywhere I went. When I was about 26, I began to realize that maybe I had a bit of depression, but I was too scared to really admit it and definitely not loud to anyone. I was ashamed for feeling how I did, I felt very unworthy as a person and I soon found it very hard to follow my dreams. I felt like no one understood me. I didn't know it then, but I was ruining things for myself the more I fell into that downward spiral in my mind. Feeling like I had no one to turn to that wouldn't judge me, I began to write my feelings into stories, notes, and songs. And all of that, along with some old work from my high school years, soon became All I Need. It was something I created without knowing it, and ultimately, this story ended up producing a powerful voice for myself, I just hadn't used it yet.

The writing made me feel better in the moment I was doing it, but the rest of the time in a 24 hour day, continued to be a battle with my mind and it's horrible thoughts. I hit a point where I wanted to give up, I couldn't see a way out, and I definitely couldn't talk to anyone about it. I was very close to the end. Until one night, I had a dream, and in that dream, that same young man showed up. He showed me visions of 3 books and being somewhere in the film business. I felt like he was showing me a published work that was going to become a film series.... I remember waking up and thinking how crazy that seemed, how impossible that sounded. Plus my grammar was horrible.

But then after a few days of dragging my feet around... I decided to put the story together as a whole. I tied in my own life experiences and made it very personal, which is why I'm so connected to this series. After reading the first book "All I Need", I soon started to learn a lot more about myself, it was almost like my own therapy session. So when I began to write "Don't Tell Me Goodbye" the second novel in the trilogy, I began the journey to healing my soul. I had taken a step back and realized that I had done something great, and more importantly I was learning about myself, and through the story, learning how to heal on my own. 

The story of my main character "Sophie", which was loosely based on my life, had connected with many people young and old, in some way or an other. I began to receive emails and messages from people who had gone through something like this, or had a child going through the same thing... and the story became even closer to my heart. I didn't feel so ashamed for my feelings and thoughts anymore. I didn't feel so alone. I then created a web-series based on the first book All I Need and premiered it independently for 275 people. The response was amazing and the story only connected even more with people, and also got many aspiring artist involved. The feedback, even though it was on a smaller scale was motivating to me. I had managed to sneak into the minds of everyone, and raise some awareness through a fictional story that had a lot of heart, my heart. Schools, communities and more were taking notice of this trilogy and what I was trying to do. The arts had become so powerful to me, and I knew how powerful they were to others now too. They could actually heal and connect people.

I soon found myself hosting "Young Fiction Writers" groups at libraries, making classroom visits, I was even nominated for Woman of the Year for arts & culture.  With my depression still lingering around as I continued the fight to heal myself, I knew I had to approach everything I did in a positive way, with blind faith, because now, people were really listening.  I studied myself very closely, learned what set me off, who set me off, what I wanted in life, what I didn't want, and so on. I dug very deep to the root of my problems and started to face things. I started to change myself for the better. In my research for the last book in the All I Need trilogy, I learned about an old Japanese treatments called "Reiki". This, of everything I did, opened my eyes the most. I didn't believe it at first, but after spending 1 day at Soaring Spirit in Cambridge Ontario, my mind had changed. A deep feeling of calm started to spread throughout my body, and push out a lot of my negative thoughts. It's one of those things you can't quite explain, kind of like the guy in my dreams. I don't think of myself as a very religious or spiritual person, but now I don't know what to believe. There's too much that doesn't make sense... And now I felt sad again, but not in a depressing way. In a way, that I had been wasting my life, when I could've been doing something great, like I was now.

Today, those dark feelings still linger around, and I have moments of lower energy, but for the most part I feel alive again. They have a hard time pushing past all of the good energy I'm now creating. So now I've taken all of that knowledge I've learned along the way, and my love for supernatural love stories, and put all of it into my last book entitled "You're Not Alone." Because I feel like you never really are. There will always be someone out there that feels or thinks the way you do, and we all need to listen to that little voice inside of us. The one that loves us the most, the one that makes us feel like we are not alone in life. So I would love for the chance to complete my trilogy and share with the world this heart felt story of love, friendship, dreams and blind faith in life. And I want it to be published and pitched for a possible film or television series. I know this story can be larger then life, and I know it will connect with people who spend everyday, secretly fighting themselves. I just need to get it out there, which is why I'm telling my true story, in hopes that I can connect with others and get some support.   

I need Sophie to have an ending that is exactly what she needs in life. And that's the main point of my story, we all need something different. We each have a fate, things we're good at, special talents and more, but are we really listening to our hearts? Or are we too surrounded by negativity, distractions and people and their "Me time" to feel whole anymore? We need to care for each other, open our eyes to our flaws, and be willing to help. I'm hoping this last part of the book will make others take a step back in life for a moment, and truly look into their soul, find out what they love about themselves, and not be afraid to chase after what they want in life. 

 But I can't do it without a little more help. So if you can, please donate, every little bit helps. Thank you from the bottom of my heart. <3


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, that's okay. The fact that you read this all, means a lot to me. But if you, or anyone you know has ever felt like this in life, like they weren't good enough, or didn't deserve something, feel free to share my story. Share it on Facebook, by email, word of mouth or anything else. It's just as good as donating. This book has saved my life, may it can save someone else's as well.

story:
Struggling to live the life you know you’re capable of? Do you know a young person who is struggling to find their path? 

It seems like that’s the norm for most Millennials. 

The reality is Millennials are not really set up to succeed in society.

We at Millennial Skills are here to change that.

The world is changing so quickly and our schools and education haven’t been able to keep up… 

We’ve been able to help Millennials have a life filled with more success and more meaning.  

We’ve been able to help them combine their career and their purpose in life so that they can start making a positive impact in their own lives and the lives of those around them. 

With tuition rates and student loans rising, it’s important for young people to start focusing on their passion and career so they do not find themselves in a bad economic position. 

According to Johnson and Wales, companies need Millennials to: 

  • Communicate well 

  • Stay organized 

  • Interact well with other people 

  • Critical think and problem solve 

  • Lead other people 

But that doesn’t appear to be the typical Millennial... 

The biggest stereotype about Millennials? 

They’re lazy and entitled… 

But I think we just weren’t taught the strategies to find our path in this new world.  

Millennial Skills was created to help budding professionals like ourselves do just that. 

After coaching thousands of Millennials who were entering the real world. 

We learned that they dream of success, but they just don’t have the skills or the support to make it a reality. 

Millennial Skills provides the confidence and the community for young people to develop the skills they need to succeed. 

Our number one mission is to help young people find their path and their purpose for their life.

We help them identify their strengths, passions, and experiences to create a career path that energizes them 

Productivity and focus are some of the main pain points that plague young people and keep them stuck on the couch

We help them to improve their efficiency and effectiveness by improving their organization and planning skills

Money isn’t everything, but it is an important survival tool in this age.

We help young people build the skills necessary excel financially.

We focus on growing their income, increasing their savings, and building their long-term wealth

We want our young people to live life full of enthusiasm and energy. That requires taking care of our health.

We help our young people to eat, sleep, and exercise with more intention. 

They say you are the average of the five people you spend the most time with. That being said we want our young people to create thriving relationships in their life

We help our community to surround themselves with mentors and quality peers.

  • Time tested strategies and tactics to help accelerate your career and personal success and help you start living the life you’re capable of 
  • Support of 500+ like-minded, motivated Millennials in our Facebook Community to keep you on tract 
  • Audio and Video Companions to the text to help implement and understand the material easier 
  • Worksheets and exercises to help retain and remember the information quicker 
  • Easy to read text that can be read from start to finish or in bite-sized pieces. 

Here’s an opportunity to help young people find their path and their purpose in life. You can create a positive change in a young person and in our future.  

We have all seen glimmers of potential within our generation and we can make a positive impact on the world by improving the Millennial generation’s awareness and compassion for others.  

Millennial Skills will be the catalyst to improve every other area of life. 

It’s time to support our community. 

Support our generation 

And support YOUR future….  

He’s spent almost the last decade in sales and entrepreneurship, trained thousands of Millennials, created millions in revenue and now wants to help other people achieve the same. 

A note from Hector: 

I’m so excited you’re interested in helping our community. I learned the hard way that I can’t do it all, and I need people like you to help me change the world for the better. I’ve experienced the blessings of so many people and now want to share the gifts I was given with the world. My life changed after I read 50 books in 2014. I decided to finally commit to passion in life. lose a ton of weight and finally move out of my parents. It was a long journey that taught me so many lessons. I learned them the hard way and I want to make that route and a path easier for the people who come after me. 

BONUSES:

  • Get focused, motivated, and more productive by using the Legendary Life Planner.
  • Utilize the exercises, questions, and templates to help you stay on task.
  • Get the Legendary Life Planner FREE with the Digital Pack!

  • Get Megan’s easy-to-read book on how you can improve your health and your life without going through the pain of dieting
  • Learn Megan’s simple seven steps to having having more energy without all the stress
  • Start improving your health TODAY when you get the "Boomer Package”

  • Listen to Brotha James’ motivational music to experience more productivity, positivity and gratitude
  • Experience musical affirmations that center and focus you on what’s most important right now.
  • Wake up and start your day with a greater sense of enthusiasm and optimism for your life.

  • Learn how to maximize your Millennial workforce by understanding the principles in Javier’s book.
  • Understand the Millennial Psyche and get a glimpse how they operate.
  • Start improving the culture and pr of your organization by getting the “Boomer Package."

Most Requested Packages  

 

  • Join our advanced reading team! Get access to the book early and have a check to be on our Book Launch Promotion Team
  • Get the first chapter of the book NOW!  

  • Get  the book when it’s released plus an audio book companion.
  • PLUS+ get our Millennial Motivation Package which includes 5 Millennial Skills Training (career, productivity, health, wealth, relationships)
  • Receive the Digital Legendary Life Planner and take your time management and productivity to the next level
  • Get musical motivation tracks and affirmations from Brotha James to help get you refocused on your goals 

  • Figure out the Millennial Generation! Get everything in the digital package plus receive TWO BOOKS to help you get started. 
  • Receive Millennial Workforce: Cracking the Code to Generation Y to help you get the most out of your Millennial employees
  • and get Start Here: 7 Diet Free Steps to Ultimate Health to start improving your health 

  • Receive EVERYTHING in the DIGITAL and BABY BOOMER package. 
  • Also get a personalized hand-signed copy of the book when it is released

  • Give the gift of mentorship.
  • Spend an hour with Hector, the author, to dive into your life, your career, your finances, health or relationships
  • Great gift for a family member

  • Inspire your class, team, organization, or company  to improve themselves.
  • Increase your teams's productivity, energy, and culture as Hector motivates your people to better themselves personally and professionally.

  • Become THEE company in your space for Millennials.
  • Get promoted  on all our marketing materials, website, as well as a full page tribute to your organization in our book.
  • Help Millennials better themselves and improve your brand in the process.

Why We Need Your Help...

Meet Our Team!

Thanks For All Your Support And Sharing!

story:
Happy to Be Sharing This Journey With You!

Two years ago I started writing about my journey with autism at Gothic Writers' Workshop, followed by five workshops with Ms. Vanessa Martir at Hunter College. I started writing as therapy to try and mend my broken heart upon my son's autism diagnosis. I realized though, that the more I attended these workshops, the more my desire to become a writer grew. As much as I saw it as an impossibility, I kept going back for more. I was intimidated by the level of eduacation most of the students had reached, and struggled with believing that I could do it too. For the past two years I only dreamed about one day attending VONA, but this year was the first time I set my very first goal. My goal... to finally let go of the fear of writing that which has held me a prisoner. That which has led me to lead a depressed life. TO FINALLY WRITE THROUGH THE FEAR AND APPLY TO VONA! I would be so humbled and eternally grateful if you could join me on this journey ;)

 

It's Only a Dream..

 

Only as a child did I dream of writing a book, and never did I imagine that I'd be preparing for my journey to become a published writer of memoir and personal narrative. For sure I never thought I'd be writng about my life though. Growing up I began to keep a diary since the age of 6. I had the Hello Kitty diary with a lock of course. I couldn't risk my brothers reading my personal stuff and telling my mom. Thinking back at the stuff I used to write, I always only wrote about my life. I wrote about the things that made me happy, the things that made me scared, the things I wished for, about one day having a sister because I so desperately needed a companion, someone to talk to. But mostly about the things that made me very sad. I guess I've been destined to write about my life and I didn't even know this until now that I write this.

When I applied to VONA I was scared, nervous, emotional, in ectasy. I was fighting to believe that I could do this. To believe that I was worthy of being accepted. I fought through the emotional journey the writing of the personal narrative I submitted put me through. That same reason why I could never complete this narrative, was the same reason why I needed to finally dig and fight through. I didn't feel like a writer worthy of being given this opportunity, let alone the title of a WRITER. And as much as I wanted to believe I wasn't going to get in, I knew in my heart in the most profound way, that I was getting in. I was calm and without worries for the month it took to hear from VONA, until 2 days before receiving my acceptance letter. On FB, I saw the amount of people from all over the world that had applied. I knew the competition was fierce, and I began to doubt myself. Upon receiving the letter of acceptance, I realized then for the first time that I am worthy.

VONA!

Thank you so much to all who took the time to read my narrative and give me your valuable critiques. To those that follow my FaceBook posts and truly enjoy my writing. Please know that you guys are the reason why I finally decided to make my Blog public. I fed off of your comments. Your request to read more of myself. But most importantly, how I made you feel. The reflections of your own life. The comments telling me how much something I wrote helped you. I will be sharing my journey with you all via my personal blog at carmeninguanzo.tumblr.com. There you will also find my 2nd blog dedicate to my son, Evan. 

The cost of VONA is $1350 and it includes room and board, all meals and the workshop. I does not however, include airfare and transportation. I won't say it will be easy to come up with all of the money, but I am asking for help in raising $1200. I know times are hard these days so please don't think that a donation as small as $5, $10, $15 or $20 is too little. Any amount will definitely help me reach my goal. I trust that I will meet it, only because I am someone that strongly believes in paying it forward! I would also extremely appreciate if you could kindly share my campaign on your page as well. This would be another way to help. Especially if you cannot make a donation.

THANK YOU SO MUCH!!!

I want to thank everyone in advance just for taking the time to read my campaign in its entirety. I am extremely grateful to all of you for believing in me. For giving me the strength to do this and to fall in love with this art more and more each passing day. I am humbled. I am excited to embark on this journey. I am thrilled to be sharing it with you every step of the way! I DID IT GUYS ;)

P.S.  Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools by clicking on EMBED where it says "Share This Campaign" on the top of the page under my picture. When you click on EMBED you will be redirected to the CODE you need to copy and paste on your FB, Blog, or whichever form of social media you use. 

BLESSINGS TO ALL!

story:
About me

Hi, my name is Perie Wolford and I'm a gay author based in Russia. Being a member of LGBT community in Russia is challenging, but thanks to such worldwide platforms like Amazon KDP it has become possible for me to express myself through books and stories that I hope might help others like me.

Project Summary

A good book in the end of a bad day can really make a difference to a kid who is suffering through bullying and oppression from his peers. It happened to me, and hopeful LGBT books like Brent Hartinger's Geography Club (which later was turned into Geography Club movie) have helped me lessen my depression at the time and struggle through teen years with hope and pride. It was a struggle nonetheless but I felt empowered; I felt like I wasn't alone; I felt like I belonged.

On a side note, I was very honored to have Brent Hartinger read my book and give a positive review. He thought it had a similar message of hope he had imprinted in his own book 10 years earlier.

Later in life, in my late twenties, I got the idea to write a book like that, hopeful and encouraging. My screenwriting skills helped me draft a book based on a movie that I hold very dear to my heart: John Hughes'  Sixteen Candles. It's an 80es classic and an example of a perfectly sweet positivity-driven plots that were popular at the time. I replicated some of the elements from the movie in my book, making it nonetheless original and hopefully bringing something new to the table. Samantha from the movie was turned into Sam in my book, a struggling gay teen. And although his struggles are silly, unlike in real life, the message of hope is still there. It does get better if you find the right path and follow it.

After the book's been published in 2014, it was warmly received and kids constantly reached out to me saying it helped them through the day. That's the best praise an author can get, knowing you helped someone, even tangentially, through the power of writing.

What I Need

The book has gathered a bit of attention back in 2014. But the past couple of years the market has been oversaturated with self-publishing new authors. It's become much more difficult to stand out and get noticed. I wish I could afford high-priced promotions, but the truth is, $500 is my monthly paycheck in Russia. I have a dayjob aside from writing, since writing doesn't get me a lot of money. That's why I thought I might ask people who care about the cause help me raise the money.

What I need $500 for:

BookBub is one of the best advertising options for Kindle books. They have a vast mailing list of readers.

  • LGBT category is $90 and a promised exposure to giveaway 4,500 free ebooks.
  • Young Adult category is $115 and a promised exposure to giveaway 18,500 free ebooks.
  • I will put the rest of the money into more ad campaignes to widen the reach even further.

Those are free ebooks that I'm giving away. I won't be making any money on those. That's why I need help covering the costs of advertisement for this project.

You can read the book online here. 

Thank you! Every dollar is appreciated.

story:
Short Summary

 "In Between The Rhymes" is part autobiography, part spoken word version of Jay-Z's "Decoded". There are quite a few things that have been hidden in plain sight in my poems, and it's time to break them down and bring what's in the dark to the light.

Off the heels of "LTV2: The Death & Rebirth of Christopher Owens", which was nominated for Spoken Word Album of the Year, I've decided to start on this project. But anyone that knows me knows I don't do "normal". I was told not to be a full time spoken word artist, I was told a spoken word album couldn't get nationwide recognition...and now I'm being told by some I shouldn't write a book. Let's show them otherwise.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Simply put: I need money to get this book published. I'm not talking about "Look, Mom... I've put some pages together!" I want this to be a professional quality book that you'll be able to pick up at your Barnes & Noble or put on your iPad. To put the book into those formats won't take a lot, but any help I can get would definitely be appreciated! Those who help will be among those who are able to receive the book long before it's released as a token of my gratitude.

The Impact

Reading is more than fundamental; it is ESSENTIAL. Spoken Word has sparked a revitalization of an appreciation of the arts with our youth. Furthermore, this book discusses the up, downs, mistakes & lessons I've learned throughout my life. It is my belief that telling my experiences will allow others to avoid my mistakes and also empower others to follow their dreams.

Other Ways You Can Help

SPREAD THE WORD!!! If you can't contribute monetarily, guess what? You know someone who can!! You just don't know that you know them because you haven't asked them yet or spread the word!

story:
Short Summary

Shadows and Reflections: A tribute to Roger Zelazny
Edited by Trent Zelazny and Warren Lapine

Shadows and Reflections is a tribute to the fiction of Roger Zelazny. We are looking for stories set in any of the various universes that Zelazny created in his short stories and novels, with the exception of the Amber universe. As you probably know, Zelazny’s work covered a very wide range of genre fiction so we are open to most genres. The only limiting factor is that a story must either use one or more of Zelazny’s characters or be expressly set in one of his milieus. Zelazny was one of the most literate and inventive writers that genre fiction has ever known. Your Story submission should reflect that.
Length: up to 10,000 words.
Payment: 5 cents per word for unsolicited stories max $250.00 and 10 cents per word for solicited stories max $500.00 on acceptance. (Note unsolicited subs are contingent upon our hitting our primary Indiegogo goal and may increase to the same amount as the solicited stories if we hit our secondary Indiegogo goal.
Submissions: Stories should be e-mailed to shadowsandreflectionsanthology@yahoo.com

 

Trent Zelazny is a Nightmare Award winning author and the son of Roger  Zelazny. Warren Lapine is the publisher of Wilder Publications and has been nominated for a Hugo Award, a World Fantasy Award, and a Chesley Award.

Roger Zelazny was very important to both Trent and Warren. Trent for obviouse reasons and Warren because it was the work of Roger Zelazny that first made him gravitate towards a career in publishing. With this anthology we are hoping to keep the memory of Roger Zelazny and his wonderful work alive.

 

Trent Zelazny is a Nightmare Award winning author and the son of Roger  Zelazny. Warren Lapine is the publisher of Wilder Publications and has been nominated for a Hugo Award, a World Fantasy Award, and a Chesley Award.

Roger Zelazny was very important to both Trent and Warren. Trent for obviouse reasons and Warren because it was the work of Roger Zelazny that first made him gravitate towards a career in publishing. With this anthology we are hoping to keep the memory of Roger Zelazny and his wonderful work alive.

At first we had considered doing this project as a short anthology featuring stories form Roger’s better known friends. Both Trent and Warren really wanted to let other, lesser known writers who were influenced by Roger participate as well as fans who aren’t writers. That desire lead to this Indiegogo campaign. If we reach our primary goal of $10,000.00 we will open the anthology up to unsolicited submissions. If we reach our secondary goal of $15,000.00 we will pay the unsolicited writers the same rate that we are paying for solicited stories. If we hit our third goal of $20,000.00 the anthology will come out not just in trade paper back and as an e-book, but also in hard cover. So please join us and help celibrate the memory of Roger Zelazny and all the amazing universes he created and get some cool perks.

Even if you can't contrubte you can help by helping us get the word out and sharing the link to our indiegogog page. Thanks Everyone for helping us make this dream happen and for allowing us to let more people in on it.

story:
I am a 3rd year student at University of Greenwich and this book is a part of my final year project. It is a project close to my heart and in many ways is a representations of who I am as an artist. The message of the book is love and it is written with the hope of a brighter future for people of all identities.

Supporting this project helps me be able to print and produce my book, which will be exhibited at the University of Greenwich in June 2019. Every little penny helps me get one step closer to being able to get the book printed. Printing 25 copies will cost me 800GBP, and printing 10 copies will cost me 650 GBP, so give what you can to help me bring this story into the world.

For a  detailed behind the scenes look at the production of the book you can go to www.theajacobsen.com/fmp

If you want to follow me on social media, I am on instagram @illusthea

story:
Was ist die Encyclopaedia Almanica?

Sechs Twitteruser*innen erzählen vom Alltag in der Migrationsgesellschaft, über Freundschaft, Depressionen und Be_hinderungen und verhandeln nebenbei feministische Themen und Rassismus. Dieses Projekt möchte ihre Tweets offline einem breiteren Publikum zugänglich machen.

Ferraeterin, Hrmpfm, Ayesha Khan, Bahar Sheikh, Hengameh Yaghoobifarah und Zugezogenovic verschaffen sich auf Twitter Gehör und manchmal liest es sich, als würden sie twittern, weil sie sonst nicht so frei und offen über bestimmte Themen sprechen können. Als schrieben sie nicht um des Schreibens Willen, sondern um Gedanken abzuschütteln. Humor, Traurigkeit und scharfe Analysen politischer Verhältnisse stehen dicht an dicht. Damit bricht diese Enzyklopädie mit dem, was als klassisches Nachschlagewerk bekannt ist, ist aber mindestens genauso wertvoll.

Ein Vorwort und die Vorstellung der jeweiligen Autor*innen machen die Encyclopaedia Almanica auch für Menschen außerhalb von Twitter zugänglich.

Gestaltet und gelayoutet wurde die Enzyklopädie von Studio Bens.

Wieso dieses Buch?

Twitter sperrt regelmäßig die Accounts von Schwarzen Menschen und Menschen of Colour. Nazis und Menschen, die es nicht so gut meinen mit BIPoCs (Black, Indigenous and People of Colour) sind im Netz sehr gut organisiert und allein eine hohe Anzahl von Meldungen kann zu der Sperrung eines Kontos führen. Das ist natürlich insbesondere für BIPoCs fatal, da ihre Stimmen in der Gesellschaft sowieso kaum Gehör finden. Durch die Sperrungen der Accounts sind wertvolle Inhalte verloren gegangen, die wir in der Enzyklopädie wieder einfangen und archivieren. Alle Accounts sind der Herausgeberin durch ihren Witz, ihre Klugheit und ihren Scharfsinn aufgefallen. Die Encyclopaedia Almanica soll unterhalten, zum Nachdenken und Austausch anregen.

Was, wenn ich nicht spenden kann?

Wir freuen uns über die Bekanntmachung unseres Projekts und des Spendenaufrufs auf allen Plattformen.

Als schrieben sie nicht um des Schreibens Willen, sondern um Gedanken abzuschütteln. Humor, Traurigkeit und scharfe Analysen politischer Verhältnisse stehen dicht an dicht. Damit bricht diese Enzyklopädie mit dem, was als klassisches Nachschlagewerk bekannt ist, ist aber mindestens genauso wertvoll.
Ein Vorwort und die Vorstellung der jeweiligen Autor*innen machen die Encyclopaedia Almanica auch für Menschen außerhalb von Twitter zugänglich.
Gestaltet und gelayoutet wurde die Enzyklopädie von Studio Bens.


Wieso dieses Buch?
Twitter sperrt regelmäßig die Accounts von Schwarzen Menschen und Menschen of Colour. Nazis und Menschen, die es nicht so gut meinen mit BIPoCs (Black, Indigenous and People of Colour) sind im Netz sehr gut organisiert und allein eine hohe Anzahl von Meldungen kann zu der Sperrung eines Kontos führen. Das ist natürlich insbesondere für BIPoCs fatal, da ihre Stimmen in der Gesellschaft sowieso kaum Gehör finden. Durch die Sperrungen der Accounts sind wertvolle Inhalte verloren gegangen, die wir in der Enzyklopädie wieder einfangen und archivieren. Alle Accounts sind der Herausgeberin durch ihren Witz, ihre Klugheit und ihren Scharfsinn aufgefallen. Die Encyclopaedia Almanica soll unterhalten, zum Nachdenken und Austausch anregen.

Was, wenn ich nicht spenden kann?
Wir freuen uns über die Bekanntmachung unseres Projekts und des Spendenaufrufs auf allen Plattformen.

story:
Hey there

I'm Rhett Hildebrandt and I have never grown up. 

I watch cartoons and wear dinosaur t-shirts to work (I have a nice collection going). When I was 3 or 4, I wrote my first book. It was about, you guessed it, a dinosaur. Go figure. And I have been doodling and coming up with stories ever since. 

I have always wanted to publish a children's book. I've had tons of ideas for them but I figured for my first book, I should go with something I know about. Sleep and advertising. I work as an art director at a big ad agency in Chicago and my wife is a professional sleeper (among other things).  Parents are constantly trying new ways to get their kids to sleep, so I decided to make a book that follows a guy trying to pitch the idea of sleep as if he were trying to pitch an advertising concept. 

Selling Sleep allowed me to explore many different media of illustrations from vector, to photo-manipulation to 3d rendered. It was a blast to do. 

Here are some sample pages!


It would mean a lot if you could support my work and pre-order a book. I'll be able to do more projects in the future if this does well!

What do you get out of this?

I just need a couple of bucks to get the book off the ground. It's 100% written, it just needs your help to get out there!

The perks:

  • $1-9: An email containing a personalized doodle just for you. (just let me know what you want...and I'll do it, if it's not too complicated)
  • $10: A signed copy of Selling Sleep (paperback)
  • $20: A poster version (16x20) of any of the pages.
  • $30: One copy of Selling Sleep AND a poster version (16x20) of any of the pages.
  • $31+ Selling Sleep, a poster and my undying love

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't have any moneys to donate, just share this page! You can also sign this mailing list: http://goo.gl/forms/eh8AHegAqB and I'll let you know when Selling Sleep is available on other distribution channels as well as availability of other projects I'm working on.


Thank you!!! RAWR! Now go to sleep

story:
Menü is an academic response to the current phenomena of food, an artistic reply to the rise of far-right extremism, and a critical reevaluation of the idea of an "authentic" cuisine. Completed for the fulfillment of a bachelor’s degree in Global Liberal Studies, it is a synthesis of my unique self-designed course of study in food anthropology and media. And ultimately, Menü was the result of a longstanding curiosity of the meal and notions of self–inspired by my own relationship to food and the experiences I have had growing up in Seattle and then living in New York City and Berlin.

The final product is a 100 page magazine that uses essays, photography, interviews and data visualization to explore the complexity of Berlin’s cultural and culinary identity. Asking the question, how does food function as a system of narrative in the context of today’s political and social realities?

All contributions will go towards final production steps of this magazine project, including printing, binding and the shipment of copies.

story:
My Book

My name is Audrey O’Neill and I am the author of Unveiled.

In this book, you will discover a part of yourself that has been veiled behind the demanding and scrutinizing nature of a perfectionistic society. My book celebrates vulnerability and raw emotions. Ultimately, I want you to see Unveiled as a tool to help you live fearlessly and understand that it's okay to ask for help - we're all connected through imperfection.

In this book, you'll learn about transforming regret into forgiveness and the art of letting go.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get


This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
 

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2019
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this [season of year]


When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now.
 

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

 

About the Author


Audrey O'Neill studied English at The College of the Holy Cross where she was a proud member of the Sigma Tau Honor Society. Audrey believes that the 'small things' in life are actually life's most important takeaways. She loves taking walks, spending quality time with friends and family, playing the piano, and journaling. Audrey aspires to enter the health care field and is passionate about helping others.

Audrey is aware of how mental illness can ruthlessly steal everything away from you. She believes that her words and her experiences can help save a life and provide someone with the inspiration they need to reach out for help.

Audrey is incredibly passionate about wellness and mental health.  She is determined to fight her battle for a beautiful life and her one wish is to help you do the same.

For more information you can connect with Audrey at asonei19@g.holycross.edu, or connect with her on Instagram @audreyoneill_

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers you think would enjoy it!!

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Audrey O’Neill
