story:
BOOK STATUS:

(As of April 2)

Standard-size puzzles: 91

TEN MORE standard-size puzzles at: $1000

DOUBLE-SIZE puzzles: 9

A standard-size puzzle becomes DOUBLE-SIZE: EACH STRETCH PERK!

Executive Summary (tl;dr):

In a world where a championship puzzle-maker without job or car tries to make ends meet, he offers the world a puzzle book series revealing every secret trick he knows to solve them, and this is the first book in that series, based on one of the most popular pure-logic competition puzzle types - the loop puzzle. Don't know what those are? NO PROBLEM! I'll walk you through every step of the way, giving you the knowledge to join the masters. Already a master? NO PROBLEM! With at least 100 hand-crafted, learning-focused puzzles, you'll have plenty of practice! Book will be provided as a .PDF file only. Perks include a sampler of other puzzle types, puzzle commissions, and the first-ever STRETCH PERK - each one makes the book bigger!

Who? What? Why?

My name is Adam R. Wood, and I am a puzzlesmith. You may know me by my handle - The Zotmeister - and actually know me primarily as a gamer, specifically one that doesn't drink, smoke, or do drugs, or perhaps you've encountered my character in that one indie game or that one card game, but I am just as passionate and active in the puzzle community as I am in the gaming community, if not even more so. Nine years ago, I pioneered the online puzzle journal, spawning numerous imitators homages, and I've contributed to the national championships for the last seven years.

In all that time, I've never made an actual puzzle book. The opportunity never arose. With your help, that changes now. However, this is not the typical "here's a bunch of puzzles, now give me my money" sort of book I see all too often. Over the years, I've built quite the mental toolbox of techniques and tricks for crafting and solving all sorts of logic-based puzzles, and I won't be content simply spitting out stumpers and sitting back. I want to make the sort of puzzle book that is perhaps rarest of all: the sort that actually teaches how to solve puzzles.

Hence, the Puzzle Primer Series. With each volume dedicated to all the ins-and-outs of a specific genre, you'll get an unprecedented insider's view of what makes puzzles tick. If you're an absolute beginner, perhaps fascinated by them but have no idea how to begin to approach them, I'll walk you through it step by step. If you're a competitive tournament solver, my puzzles will offer detailed practice for specific situations, and my techniques may streamline your process and reduce your times. If you're anywhere in between, you'll have a lot of fun, you'll hopefully learn some neat things, and by the end you should be ready for whatever's out there.

Oh, and did I mention every single puzzle it contains will be composed by hand? Because they totally will be. There's little art in computer-generated puzzles, and besides, I'll be tailoring each and every puzzle in this book to be as instructive as possible. A well-designed puzzle speaks to the solver; my intent is to make what they say crystal clear, each one adding to the foundation for future puzzles.

For this first volume, I'm tackling what is by far the most popular style of puzzle from my journal: the loop puzzle. I was the first to unify the genre, so I'm uniquely qualified to explore in detail the inner workings of not just Slitherlink but also Masyu, Yajilin and other loop-puzzle types, and especially how they can interact in hybrid puzzles - something rarely seen outside of competitions, but that will definitely be covered in my book!

What's a loop puzzle? What's Slitherlink?

Remember doing connect-the-dots when you were a kid? Loop puzzles are the logic-based puzzle version of that. There's (usually) no discernible figure in the result [and let's face it, you probably knew you were drawing an elephant or somesuch all along], but other than that, the principle is pretty similar: you have an array of dots - usually in a nice, neat grid here - and are given clues regarding how they are to be connected into a single closed loop. These dots aren't numbered - in fact, most loop puzzles don't actually use every dot in their loop. Figuring out which dots to use, and how, is all part of the puzzle. Here's a sample before-and-after (the book will have MUCH better graphics):

Slitherlink, specifically, is the most popular and by far the most common style of loop puzzle: all the clues are numbers inside the cells (between the dots) of the grid. Even though those digits are limited to just '0', '1', '2', and '3', the depth of the logic in Slitherlink puzzles can be astounding. Other styles of loop puzzles can involve gaps in the grid (sometimes with larger numbers in them!) and/or special types of dots that must be used, often in specific ways. No matter what's thrown at you, however, there's always only one way that a single loop can be formed that adheres to all the clues. Knowing how the clues interact with each other is typically the main means of solving, but the very nature of a loop itself is often key!

What's going to be in this book?

Let me say this straight away: this is not going to be just a collection of puzzles. There will be text. This will be an actual book. Don't worry, though - it won't read like a textbook. It will be informal while still being thorough, getting through just enough exposition to get you from one puzzle to the next. For the curious, there will also be information about the history of the puzzles, some math facts regarding the puzzles, and other trivia.

The meat-and-potatoes of the book, however, is of course the puzzles themselves. They will lead you through the entire process of mastery, starting with puzzles based on basic loop logic, then introducing more complex clue types - and hidden patterns within them! - one at a time. The accompanying text and diagrams - like the one below - will point out what to look for, clearly defining all sorts of solving elements: short circuits, corners, power towers, parity breaks, and those pesky entry-and-exit rules, to name a few. As you solve, you'll eventually find yourself automatically thinking things like "can't bounce off that dented two" and "that trick never works" and before you realize it, you'll be an expert.

There's absolutely no way anything less than a hundred puzzles will suffice for this book. Slitherlink alone is deep enough to cover half that! I will be alternating between Slitherlink and other styles of loop puzzles so as to keep the difficulty curve smooth throughout the book. At the end will be hybrid puzzles, putting everything you'll have learned together - along with some final techniques the hybridization itself brings to bear! - into a unified challenge. When you're done, you'll know everything I know about loop puzzles, and hopefully will find it to be the most satisfying puzzle book you've ever worked through.

What is this book going to be, exactly?

Okay, so here's the deal: I agree that there's no substitute for having a printed puzzle book in your hands, pushing a pencil across the page... but I can't help but feel that such would be getting ahead of myself. As I'm typing this pitch, I really have no clue what the market for an uncommon book like this really is, beyond a core group that have been aching for something like this for, like, ages. So that's why I'm taking this in phases - planning multiple volumes, working on one at a time, and cutting out as many middlemen as feasible in the meantime. Hopefully, somewhere down the line, these will be sufficiently popular that getting a publisher for a traditional physical book can be made to happen, or at least I could try crowdfunding such a thing with much less risk. But for now, the book will be created as, and provided as, purely a .PDF document.

Think about that for a moment, though. No shipping! As soon as it's done, it's in your inbox, with no further hassle at my end or tension at yours. If there are any errors discovered in the book - if you know my puzzle pedigree, you'll know this is extremely unlikely, but if it somehow happens anyway - I can fix them and have an updated version sent to you promptly. And it saves paper! You'll likely only want to print the puzzles themselves, not the textual portions - and the book will be formatted to facilitate this - so that'll be fewer trees pulped and ink sprayed. Or perhaps you have a smartphone that can read .PDF files as an ebook [N.B.: you're on your own for this, I can't even begin to offer smartphone support].

The best part of this, though, is the simple fact that you'll get the book in your possession without paying anyone other than me: your funds will go directly to supporting me and making this book the best I can for what I raise.

As mentioned earlier, the book will have at least one hundred loop puzzles; each will be at least a ten-by-ten grid (eleven-by-eleven counting the dots). Some may be larger out of need or as a stretch perk [see below for details on that little innovation!]; the overall puzzle count can increase with stretch goals, but rest assured I've given myself plenty of time to meet my deadline even if we find this campaign rolling in dough.

What's in it for me?

THE PERKS

SHOW ME THE FORTY

A little backstory: on my thirtieth birthday, I gave my journal followers a gift - a whopper of a hybrid loop puzzle over a 29-by-29 grid (30-by-30 going by the dots rather than the cells). It's here if you want to see it, but it's not for the faint of heart (you may want to finish my book first!). It proved very popular (and inspirational for some), so I made a 35-dot-by-35-dot followup... six years later. Yes, a year late, but that's something I intend to make up for. On Earth Day, 2015, I'll put on my journal a 40-dot-by-40-dot behemoth... a year early.

But pledge me a lowly dollar and I'll show it to you a full year earlier than that! If you want to support my project but either have little to spare [trust me, I know the feeling] or figure I can't possibly teach you anything you don't already know about loop puzzles (and that may even be true for some of you, but not many) and just want something truly staggering to tackle, then this humble (if large) option is for you.

This perk will be delivered to its backers on Earth Day, 2014, regardless of any other perks they may have coming.

FRESH DOZEN

Don't like loop puzzles? I have an option for that as well: how does a sampler of a dozen of my original puzzle types sound? Yes? Pretty? Hm? Two each of Island Oases (note the plural, it's new and improved!), Totally Rooked, Smullyanic Dynasty, Pokerum (a simplified Heartbreaker), Astral Wayfarer (I just renamed Seeking Syren), and some Sudoku variant I'm keeping secret for now... All puzzles will have grids of size 10-by-10 or larger. Yes, even the Sudoku. These puzzles will only be available to backers for at least a year - they will never be put on my journal or any other website before then, and they won't be any cheaper than the three bucks I'm asking for them now. Pinky swear. 

This perk will be delivered to its backers by the end of April, 2014, regardless of any other perks they may have coming. This is a month before the book is due, so if you'd like to add this in with a book order, it'll give you something to whet your appetite. In fact, I'll sweeten that deal even further: get the book and the sampler, and I'll show you the forty for free! The option you're looking for up there on the right for this is "ALL THE PUZZLES".

LUCKY THIRTEEN

Two, two, two perks in one! Thirteen puzzles, four dollars. Not sure why anyone wouldn't just add a buck and get the book proper, but I'm nothing if not thorough.

THE BOOK

Why we're here! I can't help but feel I'm offering an awful lot of value here for only five dollars - it's at least a hundred hand-made puzzles - but I really want there to be no unnecessary obstacles. After the campaign, I'll likely sell it for $5.99 - you're saving money getting it now!

My deadline to complete and deliver the book is the end of May, 2014. That's aggressive, but I've nothing better to do with my time right now, and even if some stretch goals are hit I foresee no issues making that date. If bad things happen, well, the nice thing about digital distribution is that it's trivial to provide updates, but I don't suspect that will be necessary.

ALL THE LOOPINESS

Simple addition. You get the book and the "40" puzzle for $5 + $1 = $6. Math is convenient.

ALL THE PUZZLES

Now we're talking. As mentioned before, back the book and the sampler, and I'll throw in the "40" for no extra cost. That will get you every (public) puzzle I have on offer here for eight dollars.

THE STRETCH PERK (!!)

So I had this brainstorm. What could I possibly offer someone who's willing to spend more than eight dollars on me (I should be so lucky) without sending anything physical or committing myself to some additional projects when I'm trying to get a book done? And then it hit me: the excitement and satisfaction of being the one to meet a stretch goal! After all, I'm not likely to hit stretch goals with just sub-ten-dollar pledges anyhow (unless I'm luckier than I'm certain I am, or so I figure).

Introducing: the stretch perk! Back this perk (or any more expensive one) and congrats, we just hit a stretch goal! Each individual pledge at this level meets its own stretch goal. For twenty-five USD, I will - in addition to giving you "ALL THE PUZZLES" - take one of the ten-by-ten puzzles in my book and double its size to ten-by-twenty. For everybody. It'll be a permanent upgrade to the book. You'll be a hero to us all. And everyone who reads the book will know you're that hero, because - if you wish - I will credit you for that heroism right in the book, right next to the puzzle I've double-sized in your honor! This is the only means I'm offering of getting credited in the book - it's not like anyone reads through those massive backer lists most crowdfunded projects generate anyhow, hidden in the back of the book or the sides of the box or somesuch. Your name (or handle or whatever, as long as it's family-friendly), if you want it there, will be right in the thick of it where it will be seen. So... can I pencil you in to make history and be a backer to the original stretch perk?

...TO CALL YOUR OWN

I figured, while we're here and all, if someone wanted to commission me to make a puzzle, why not give them the chance and let everyone benefit? So for $50 - that's $25 over THE STRETCH PERK - you get that perk (natch) and a puzzle made by hand by me for you, with an eternal license to use it for any non-illegal, non-defamatory purpose you so desire just as long as anywhere you put that puzzle you put the proper credit for its creator with it. That's it. Publish it in a magazine or a book of your own - just give me a byline - and make a profit out of it. Incorporate it into a work of art or a computer game (or something that's both) and sell it - it's yours to wield. The puzzle itself may be any style of logic-based, grid-based puzzle that appears on my journal or, indeed, most anyone else's (though some types are clearly beyond me); I would encourage you if you're interested in this to contact me directly with what you have in mind before pledging at this level. I don't want to leave anyone disappointed. All reasonable requests will be attempted to the best of my ability. Want the givens to be in a certain pattern, perhaps spelling out something? Should be easy! Do that all the time. Want it easy? hard? moderate? Your call.

The only other restriction is the puzzle's size. I'm limiting it to 11 cells in each of its two dimensions at the maximum. ...Unless you'd like to pay for more. For a $100 pledge, I'll up that limit to 21 cells. Nearly double in each direction - you're getting an extra cell per dollar (beyond the stretch perk)!

Any puzzles either of these perks engender will be delivered by the end of June, 2014. The book comes first, you understand. As you're working through the book - that will be delivered in May - I'll be working through any commissions.

THE SHIRT OFF MY BACK [SOLD OUT!]

I couldn't resist making this a perk. I mean the name quite literally. I doubt anyone will go for it, but for fun I decided to put this out there. As I mentioned at the beginning of this pitch, I'm kind of geek-famous for several lines I had in a certain videogame documentary. In most of my scenes, I'm wearing a t-shirt depicting a VCS joystick and captioned "REPRESENT."; when my likeness was used in the pair of crowdfunded projects I linked above [I miss discretionary income], my depicters replicated the shirt in my images. I still have that shirt, and I'd continued to wear it until fairly recently. You see, it's developed some holes, including a rather awkward one right in the front (along the white part in the center of the joystick). If you have skill stitching and hopes of wearing it (please don't tell me), I forget if it's an L or XL - the tag's faded to translucence.

I have no idea what it might actually be worth to a movie prop collector, but if you're willing to find out, well, $250 is my price. The stretch perk is included in that, natch. I'll also make up and hand-sign a certificate to verify its authenticity. If you'd like, I could also sign the back of the shirt itself, or even write one of my quotes on it if you wish, or you could just take it as is.

Photos can be provided on request.

This is one of only two physical items I'm offering; if you want this, I'll need a shipping address. If it's outside the United States (hey, I'm big in England), I'll need an extra $6 added to your pledge, and a friendly reminder: handling customs at your end is your responsibility. I will ship via the United States Postal Service, insured.

MY KINGDOM FOR YOUR PLEDGE

I am a man of little money but many treasures. One of those treasures is a complete, unplayed set of English-language Portal Three Kingdoms cards for that collectible card game. I lucked out on that one: I acquired it before the cards became Eternal-format tournament legal and their price skyrocketed. The largest online retailer for the game would, as of this writing, be charging more for this than I am, and they don't even have one in stock! Besides, all you could hope to get from them is near-mint-condition cards. Mine are unplayed.

Why would I offer such a thing? I'll tell you: this perk is - I can't resist the pun, I'm very sorry - the magic bullet. The way I see it, it's win-win-win: the purchaser gets the cards for less than retail, I sell them for more than a retailer would pay me, and everyone backing this campaign benefits from three stretch goals completed in one fell swoop!

So if you have three thousand United States dollars to spend and want an Imperial Seal for a Vintage deck and/or plan to build the most enviable Commander deck ever ("Suck Horsemanship, evildoers!"), let's do business.

Photos can be provided on request.

This is one of only two physical items I'm offering; if you want this, I'll need a shipping address. If it's outside the United States, I'll need an extra $10 added to your pledge, and a friendly reminder: handling customs at your end is your responsibility. I will ship via the United States Postal Service, insured.

It's entirely possible someone with no interest in this project will catch wind of this and want to secure this perk for the investment alone. Please help get the word out!

You do have stretch goals, right?

It wouldn't be much of a crowdfunding campaign without them, would it? I'm starting very simple: for each of the first five thousand dollars that get pledged, I'm adding ten puzzles to the book's minimum quota. If we hit four digits, the book will be at least 110 puzzles; at two grand, it'll be 120+ puzzles, and so on, capping at 150 puzzles for five thousand dollars. If by some miracle I pass that threshold, I'll try to think of something, but at that point I wouldn't be able to increase the scope of the book any further. I'll most likely start looking forward to the second volume of the Puzzle Primer Series should that occur! And don't forget the stretch perk - up to 127 puzzles could be doubled in size!

What's in it for you?

...Someone's still reading this? Really? Well, then, in that case, I'll lay it to you straight. I could say that having my own puzzle book has been a personal dream of mine since my age was a single digit. I could even add that the success of this campaign would be a grand personal justification of how much time and energy I've devoted to this passion of mine that most would dismiss as a hobby. And both of those would be absolutely true. But if I'm to be completely honest, my current situation is more dire. At this point, I have been unemployed for nearly ten straight months. My two previous jobs were both with Navy contractors, the first of which spectacularly imploded (its former CEO is in prison...) and the second unable to keep me on due to the sequestration. No one is offering to hire me, my benefits have expired, and the extensions haven't been turned back on by Congress. I'm, bluntly, up that proverbial creek without a paddle. This project is literally the only potential source of income I have going at the moment.

And if that weren't enough, I have also recently lost use of my vehicle, putting me further up that creek without even the canoe.

I realize this sort of desperate situation is not the ideal environment in which someone should be relying on a crowdfunding campaign. However, what else am I going to do with myself? I'm tired of not creating anything. I'm tired of my status being judged by a single (now negative) number that was apparently beyond my control to increase. I'm hoping that there are people out there that can appreciate my talent and help me out of this quagmire, help me realize my dreams, and help me help others in spreading the love of puzzles. And I'm sincerely hoping that you are among them. I cannot overstate how much it would mean to me. I am at your mercy; I would rather be at your service.

Personal Privacy Policy: I will not share any personal information (such as email or physical addresses) provided to me through this campaign with ANY third party not necessary for agreed-upon transactions (such as the U.S. Postal Service for physical mailings) for ANY purpose, barring a court order. I'm using Indiegogo for this campaign because I've been spammed multiple times at that "other crowdfunding site"; I will NOT do that to anyone else, ever.

Disclaimer: third-party entities linked to in this pitch are not affiliated with this campaign, and no endorsement should be assumed.
story_txt:
BOOK STATUS:
(As of April 2)
Standard-size puzzles: 91
TEN MORE standard-size puzzles at: $1000
DOUBLE-SIZE puzzles: 9
A standard-size puzzle becomes DOUBLE-SIZE: EACH STRETCH PERK!
Executive Summary (tl;dr):
In a world where a championship puzzle-maker without job or car tries to make ends meet, he offers the world a puzzle book series revealing every secret trick he knows to solve them, and this is the first book in that series, based on one of the most popular pure-logic competition puzzle types - the loop puzzle. Don't know what those are? NO PROBLEM! I'll walk you through every step of the way, giving you the knowledge to join the masters. Already a master? NO PROBLEM! With at least 100 hand-crafted, learning-focused puzzles, you'll have plenty of practice! Book will be provided as a .PDF file only. Perks include a sampler of other puzzle types, puzzle commissions, and the first-ever STRETCH PERK - each one makes the book bigger!
Who? What? Why?My name is Adam R. Wood, and I am a puzzlesmith. You may know me by my handle - The Zotmeister - and actually know me primarily as a gamer, specifically one that doesn't drink, smoke, or do drugs, or perhaps you've encountered my character in that one indie game or that one card game,  but I am just as passionate and active in the puzzle community as I am in the gaming community, if not even more so. Nine years ago, I pioneered the online puzzle journal, spawning numerous imitators homages, and I've contributed to the national championships for the last seven years.In all that time, I've never made an actual puzzle book. The opportunity never arose. With your help, that changes now. However, this is not the typical "here's a bunch of puzzles, now give me my money" sort of book I see all too often. Over the years, I've built quite the mental toolbox of techniques and tricks for crafting and solving all sorts of logic-based puzzles, and I won't be content simply spitting out stumpers and sitting back. I want to make the sort of puzzle book that is perhaps rarest of all: the sort that actually teaches how to solve puzzles.Hence, the Puzzle Primer Series. With each volume dedicated to all the ins-and-outs of a specific genre, you'll get an unprecedented insider's view of what makes puzzles tick. If you're an absolute beginner, perhaps fascinated by them but have no idea how to begin to approach them, I'll walk you through it step by step. If you're a competitive tournament solver, my puzzles will offer detailed practice for specific situations, and my techniques may streamline your process and reduce your times. If you're anywhere in between, you'll have a lot of fun, you'll hopefully learn some neat things, and by the end you should be ready for whatever's out there.Oh, and did I mention every single puzzle it contains will be composed by hand? Because they totally will be. There's little art in computer-generated puzzles, and besides, I'll be tailoring each and every puzzle in this book to be as instructive as possible. A well-designed puzzle speaks to the solver; my intent is to make what they say crystal clear, each one adding to the foundation for future puzzles.For this first volume, I'm tackling what is by far the most popular style of puzzle from my journal: the loop puzzle. I was the first to unify the genre, so I'm uniquely qualified to explore in detail the inner workings of not just Slitherlink but also Masyu, Yajilin and other loop-puzzle types, and especially how they can interact in hybrid puzzles - something rarely seen outside of competitions, but that will definitely be covered in my book!
What's a loop puzzle? What's Slitherlink?Remember doing connect-the-dots when you were a kid? Loop puzzles are the logic-based puzzle version of that. There's (usually) no discernible figure in the result [and let's face it, you probably knew you were drawing an elephant or somesuch all along], but other than that, the principle is pretty similar: you have an array of dots - usually in a nice, neat grid here - and are given clues regarding how they are to be connected into a single closed loop. These dots aren't numbered - in fact, most loop puzzles don't actually use every dot in their loop. Figuring out which dots to use, and how, is all part of the puzzle. Here's a sample before-and-after (the book will have MUCH better graphics):
Slitherlink, specifically, is the most popular and by far the most common style of loop puzzle: all the clues are numbers inside the cells (between the dots) of the grid. Even though those digits are limited to just '0', '1', '2', and '3', the depth of the logic in Slitherlink puzzles can be astounding. Other styles of loop puzzles can involve gaps in the grid (sometimes with larger numbers in them!) and/or special types of dots that must be used, often in specific ways. No matter what's thrown at you, however, there's always only one way that a single loop can be formed that adheres to all the clues. Knowing how the clues interact with each other is typically the main means of solving, but the very nature of a loop itself is often key!What's going to be in this book?Let me say this straight away: this is not going to be just a collection of puzzles. There will be text. This will be an actual book. Don't worry, though - it won't read like a textbook. It will be informal while still being thorough, getting through just enough exposition to get you from one puzzle to the next. For the curious, there will also be information about the history of the puzzles, some math facts regarding the puzzles, and other trivia.The meat-and-potatoes of the book, however, is of course the puzzles themselves. They will lead you through the entire process of mastery, starting with puzzles based on basic loop logic, then introducing more complex clue types - and hidden patterns within them! - one at a time. The accompanying text and diagrams - like the one below - will point out what to look for, clearly defining all sorts of solving elements: short circuits, corners, power towers, parity breaks, and those pesky entry-and-exit rules, to name a few. As you solve, you'll eventually find yourself automatically thinking things like "can't bounce off that dented two" and "that trick never works" and before you realize it, you'll be an expert.
There's absolutely no way anything less than a hundred puzzles will suffice for this book. Slitherlink alone is deep enough to cover half that! I will be alternating between Slitherlink and other styles of loop puzzles so as to keep the difficulty curve smooth throughout the book. At the end will be hybrid puzzles, putting everything you'll have learned together - along with some final techniques the hybridization itself brings to bear! - into a unified challenge. When you're done, you'll know everything I know about loop puzzles, and hopefully will find it to be the most satisfying puzzle book you've ever worked through.
What is this book going to be, exactly?
Okay, so here's the deal: I agree that there's no substitute for having a printed puzzle book in your hands, pushing a pencil across the page... but I can't help but feel that such would be getting ahead of myself. As I'm typing this pitch, I really have no clue what the market for an uncommon book like this really is, beyond a core group that have been aching for something like this for, like, ages. So that's why I'm taking this in phases - planning multiple volumes, working on one at a time, and cutting out as many middlemen as feasible in the meantime. Hopefully, somewhere down the line, these will be sufficiently popular that getting a publisher for a traditional physical book can be made to happen, or at least I could try crowdfunding such a thing with much less risk. But for now, the book will be created as, and provided as, purely a .PDF document.Think about that for a moment, though. No shipping! As soon as it's done, it's in your inbox, with no further hassle at my end or tension at yours. If there are any errors discovered in the book - if you know my puzzle pedigree, you'll know this is extremely unlikely, but if it somehow happens anyway - I can fix them and have an updated version sent to you promptly. And it saves paper! You'll likely only want to print the puzzles themselves, not the textual portions - and the book will be formatted to facilitate this - so that'll be fewer trees pulped and ink sprayed. Or perhaps you have a smartphone that can read .PDF files as an ebook [N.B.: you're on your own for this, I can't even begin to offer smartphone support].The best part of this, though, is the simple fact that you'll get the book in your possession without paying anyone other than me: your funds will go directly to supporting me and making this book the best I can for what I raise.As mentioned earlier, the book will have at least one hundred loop puzzles; each will be at least a ten-by-ten grid (eleven-by-eleven counting the dots). Some may be larger out of need or as a stretch perk [see below for details on that little innovation!]; the overall puzzle count can increase with stretch goals, but rest assured I've given myself plenty of time to meet my deadline even if we find this campaign rolling in dough.What's in it for me?THE PERKSSHOW ME THE FORTYA little backstory: on my thirtieth birthday, I gave my journal followers a gift - a whopper of a hybrid loop puzzle over a 29-by-29 grid (30-by-30 going by the dots rather than the cells). It's here if you want to see it, but it's not for the faint of heart (you may want to finish my book first!). It proved very popular (and inspirational for some), so I made a 35-dot-by-35-dot followup... six years later. Yes, a year late, but that's something I intend to make up for. On Earth Day, 2015, I'll put on my journal a 40-dot-by-40-dot behemoth... a year early.But pledge me a lowly dollar and I'll show it to you a full year earlier than that! If you want to support my project but either have little to spare [trust me, I know the feeling] or figure I can't possibly teach you anything you don't already know about loop puzzles (and that may even be true for some of you, but not many) and just want something truly staggering to tackle, then this humble (if large) option is for you.This perk will be delivered to its backers on Earth Day, 2014, regardless of any other perks they may have coming.FRESH DOZENDon't like loop puzzles? I have an option for that as well: how does a sampler of a dozen of my original puzzle types sound? Yes? Pretty? Hm? Two each of Island Oases (note the plural, it's new and improved!), Totally Rooked, Smullyanic Dynasty, Pokerum (a simplified Heartbreaker), Astral Wayfarer (I just renamed Seeking Syren), and some Sudoku variant I'm keeping secret for now... All puzzles will have grids of size 10-by-10 or larger. Yes, even the Sudoku. These puzzles will only be available to backers for at least a year - they will never be put on my journal or any other website before then, and they won't be any cheaper than the three bucks I'm asking for them now. Pinky swear. This perk will be delivered to its backers by the end of April, 2014, regardless of any other perks they may have coming. This is a month before the book is due, so if you'd like to add this in with a book order, it'll give you something to whet your appetite. In fact, I'll sweeten that deal even further: get the book and the sampler, and I'll show you the forty for free! The option you're looking for up there on the right for this is "ALL THE PUZZLES".LUCKY THIRTEENTwo, two, two perks in one! Thirteen puzzles, four dollars. Not sure why anyone wouldn't just add a buck and get the book proper, but I'm nothing if not thorough.THE BOOKWhy we're here! I can't help but feel I'm offering an awful lot of value here for only five dollars - it's at least a hundred hand-made puzzles - but I really want there to be no unnecessary obstacles. After the campaign, I'll likely sell it for $5.99 - you're saving money getting it now!My deadline to complete and deliver the book is the end of May, 2014. That's aggressive, but I've nothing better to do with my time right now, and even if some stretch goals are hit I foresee no issues making that date. If bad things happen, well, the nice thing about digital distribution is that it's trivial to provide updates, but I don't suspect that will be necessary.ALL THE LOOPINESSSimple addition. You get the book and the "40" puzzle for $5 + $1 = $6. Math is convenient.ALL THE PUZZLESNow we're talking. As mentioned before, back the book and the sampler, and I'll throw in the "40" for no extra cost. That will get you every (public) puzzle I have on offer here for eight dollars.THE STRETCH PERK (!!)So I had this brainstorm. What could I possibly offer someone who's willing to spend more than eight dollars on me (I should be so lucky) without sending anything physical or committing myself to some additional projects when I'm trying to get a book done? And then it hit me: the excitement and satisfaction of being the one to meet a stretch goal! After all, I'm not likely to hit stretch goals with just sub-ten-dollar pledges anyhow (unless I'm luckier than I'm certain I am, or so I figure).Introducing: the stretch perk! Back this perk (or any more expensive one) and congrats, we just hit a stretch goal! Each individual pledge at this level meets its own stretch goal. For twenty-five USD, I will - in addition to giving you "ALL THE PUZZLES" - take one of the ten-by-ten puzzles in my book and double its size to ten-by-twenty. For everybody. It'll be a permanent upgrade to the book. You'll be a hero to us all. And everyone who reads the book will know you're that hero, because - if you wish - I will credit you for that heroism right in the book, right next to the puzzle I've double-sized in your honor! This is the only means I'm offering of getting credited in the book - it's not like anyone reads through those massive backer lists most crowdfunded projects generate anyhow, hidden in the back of the book or the sides of the box or somesuch. Your name (or handle or whatever, as long as it's family-friendly), if you want it there, will be right in the thick of it where it will be seen. So... can I pencil you in to make history and be a backer to the original stretch perk?...TO CALL YOUR OWNI figured, while we're here and all, if someone wanted to commission me to make a puzzle, why not give them the chance and let everyone benefit? So for $50 - that's $25 over THE STRETCH PERK - you get that perk (natch) and a puzzle made by hand by me for you, with an eternal license to use it for any non-illegal, non-defamatory purpose you so desire just as long as anywhere you put that puzzle you put the proper credit for its creator with it. That's it. Publish it in a magazine or a book of your own - just give me a byline - and make a profit out of it. Incorporate it into a work of art or a computer game (or something that's both) and sell it - it's yours to wield. The puzzle itself may be any style of logic-based, grid-based puzzle that appears on my journal or, indeed, most anyone else's (though some types are clearly beyond me); I would encourage you if you're interested in this to contact me directly with what you have in mind before pledging at this level. I don't want to leave anyone disappointed. All reasonable requests will be attempted to the best of my ability. Want the givens to be in a certain pattern, perhaps spelling out something? Should be easy! Do that all the time. Want it easy? hard? moderate? Your call.The only other restriction is the puzzle's size. I'm limiting it to 11 cells in each of its two dimensions at the maximum. ...Unless you'd like to pay for more. For a $100 pledge, I'll up that limit to 21 cells. Nearly double in each direction - you're getting an extra cell per dollar (beyond the stretch perk)!Any puzzles either of these perks engender will be delivered by the end of June, 2014. The book comes first, you understand. As you're working through the book - that will be delivered in May - I'll be working through any commissions.THE SHIRT OFF MY BACK [SOLD OUT!]I couldn't resist making this a perk. I mean the name quite literally. I doubt anyone will go for it, but for fun I decided to put this out there. As I mentioned at the beginning of this pitch, I'm kind of geek-famous for several lines I had in a certain videogame documentary. In most of my scenes, I'm wearing a t-shirt depicting a VCS joystick and captioned "REPRESENT."; when my likeness was used in the pair of crowdfunded projects I linked above [I miss discretionary income], my depicters replicated the shirt in my images. I still have that shirt, and I'd continued to wear it until fairly recently. You see, it's developed some holes, including a rather awkward one right in the front (along the white part in the center of the joystick). If you have skill stitching and hopes of wearing it (please don't tell me), I forget if it's an L or XL - the tag's faded to translucence.I have no idea what it might actually be worth to a movie prop collector, but if you're willing to find out, well, $250 is my price. The stretch perk is included in that, natch. I'll also make up and hand-sign a certificate to verify its authenticity. If you'd like, I could also sign the back of the shirt itself, or even write one of my quotes on it if you wish, or you could just take it as is.Photos can be provided on request.This is one of only two physical items I'm offering; if you want this, I'll need a shipping address. If it's outside the United States (hey, I'm big in England), I'll need an extra $6 added to your pledge, and a friendly reminder: handling customs at your end is your responsibility. I will ship via the United States Postal Service, insured.MY KINGDOM FOR YOUR PLEDGEI am a man of little money but many treasures. One of those treasures is a complete, unplayed set of English-language Portal Three Kingdoms cards for that collectible card game. I lucked out on that one: I acquired it before the cards became Eternal-format tournament legal and their price skyrocketed. The largest online retailer for the game would, as of this writing, be charging more for this than I am, and they don't even have one in stock! Besides, all you could hope to get from them is near-mint-condition cards. Mine are unplayed.Why would I offer such a thing? I'll tell you: this perk is - I can't resist the pun, I'm very sorry - the magic bullet. The way I see it, it's win-win-win: the purchaser gets the cards for less than retail, I sell them for more than a retailer would pay me, and everyone backing this campaign benefits from three stretch goals completed in one fell swoop!So if you have three thousand United States dollars to spend and want an Imperial Seal for a Vintage deck and/or plan to build the most enviable Commander deck ever ("Suck Horsemanship, evildoers!"), let's do business.Photos can be provided on request.This is one of only two physical items I'm offering; if you want this, I'll need a shipping address. If it's outside the United States, I'll need an extra $10 added to your pledge, and a friendly reminder: handling customs at your end is your responsibility. I will ship via the United States Postal Service, insured.It's entirely possible someone with no interest in this project will catch wind of this and want to secure this perk for the investment alone. Please help get the word out!You do have stretch goals, right?It wouldn't be much of a crowdfunding campaign without them, would it? I'm starting very simple: for each of the first five thousand dollars that get pledged, I'm adding ten puzzles to the book's minimum quota. If we hit four digits, the book will be at least 110 puzzles; at two grand, it'll be 120+ puzzles, and so on, capping at 150 puzzles for five thousand dollars. If by some miracle I pass that threshold, I'll try to think of something, but at that point I wouldn't be able to increase the scope of the book any further. I'll most likely start looking forward to the second volume of the Puzzle Primer Series should that occur! And don't forget the stretch perk - up to 127 puzzles could be doubled in size!What's in it for you?
...Someone's still reading this? Really? Well, then, in that case, I'll lay it to you straight. I could say that having my own puzzle book has been a personal dream of mine since my age was a single digit. I could even add that the success of this campaign would be a grand personal justification of how much time and energy I've devoted to this passion of mine that most would dismiss as a hobby. And both of those would be absolutely true. But if I'm to be completely honest, my current situation is more dire. At this point, I have been unemployed for nearly ten straight months. My two previous jobs were both with Navy contractors, the first of which spectacularly imploded (its former CEO is in prison...) and the second unable to keep me on due to the sequestration. No one is offering to hire me, my benefits have expired, and the extensions haven't been turned back on by Congress. I'm, bluntly, up that proverbial creek without a paddle. This project is literally the only potential source of income I have going at the moment.And if that weren't enough, I have also recently lost use of my vehicle, putting me further up that creek without even the canoe.I realize this sort of desperate situation is not the ideal environment in which someone should be relying on a crowdfunding campaign. However, what else am I going to do with myself? I'm tired of not creating anything. I'm tired of my status being judged by a single (now negative) number that was apparently beyond my control to increase. I'm hoping that there are people out there that can appreciate my talent and help me out of this quagmire, help me realize my dreams, and help me help others in spreading the love of puzzles. And I'm sincerely hoping that you are among them. I cannot overstate how much it would mean to me. I am at your mercy; I would rather be at your service.Personal Privacy Policy: I will not share any personal information (such as email or physical addresses) provided to me through this campaign with ANY third party not necessary for agreed-upon transactions (such as the U.S. Postal Service for physical mailings) for ANY purpose, barring a court order. I'm using Indiegogo for this campaign because I've been spammed multiple times at that "other crowdfunding site"; I will NOT do that to anyone else, ever.

Disclaimer: third-party entities linked to in this pitch are not affiliated with this campaign, and no endorsement should be assumed.

story:
The Writer's Passion

It has always been my passion to inspire excellence in young people. In 2001, I was given the opportunity to do just that with hundreds of inner-city youth in the city of Philadelphia. Working with young people, I was able to understand the needs that, having grown up in the inner-city myself, I thought I knew. I was able to see the potential of young people from my community from a different, more experienced perspective. I was also able to understand the needs differently as well. I then had my first child, my daughter, and I truly realized how great my passion was. Not only did I want to inspire young people; I wanted to empower young people to be excellent and help them build an environment that is excellent for them and their future- a future that my children will be a part of.

But what did that mean? Children are exposed to a plethora of ideas, experiences, realities and fantasies. There are many stories in all sorts of mediums (books, television, etc.) that help guide our young. However, much of the stories that influence our youth lack a message that relates to their history. And if we are unaware of our history, we are unsure of our future.

And while my passion is, in deed, to inspire excellence is young people; my ultimate goal is to connect our youth to their future with a strong foundation- pride in their history.  

 

The Story

Although The Poor Man and His Princess is a fictional tale, it is a story that illustrates a setting, a message and an aspect of history, that our young people seldom learn about in today's stories. Set in West Africa several hundred years ago, The Poor Man and His Princess exposes the reader to a time and place of royalty of many sorts. The characters in this story display characteristics found across the wide spectrum of royalty- from humility to pride; from sadness to joy. The setting of The Poor Man and His Princess is one of true history- "when kingdoms were still growing... Just west of the rice fields and north of the okra."  

Many of our young people today learn about "the Disney princess," and royalty in magical fantasy worlds that they find difficult relating to. The Poor Man and His Princess exposes our young people to characters so real and relevant to our history that the readers may not only feel a connection to them, they may even find it possible to have descended from them.

The Poor Man and His Princess is a story that can inspire young people to be great no matter the environment from which they are. It is a tale unconditional love, growth, connection and home.

 

What is Needed & What You Get

We live in a time when publishing for such stories is quite difficult due to many unfortunate realities within media today. Therefore, I am requesting the support of my community to help bring this tale to our youth through your donations.

Much time and money has already been devoted to this small project already. Still, in order for this story to be impactful; and in order for there to be real exposure that can be meaningful and fruitful, many more resources are needed. Designing, printing, legal filing, publishing, marketing and distribution still needs funding. And the community's help is needed.

There are perks to your contributions. Donating to this project can get you credited in the final published book. If you have a business of your own, you may also have your business marketed in the final published work (for example: if you are an artist or entrepreneur, your work or business may be mentioned in the credit section of the book). Large contributions may get you a free copy of The Poor Man and His Princess, plus special credit. Please see the perks section of this campaign for further details.

As mentioned, funds will go to the publication, marketing and distribution of The Poor Man and His Princess. Funds will also help the creation of more stories and other meaningful resources for our young people. Many more stories have been created. The Poor Man and His Princess has been chosen to be the first, to set the stage for the other creations waiting to serve as inspiration for the community. 

Your support is greatly appreciated. 

  

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people may just not be able to contribute, but that doesn’t mean they cannot help:

  • Sharing the information about me, our goals and The Poor Man and His Princess is very helpful.
  • Like and share our up and coming Facebook page.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • If you are an artist, ask how you may contribute to this and future projects.
  • Feedback is also very helpful.
  • And MORAL SUPPORT is always appreciated

THANK YOU!

THANK YOU!

story:
Campaign Update
WOW - We have surpassed $8,000! Thank you to everyone who has supported my journey. 

All future pre-orders will receive a free bookmark set as well as 3 art prints inspired by space (images attached above). 

To pay it forward, 50% of all contributions above the $8,000 goal will be donated to a COVID-19 mental health crisis relief, specifically the International OCD Foundation. Many studies have shown that the COVID-19 pandemic is relentlessly exacerbating our mental health, particularly for patients with illnesses such as Obsessive Compulsive Disorder that are vulnerable to high stress, anxiety, and lack of control.

Even though we only have around 40 hours left in the campaign, I will continue to work hard to raise funds for my first book and also support those struggling during the COVID-19 pandemic. 

Story of My Book

Into the Unknown: Human Curiosity, Politics, and Prejudice in the True Space Age is about how we can stay curious, connected, and educated as humanity enters the new “True Space Age” in the upcoming years. 

My name is Ellena Hyeji Joo and I am the author of Into the Unknown. I wrote this book for my brother, who is a high school student interested in space, aliens, and pretty much all the popular franchises set in space. As our daily conversations on space, aliens, and the upcoming milestones in humanity grew, I realized that this is a critical topic! What will we do in the face of so much unknown as we enter space? Do we understand space? Do we understand who we are in the universe?

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover what it means for you to be part of one species dedicated to exploring its meaning beyond our planet, solar system, or even our galaxy. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for space. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you feel excited for the True Space Age and feel equipped with the challenges and information that come hand-in-hand with our entering space. 

In this book, you’ll learn about space, aliens, and humanity. You’ll hear stories such as...

  • Why we are attracted to the idea of aliens as creatures that will come invade our planet
  • What it means for us that federal agencies like NASA (with political motives) are leading space exploration projects and the politics behind space exploration
  • What it means that space exploration is becoming increasingly privatized and how companies like SpaceX and Blue Origin are benefiting and undermining technological advancements in space
  • How we can protect our sense of wonder when it comes to space

 

You will love this book if you enjoy the Marvel Universe, Star Wars, Star Trek, and any movies set in space with aliens, but you have also always been attracted to understanding why we gravitate towards these movies and are inclined to explore the questions such movies raise.

Into the Unknown: Human Curiosity, Politics, and Prejudice in the True Space Age is a nonfiction book that speaks to the ordinary person curious about space, young space entrepreneurs, and space enthusiasts who want to look at the meaning of “aliens” and “space” in a new way.

 

The Book - Into the Unknown: Human Curiosity, Politics, and Prejudice in the True Space Age

The book is written in 3 parts. 

Part 1 contains the introduction and chapters 1 - 4. It explores “how we got here,” including our brief history of aliens, alienation, why we are afraid of all things aliens or ‘unknown’ or ‘spacey’ and why these questions are critical to answer and discuss right now. 

Part 2 contains chapters 5-7. This section explores principles of positive alien engagement and for “aliens” on Earth as well.

Part 3 contains chapters 8-11. This section explores how to live a curious, and open-minded life to prepare for the True Space Age. It goes over controversial topics, such as "Why is America turning space American?"; and how can we stay realistic but hopeful and optimistic for upcoming discoveries?


What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April, 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The translation for my book to publish a version that my parents and friends in South Korea can read.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Spring of 2021.

 

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will be invited to "moonshot" workshops I host on how to use space as a "space" for curiosity, imagination and connection!
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

 

About the Author

Ellena Hyeji Joo is a senior at Georgetown University, School of Foreign Service. She is majoring in International Politics and minoring in Journalism. 

Ellena wrote this book because she is passionate about answering bigger, deeper questions whose answers may be key to protecting our future, values, and evolving our humanity to stay focused on what really matters. Ellena hopes to leave an impact in young adults who seek a career that requires curiosity, creativity, and thinking outside the box (or even outside of the planet). She is curious about how difficult conversations can change the world, such as why it is difficult to stay actively curious and optimistic in the space age. 

Ellena loves spending time with her family, especially her younger brother, who loves to introduce her to new series on space (there are so many!) and guide her through the messy, but wonderful thoughts a person can have surrounding the topics of space and aliens. She loves reading, writing, and chasing dogs and cats in her neighborhood even though she knows she is deathly allergic to them (the animals also seem allergic to her over enthusiasm). 

For more information, you can connect with Ellena Hyeji Joo at hj231@georgetown.edu or at @ellenajoo_writes on instagram.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #IntotheUnknown and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

 

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Ellena Hyeji Joo

story:
Story of My Book

Everyday Impact is exploring the concept of social impact. This book dives into how different people from various industries and walks of life create positive change in the communities around them in their own way. It places a unique emphasis on, what I like to call, the concept of “Everyday Impact”; how one small action can have a ripple effect. This book looks into how small actions, when done consistently over time, can create a compounding effect that leads to an even greater impact in the future. 

My name is Erin Feng and I am the author of Everyday Impact. I wrote this book because there is much misconception around what social impact truly is. In an age of big businesses and millionaires, it’s easy to feel like our individual contributions are negligent in comparison to big corporations dishing out billions in donations to fight climate change and other social issues. It can be disheartening. I want to bring the conversation back to the everyday people, like you and me, who have an abundance of potential to create an impact beyond our initial beliefs. 

In reading this book, my hope is that you will discover the potential and power within yourself to make a difference in the society around you. I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for social impact and personal development. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you go above-and-beyond the status quo and find meaningful purpose in working for the betterment of people outside of yourself.

In this book, you'll learn about three principles which I call the “3 I's of Meaningful Change.” These fundamental principles are key traits of today's change-makers. I also share the ideas of applying them to your own life. You'll hear stories such as...

  • The journey of Muhammad Yunus and how he used $27 to redefine the banking industry and create an entirely new field of Microfinance. 
  • The interesting concept of “purpose over profit” will be explored through the purposeful redemption story of Scott Harrison who went from nightclub promoter to the founder of the renowned organization charity, Water.
  • Finally, we’ll see the magical concept of the “golden ticket” in action through the story of a successful magician, Claude Haggerty, and how a $10 magic show ticket inspired him down a path of impact and meaning, using magic to raise over $4 million for charity. 

You will love this book if you are on a quest for personal development and have the desire to leave a lasting legacy you can be proud of. 


Everyday Impact is a nonfiction book that speaks to driven youth and open-minded adults who want to look at social impact and personal success in a new way.

 

The Book - Everyday Impact

The book is written in five parts:

Part 1 contains the Introduction and Chapter One: “A Brief History of Social Impact” and Chapter Two: “Why Now?” This preliminary section is more technical, containing detailed overviews of the history of social impact and the impact revolution as we know it today. Pulling research from reputable sources, you will see how CSR went from an unknown term to a social norm. You will also learn how some of the world’s greatest changemakers like Muhammad Yunus started from humble beginnings and went on to redefine industries. These chapters set up the foundation and tone for the ensuing text.  

Part 2 contains Chapters Three: “From Hardships to Inspiration“ and Chapter Four: ”Purpose over Profit“. Here we begin diving into the first principle of “Everyday Impact” known as the Inspiration section. These two chapters will speak to familiar topics such as the influence of one’s past on present behaviors, as well as, the ubiquitous idea of purpose over profit. What you’ll find is that these chapters are very “real”; they’re not afraid to define hardships. They tell the stories of real people who have overcome intense but relatable challenges. 

Part 3 contains Chapter Five: “Community Impact”, Chapter Six: “Power of Kindness”, Chapter Seven: “Everyday Advocacy”, Chapter Eight: “Corporate Giving & the Power of Business”, and Chapter Nine: Young Impact“. Like the “Impact” section of this book, we dive into the specific stories of people from all walks of life, from chiropractors to students to entrepreneurs, and how they have created a positive impact in their own way. Not only will you be moved by these individuals, but imbued within their stories of impact are the insights and personal lessons they learned throughout their journey to enhance their own contributions. 

Part 4 contains Chapter Ten: “Taking a Leap of Faith” and Chapter Eleven: “Challenging the Conventional”. In this section, we explore the final principle of “Innovation,” and how community change-makers have innovated to augment their impact and leave a legacy. You’ll hear stories of everyday people who have done extraordinary things, from a life development coach who used the lesson of “leaps of faith” to develop a new effective and unique approach to serve his clients, to a physiotherapist going above-and-beyond to help her clients during COVID-19.

Part 5 contains Chapter Twelve: “Putting it All Together” and the Conclusion. This final section will summarize the teachings shared from the previous sections and show how to truly drive Everyday Impact. You’ll hear the story of Claude Haggerty, a renowned magician who raised over $4 million for charity. You will also learn how he implemented each of the 3 I’s of Meaningful Change throughout his life of impact and meaning

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
 

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April, 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish spring 2021.
     

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.
 

  • I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

 

About the Author

Erin Feng is a driven student, young leader, and passionate changemaker with the goal of making a positive difference in society. From a young age, her character and ambitions showed a maturity beyond her years as she took to tasks with heart and vigor. Erin excels in servant leadership and possesses extensive experience in working with purpose-driven projects and organizations. As a full-time student at the University of Pennsylvania and community leader, Erin seeks to continuously find ways to serve and better those around her.

Erin’s passion for social impact began with a desire to bridge her fervor for business with her altruistic personality. As a Gen Z individual, she could relate to being disheartened by the contributions of big corporations and the wealthy elite. Through her experience in community service and networking, Erin was inspired by the people who served as mentors to her. She realized that there was potential in anyone to create a difference in the world even if it’s simply in their own backyard. Motivated, Erin was curious about the ways that different people from all walks of life could generate impact in their own unique ways and embarked on a journey to find the similarities changemakers possess on how they create a difference. Through her experiences and interviews, Erin hopes to empower everyone to go above-and-beyond in ways outside of themselves to create a difference in the world. 

As a young freshman at Wharton, Erin finds immense joy in hanging out with her friends and getting boba to treat her bubble tea addiction. She prides herself in her ability to play the “holy trinity of Asian instruments” - the violin, piano, and the flute - and enjoys framing her best friends in chill games of Among Us. 

For more information, you can connect with Erin Feng at erinfeng676@gmail.com and at @erinfeng_author on Instagram.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. Please use #EverydayImpact and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Erin Feng

Through her experiences and interviews, Erin hopes to empower everyone to go above-and-beyond in ways outside of themselves to create a difference in the world. As a young freshman at Wharton, Erin finds immense joy in hanging out with her friends and getting boba to treat her bubble tea addiction. She prides herself in her ability to play the “holy trinity of Asian instruments” - the violin, piano, and the flute - and enjoys framing her best friends in chill games of Among Us. For more information, you can connect with Erin Feng at erinfeng676@gmail.com and at @erinfeng_author on Instagram. 

Risks & Challenges
The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 
Other Ways You Can HelpSome people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. Please use #EverydayImpact and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.
You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.Thank you so much for all of your love and support!Thanks again,Erin Feng

story:
Who I Am and Who You Are

I'm Thomas Goss. Welcome to my Indiegogo page! If you're viewing this campaign, it means that you're interested in orchestration. More than that, you're passionate about it. You know that as a composer or arranger, the orchestra provides the most liberating, inspirational canvas for your creativity.

I feel the same exact way. As a professional composer, I've made orchestration the main focus of my career, composing and arranging many hours of orchestral music for film, dance, theater, and the concert stage. I know how the finer details can be so fascinating, so revealing, opening up many new possibilities of color and texture. 

It's the kind of pursuit that's long needed its own interactive network in which orchestrators can help each other to grow through support, feedback, and sharing of resources. That's why I created the internet community Orchestration Online, bringing thousands of composers at all levels of experience together on Facebook, YouTube, and Twitter. I've been watching you develop, interact, and reach out for information and perspective. This is your book as much as it is mine. And I want it on your screens next year.


Why You Need This Book

Orchestration manuals tell you the basics: the varieties, characteristics, techniques, and ranges of orchestral instruments; how they're generally used; and some useful samples to study.

What really makes an orchestral score come alive? Imagination backed up by confidence and practical knowledge. What do the musicians know, and how does that affect how they perform your music? What are the consequences of using certain approaches? How do instruments and sections relate to one another?

What's needed is a book that reflects the perspective and experience of working orchestrators, showing how they think and why they make certain choices.


What Kind of a Book and When

I plan to launch "100 Orchestration Tips" as an e-book, published in a full-screen format. It will be e-mailed directly to supporters of this campaign, whose minimum donation will grant them a copy. I plan to release the book by March 15, 2015.

After this campaign closes, I will shift sales over to an internet store on the main Orchestration Online website. The book will then be sold from that location. But if we gain enough momentum by its initial release, it may prove to be a book that could cross to the print world. If it does, so will the credibility and reputation of this community.


An update above about how our campaign is going, with more information about the "5 Orchestral Textures" perk


What You'll Find in "100 Orchestration Tips"

Mostly, it will be the kind of information you don't find in an orchestration manual:

  • An introduction discussing the evolution of the orchestration process, how modern orchestrators work, and how to increase your speed and efficiency to make more time for the tools of the imagination.
  • 100 detailed tips on orchestration, with many illustrations showing the advice in action. Some of these tips will be adapted and expanded from those already available on the Orchestration Online website. Others will be completely new, rounding out the information to cover all main sections of the orchestra.
  • An added section of 30 commonly asked questions, to take a lot of the guesswork out of the many challenges faced by professional orchestrators and composer.

Have a look at some sample orchestration tips above in video format...


Why I'm Crowdfunding This Book

I want this book to go out directly to as many readers as possible. The campaign target above reflects not so much the money needed to launch this book, as much as what it represents in terms of readers. If I knew that at least 500 composers and orchestrators out there were gaining new valuable insights and building their approaches to the sprawling craft of orchestration, I would call that a launch. In the end, raising the level of understanding in our entire field only helps the music to become ever more potent as we all become stronger artists.

What's more, here's an opportunity for us to show the established world of publishing that we are a strong community, worthy of their respect. The more direct support a project like this receives, the greater the awareness will build across many other communities. Let's make it clear to them all that a book like this has readers who are committed to a subject that is like no other in interest, appeal, and variety.


    How I'll Use Your Funds

    These days, I'm finding my time taken up more and more by orchestration projects from all over the world, with clients from many countries like Canada, India, Russia, and the United States. I love this job, but it has its challenges, forcing me to prioritize work as it's offered, and carefully schedule projects over the course of a year. The funding level I've requested above will help me to set aside a solid block of time - say 4 to 6 weeks - during which I can commit nearly all of my available time to completing this text on behalf of my readers. It will also help me to maintain and improve many of the assets I use to benefit my fellow orchestrators, like equipment, software, and expenses related to maintaining and managing our community's presence on the internet.



    My orchestration for composer Dmitry Rybnikov's score to "The Magic Tower."


    The Bottom Line

    After all that I've said above about this launch, what it really boils down to is that I'm offering a reasonably priced book, with information you're going to find helpful. Sure, I've offered some additional perks, and I recommend checking them out. I'd love to show you a preview of some larger-scale training I'll be offering next year, include your questions and suggestions in the book, and even mentor a few of you directly. That would be an honor. But "100 Orchestration Tips" is going to be great fun to write for you all, and I can't wait to hear how you put the information to use in your own music.


    Warmest regards and thanks, Thomas Goss

story:
Ever wanted to write the Great American Novel? 

The story of 13 year-old Jude spoke to me.  She lives in a 1970's household full of violence and alcohol.  How will she save herself and her sisters?  A gripping story of one young girl attempting to escape her cruel stepfather and her mother, who may just have given up.  This book is about the violence we witness, love, death, and redemption.

Excerpt from Pieces of Mother:
"Jude put their loot in the flowered basket at the front of her bike and they were off! She pedaled very carefully around the church, as everyone was spilling out of church and filling the street, and went home to find the car gone. She went into the house with Beth, scuttled downstairs to the finished basement, and made a fort with chairs and sleeping bags. She threw all the couch pillows into the hole she made, and put in her tape recorder, the candy and drinks, and crawled in. Beth crawled in after her. Jude put in her Barry Manilow tape. They stayed in there the rest of the afternoon. 
‘Til they heard the door slam"
Since I am self-publishing, I will need the money for my ISBN number, books to sell, table and event fees for selling, gas and toll $ for traveling to independent bookstores, conventions, and book fairs.  Thank you!
To see more of my work, including the non-fiction book, She's So Bipolar at Amazon:      http://www.amazon.com/Shes-So-Bipolar-Veronica-...

story:
THE STORY

In the cold, hidden, dark world of Antiope, Adan, Syria and Noah along with 35 other billions people live aggregate in huge colonies under the crustal plate of the Earth. They can leave those underground megalopolis only to work as slaves in the fields of corn and soybeans, which cover overall the planet. Reduced just to meta-data, humans drag their miserable existence subjugated by the Supreme Singularity...

HERE'S WHAT I'LL BE USING YOUR CONTRIBUTION FOR:

THE AUTHOR

SLIDESHARE PRESENTATION
OF HUMAN DOMESTICATION
THE BOOKS I HAVE WRITTEN ON EVOLUTIONARY NUTRITION
EVODIET 4 EVER will soon be translated into English. For sixteen years, this theme has been the main subject of my attention

FLORENCE, MAY 2013 SYMPOSIUM "IL CIBO DELL'UOMO"
Prof. Giovanni Gasbarrini, Gastroenterologist
