story:
Short Summary

This is an invitation to take part in cool new scifi project. Money is not needed since the project will go even if the campaign collects $0, I'm hoping to get feedback and ideas if this story sparks your interest. I can fund the campaign and will do so myself, this is more of an invitation to take part in any capacity you feel comfortable in. 

This story takes place in a Pan-Galactic Union speed actress half a trillion galaxies through the universe. 

The Union and it’s Capital Planet are vast. Corruption and attacks on the freedom happen. One day in the year 5973 on the Nets an idea was born. Why don’t millions of programmers come together and create an AI (Artificial Intelligence) watchdog. Public servants have no privacy so why not start with them watch over their spending and expose corruption. The watchdog can fight crime. Expose deceptions and trade manipulations and scam artists and expose them. 

Millions of programmers loved the idea, and they started a wast open source project like no other before. The intelligence which was going to be set loose on the Universe was named Volan Putnik! Self sufficient and self governing and ever inquisitive and learning. 

The programers also gave Volan a blog where to report his status and to make sure the Union or any of the States and Territories couldn’t shut his blog down they made it distributed across millions of computers. 

So Volan Putnik was born. This story is about his birth and the first case Volan tackled.

What We Need & What You Get

  • DESIGN: Design is important both the cover and blog. 
  • MARKETING: Editing is needed and might have to use a better editor.
  • EDITING:  I’m also looking to do some better marketing, like getting listings, marketing blasts of the story to established lists and so on. 

Depending on how much is contributed I’ll look for the based way to put it to good use. 

Why is a small sci-fi story like this important and what can it do? 

Some people don’t think storytelling is important. I think storytelling and science fiction is important to people like me and there are millions of us. It’s a way to explore how our world could be, and how we can live and improve our relationships. 

This story is just a stepping stone to help me learn to write. I don’t have a college degree and I was born in a small village in a small communist county (Serbia) and my story is about things I have seen, but I want to tell it in a  big novel when I build up my confidence. I'm hopping this series is a start and Volan will play a part.  

I’m hoping you can help and more immortally join me on the journey. There is a huge twist down the road explaining how the Universe was created and humidity and what our purpose it. This book is step #1 in that direction. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • PUBLICITY: If you know podcasts, radio, tv, newspapers etc.. where this can get some exposure it will help a great deal. 
  • SOCIAL MEDIA: If you have a social media following and can post this campaign that will help a great deal. 
  • EMIAL LIST: If you have an email list where  you can send this campaign info to, that will be a great help as well.
  • TEAM MEMBERS-ADVISERS. I'm new to science fiction and if you are interested in joining the teach in any role you see fit, let me know.

I want to thank you and will keep you posted on the progress. 

Where is this project ultimately going?

This first book will be a first stepping stone. My gran idea is to tell a story of how and why the Universe came about to be and how it can be organized and what can happen if things go wrong. My original idea was to make Volan an ex congressman who becomes a travel blogger and goes to interesting planets throughout the Union, but I realized it will be hard to create conflict with this approach, and then one day the idea came to me why not use an all powerful artificial intelligence which can go almost anywhere and do all kinds of things. I could have them zap throughout the billions of planets and engage in all kinds of conflict and resolve some of that and it would give me a great way to describe what life is like in this vast country in preparation for what I really want to tell ultimately when the people of the great Union make an amazing discovery. With the Birth of Volan i can set the stage for that great discovery.

Sincerely, 

Slobodan (Dan) Stojadinovic
<Slobodan="The one who is free">

story:
【中文在后面】

Set in the raw Hellish throes of the Liberian Civil War, following the introduction of a shoe-shine boy who is confronted by the invasion of his town, the novel fast forwards a decade to the war’s 2003 historical climax.

With the capital and President Charles Taylor besieged from an array of triumphant rebel forces all lusting for further spoils, only six days remain until Taylor’s US, UN and Nigerian-brokered resign-and-depart-into-exile deadline.

Accordingly, the tension is skyrocketing - will Taylor go voluntarily or will there be a bloodbath?  Will there be a bloodbath anyway?

Meanwhile, an obscure rebel group deep in the interior (at a place called ‘The Crossing’) unexpectedly seeks, under UN auspices, to disarm.

Requiring expatriate monitors, but with most foreigners already evacuated, the resultant ragtag group of six consists of: a UN professional; a doctor & spy; a boilermaker businessman; an economist; a nurse; and, an adventurer (Jake).

Although, on account of mateship, consenting to participate, aware their destination is the scene of his secret ten-year-previous humiliation, Jake is terrified – terrified of what happened last time and terrified of what his instincts tell him is awaiting them this time.

Meanwhile, convinced their fate hinges on him understanding his fascination with warzones, short of time and amidst the new journey, layer-by-layer, he exhumes his rich yet traumatic past….


Admirers of The Heart of Darkness (the inspiration for the Apocalypse Now movie) and/or Zen & the Art of Motorcycle Maintenance may be particularly attracted to this book.

Every $100 contribution (and multiple) will receive an autographed numbered copy of the book.

If you can't contribute but would like to help then perhaps you can refer others to this site. The Indiegogo share tools are great for this.

Thank you.


Chapter 1 – Jonathan

“Shoe-shine I can do, so let me do it for you” Jonathan sing-song sang in shy pretence as, rising from a squat, his ungainly 7-year-old gait, emaciated limbs, bare chiseled feet and sheen of dirt and sweat gave the impression he’d just been borne of the earth.

However, failing to attract his target, slumping back down, he reached for his plastic bottle of creek water and, as was his obsession, tipped a little on his hands.

“You must keep your hand clean,” his teacher grandfather had lectured, only partially evading the use of clipped Liberian English, “and, especially before eating, wash between the finger!”

Yet, of the three predominant threats – disease, war wounds and malnutrition – it was the latter that currently occupied the boy’s thoughts.

Can this week we buy the meat, Jonathan wondered hoping there would be something to add to the vegetables and fruit his family variously grew and scavenged?

With his home a rudimentary single-roomed rectangular wooden-walled hut with an amalgamation of wood and iron pieces for a roof, a transparent plastic sheet for a window and a curtain for a door, Jonathan lived with his mother (Joy), two elder sisters (Annabelle and Blessing), Annabelle’s infant son (Deloitte) and Annabelle’s husband (Johnson).

At night, although sleeping in close proximity to the others (except for Johnson who, employed at the rubber plantation to ‘milk’ sap, started early, finished late and typically slept where he stopped), upon lying down, the next thing Jonathan was usually conscious of were the lights and sounds of the morning.

Nevertheless, the previous evening, the boy had been roused by Blessing’s murmurings.

Straining upright from his sleeping position on the wooden floor, drawing his knees into his chest and arm-locking them in; the boy’s gaze had been drawn to the dim wisps of moonlight wandering through four closely netted cracks in the hut’s side.

‘The night light’ be so brave, Jonathan observed feeling his usual camaraderie with the moon; even of the dark it not afraid!  Yes, other than our loving Lord Jesus, must not the Moon God be the greatest of all spirit?

Attracted by the sound of a faint moan squeezing from Blessing’s lips, gazing upon his sister’s ever-so-faintly illuminated face, the boy caught a glimpse of moisture glinting from the corner of one of her eyes.

Unless you the baby, he noted, there no purpose to crying – no thing to be gained for the effort lost.

With her eyelids parting to reveal slivers of partially eclipsed moons, which mirrored light from the great hanging rock itself, though at first assuming she’d awoken, he quickly realized she was battling foes from ‘the other world’.

Poor Blessing, Jonathan thought; what in your sleep so often make your eye trickle and your face shake?

Believing her dreams wouldn't end until she defeated the enemies within them, silently wishing her victorious, he watched as, tossing-and-turning in-and-out of the moon’s silver rays, the shifting light and shadows seemed to suggest forces of good and evil were alternatively controlling her.

What you dream of, Jonathan bleakly questioned again?  Is it ‘the great journey’ of our family? 

More than seven years previous, while Jonathan was still in his mother’s womb, their village had been attacked and his father and two brothers never heard of again. 

With the rest of the family escaping, walking for days through the jungle-clad mountains, they’d finally arrived in his mother’s hometown of Harrington, where, reuniting with Jonathan’s grandfather and aunts, they’d made their new home.

Since his mother and Annabelle refused to speak of the journey, Jonathan had learnt most about it from Blessing – snippets from her memory and, especially, her illustrations, which were the result, years earlier, of a foreign lady coming to her Sunday School class and encouraging them to sketch what they’d witnessed and what had happened to them during the war.

“The drawing felt hard but good,” Blessing had told him, “like lemon and sugar together.”

Lying back down on the hut’s wooden floor, dozing, Jonathan’s thoughts had drifted to the ‘bad children’.

--------------------------------------

如果你相信，就像很多电影里的陈词滥调一样，你有一个秘密方法可以帮助世界，那么你会怎么做？可以实现想法的一个关键，就是针对战争的源头采取行动来避免这种在意识控制下发生的战争，可以先发制人地系统地来大规模减少全球的痛苦。

如果你认为解释你的想法的最好办法就是把它们写进一本小说，但是，这将需要你不断地重温并深入到你自己在战区的那些最糟糕的经历里，那么你会怎么做？

如果你开始写了，却像所有人一样，受到变化莫测的生活的打击，比当初所预期的，你需要花更多时间和精力，那么你会怎么做？

如果随着时间的推移，你内心的斗争也越来越剧烈，也许别人是对的，你真的是疯了，不过，你又相信每推迟一天完成你的书，就可能增加成千上万的痛苦的人，那么你会怎么做？

如果你放弃自己的事业，并愿意承受债务，以完成这本书。现在你到了这样一个地步，没有能力阻止债务的增长，却还需要另外10个月全天写书，那么你会怎么做？

因此，在已经花费数年时间投入到这本书，并且看到你所有可怕的预测成真（最近有一个七岁悉尼出生的孩子自豪地抓着一个人的头发把他被砍掉的脑袋拎在手里微笑着看着你），如果你还需要一万八千美元来支付以后每月债务的利息和维持生存才能完成这本书，那么你会怎么做？

在所有的这些情况下，你会怎么办？

好吧，尽管最初的想法是凭借我自己的力量去完成它，但是到最后我已无能为力，就像你看到的这样，我所做的就是转向Indiegogo和人群资金。

你好 - 我的名字是Paul Ross，我的小说的标题是《你好白人》。

早在上世纪九十年代，当时东帝汶仍然是印度尼西亚的一部分，在圣克鲁斯大屠杀的一个星期内，我走过那里，我了解到了一些第一手的情况。然后，我想要做一些对人类有意义的事情，我结束了在伊拉克和利比里亚的战争区作为人道主义援助人员的工作和生活，那个时候，利比里亚是世界上最贫穷的国家，故事发生在利比里亚。

关于小说的情节，请参阅这个网站故事的部分。

首先介绍了一个擦鞋童，在地狱般痛苦的利比里亚内战区域，他生活的镇遭到入侵。接着，小说快进十年到2003年战争历史上的高潮时期。

总统查尔斯·泰勒在首都被叛军围困，只能坚持6天，直到泰勒的美国联合国和尼日利亚做的流亡报告最后期限到来的那天。

因此，紧张不安的气氛暴涨。威尔·泰勒自愿离开还是会有大屠杀？究竟会不会有大屠杀呢？

与此同时，一个隐藏在地下（在一个叫“隧道”的地方）的不起眼的反叛组织竟出人意料地寻求在联合国支持下解除武装。

需要外籍人员的监视，但大多数外国人已经撤离，最后结果是六个人组成了一个团队，包括：一个专业的联合国人员；一个医生兼间谍；一个锅炉制造商人；一个经济学家；一名护士；还有一个冒险家（杰克）。

虽然，因为友谊杰克同意参加，他知道他们的目的地正是他10年以前遭受耻辱的地方。杰克很害怕-害怕过去发生的事和他直觉到正在等待他们事。

同时，他相信他们的命运和战区不可分割，他想了解战区，时间紧迫，在新的征程中，他一层接一层地挖掘出了他丰富的满是创伤的过去......

总之，仰慕《黑暗之心》和/或《禅与摩托车维修的艺术》的读者非常可能被这本书吸引。

每贡献一百美元（或倍数），将获得写有作者亲笔签名的书。

如果你不能资助但想帮助，那么也许你可以向别人推荐这个网站。

谢谢。
story_txt:
【中文在后面】
Set
in the raw Hellish throes of the Liberian Civil War, following the introduction
of a shoe-shine boy who is confronted by the invasion of his town, the novel
fast forwards a decade to the war’s 2003 historical
climax.
With
the capital and President Charles Taylor besieged from an array of triumphant
rebel forces all lusting for further spoils, only six days remain until
Taylor’s US, UN and Nigerian-brokered resign-and-depart-into-exile deadline.
Accordingly,
the tension is skyrocketing - will Taylor go voluntarily or will there be a
bloodbath?  Will there be a bloodbath
anyway?
Meanwhile,
an obscure rebel group deep in the interior (at a
place called ‘The Crossing’) unexpectedly seeks, under UN auspices, to disarm.
Requiring expatriate monitors, but with most
foreigners already evacuated, the resultant ragtag group of six consists of: a
UN professional; a doctor & spy; a boilermaker businessman; an economist; a
nurse; and, an adventurer (Jake).
Although, on account of mateship, consenting to
participate, aware their destination is the scene of his secret
ten-year-previous humiliation, Jake is terrified – terrified of what happened
last time and terrified of what his instincts tell him is awaiting them this
time.
Meanwhile, convinced their fate hinges on him
understanding his fascination with warzones, short of time and amidst the new journey, layer-by-layer,
he exhumes his rich yet traumatic past….
Admirers
of The Heart of Darkness (the inspiration for the Apocalypse Now movie) and/or
Zen & the Art of Motorcycle Maintenance may be particularly
attracted to this book. 
Every $100
contribution (and multiple) will receive an autographed numbered copy of the
book.
If you can't
contribute but would like to help then perhaps you can refer
others to this site. The Indiegogo share
tools are great for this.
Thank you. 
Chapter 1 – Jonathan
“Shoe-shine
I can do, so let me do it for you” Jonathan sing-song sang in shy pretence as,
rising from a squat, his ungainly 7-year-old gait, emaciated limbs, bare chiseled
feet and sheen of dirt and sweat gave the impression he’d just been borne of
the earth.
However,
failing to attract his target, slumping back down, he reached for his plastic
bottle of creek water and, as was his obsession, tipped a little on his hands.
“You
must keep your hand clean,” his teacher grandfather had lectured, only
partially evading the use of clipped Liberian English, “and, especially before
eating, wash between the finger!”
Yet,
of the three predominant threats – disease, war wounds and malnutrition – it
was the latter that currently occupied the boy’s thoughts. 
Can
this week we buy the meat, Jonathan wondered hoping there would be something to
add to the vegetables and fruit his family variously grew and scavenged?
With
his home a rudimentary single-roomed rectangular wooden-walled hut with an
amalgamation of wood and iron pieces for a roof, a transparent plastic sheet
for a window and a curtain for a door, Jonathan lived with his mother (Joy), two
elder sisters (Annabelle and Blessing), Annabelle’s infant son (Deloitte) and
Annabelle’s husband (Johnson).
At
night, although sleeping in close proximity to the others (except for Johnson who,
employed at the rubber plantation to ‘milk’ sap, started early, finished late
and typically slept where he stopped), upon lying down, the next thing Jonathan
was usually conscious of were the lights and sounds of the morning. 
Nevertheless,
the previous evening, the boy had been roused by Blessing’s murmurings.
Straining
upright from his sleeping position on the wooden floor, drawing his knees into
his chest and arm-locking them in; the boy’s gaze had been drawn to the dim
wisps of moonlight wandering through four closely netted cracks in the hut’s side.
‘The
night light’ be so brave, Jonathan observed feeling his usual camaraderie with
the moon; even of the dark it not afraid! 
Yes, other than our loving Lord Jesus, must not the Moon God be the
greatest of all spirit? 
Attracted
by the sound of a faint moan squeezing from Blessing’s lips, gazing upon his
sister’s ever-so-faintly illuminated face, the boy caught a glimpse of moisture
glinting from the corner of one of her eyes.
Unless
you the baby, he noted, there no purpose to crying – no thing to be gained for
the effort lost.
With
her eyelids parting to reveal slivers of partially eclipsed moons, which
mirrored light from the great hanging rock itself, though at first assuming
she’d awoken, he quickly realized she was battling foes from ‘the other world’. 
Poor
Blessing, Jonathan thought; what in your sleep so often make your eye trickle
and your face shake?
Believing
her dreams wouldn't end until she defeated the enemies within them, silently
wishing her victorious, he watched as, tossing-and-turning in-and-out of the moon’s
silver rays, the shifting light and shadows seemed to suggest forces of good
and evil were alternatively controlling her.
What
you dream of, Jonathan bleakly questioned again?  Is it ‘the great journey’ of our family?  
More
than seven years previous, while Jonathan was still in his mother’s womb, their
village had been attacked and his father and two brothers never heard of
again.  
With
the rest of the family escaping, walking for days through the jungle-clad
mountains, they’d finally arrived in his mother’s hometown of Harrington,
where, reuniting with Jonathan’s grandfather and aunts, they’d made their new
home.
Since
his mother and Annabelle refused to speak of the journey, Jonathan had learnt
most about it from Blessing – snippets from her memory and, especially, her
illustrations, which were the result, years earlier, of a foreign lady coming
to her Sunday School class and encouraging them to sketch what they’d witnessed
and what had happened to them during the war.
“The
drawing felt hard but good,” Blessing had told him, “like lemon and sugar
together.” 
Lying
back down on the hut’s wooden floor, dozing, Jonathan’s thoughts had drifted to
the ‘bad children’.
--------------------------------------

story:
“Americans are so competitive that in order to manage an American man you have to date at least four others. On the other side, Italian men are great in making you feel like the only one… among five others.”

(from "The Scandalous Memoir of a Freelance")

About The Freelance

"The Scandalous Memoir of a Freelance" (Freelance and not Freelancer because this is the way we call any freelancer in Italy) will be my first book in English and it is based on real experiences of dating, sex and love in New York City that I heard about and lived since I moved here from Italy five years ago. 

It tells the story of an Italian journalist who comes to the U.S. pursuing her career dreams and that ends up looking for Mr. Right too. Alas, she meets only a lot of Mr. Right Now of the strangest sort. She becomes so cynical that she can only  trust only her cactus, Mr. Cactus - she keeps saying. But, is dating in the Big City really so awful? Are Italy and the U.S. so different when it comes to love and sex?

This story needs to be told and to do that I need your support.

About The Author

I am a freelance journalist, of course. Italian, as I said. That brings a different cultural perspective on my experiences, maybe something you can relate to.

But why should I write a memoir? It all started as a joke. I was posting short sentences on Facebook, little scenes, sketches of conversations together with my personal considerations, pretending they were quotes from a bestseller, "The Scandalous Memoir of a Freelance", but given the success of these quotes I eventually decided to really start writing the "bestseller."

 It will be fun.

Why Crowdfunding This Book?

There are three main reasons why I decided to ask for financial support for this book

1) As a freelancer my time is almost all I have to survive. The more articles I write the more I can earn (and given the crisis of the media in Italy it is not a lot), which is why it is very hard for me to find time to sit down and write something purely creative as this book. All the hours I will spend writing are less time for my job. Your help will allow me to find those precious hours during the day to dedicate only to this project I really care about.

2) It will help me to finance a class in creative writing I will attend at Gotham Writers. As I said, English is not my first language, plus I have never written a memoir before, I really need some coaching in this adventure.

3) Publishing. I will look for a publisher but I am also ready to self publish this book. I really believe in it and if for some reason it won't appeal any editors at first, I will skip the traditional path and make sure you guys can read the adventures of the Freelance.

story:
Improving Caffeine: Introducing GMP Liquicaff.

Caffeine is nature's performance-enhancing drug, but consuming caffeine can be a downer. You're probably already painfully aware of the drawbacks of typical caffeine products:
  • Coffee: Home-brewed takes time, coffee shops are expensive; your pearly whites eventually look like the "before" mouth in a teeth whitening commercial; you blow your big moment in an important meeting because you're focusing on not peeing your pants.
  • Energy drinks: Expensive; tastes like chemicals because it's made from a lot of chemicals; contains a mountain of sugar or artificial sweeteners; people might mistake you for an X-Games groupie.
  • 5 Hour Energy: Tastes so bad, it's marketed as a selling point; More expensive than angel tears on a per-ounce basis (shots cost up to $5 each).
  • Caffeine tablets: Cheap, but with mediocre results; pressed-tablet delivery format may contain buffers and stabilizers, and may be slower-acting. Plus, plain-caffeine formula is less effective than energy blends at providing long-lasting, sustained energy.

So what's the alternative? Good Morning Pill Liquicaff.

We're Perfect Day Nutrition, and since 2011, we've been making energy vitamin supplements to provide people with the energy they need without assaulting their wallets. Our first product was the brainchild of two college roommates who loved (and needed) caffeine, but wanted to spend money on beer, not energy drinks.

Fast forward 3 years: we've sold millions of capsules of our Original and Turbo (extra strength) formulas, but we're about to further improve the caffeine game by launching our third product, the GMP Liquicaff. We've taken everything we've learned from our first two products to formulate the best energy supplement on the market. So what makes the new GMP Liquicaff so special?

  • Liquid-capsule delivery format: We're the first company to put liquid caffeine in a pill, providing the fast-acting properties of liquid in a quick, easy, no-taste, no-calorie format. Plus, the sip of water you take to wash down a GMP Liquicaff won't have you running to the bathroom during a meeting or pulling over at the next rest stop.
  • More money in your pocket - The GMP Liquicaff costs between 20 and 40 cents per serving (depending on bottle size). That's barely more than a plain pressed-caffeine tablet, and up to 95% cheaper than your morning coffee, energy drink, or energy shot. Substituting one GMP Liquicaff per day (versus $3 for a typical energy beverage) can save you over $1,000 per year.
  • Cutting-edge formula providing added benefits: More than just caffeine (which comes from natural sources), GMP Liquicaff's liquefied formula includes four powerful herbal extracts to provide enhanced energy, metabolic, and mental benefits:
  1. Guarana seed extract - natural source of caffeine, potentially providing additional weight management beneﬁts** 
  2. Green Tea Leaf Extract - natural source of caffeine and an antioxidant, valued in Asia for providing many health beneﬁts**
  3. Yerba mate - trusted South American herb with health beneﬁts that may include increased energy and focus, weight-management, and mood improvement** 
  4. Elutherococcus senticosus - trusted Asian herb that may promote increased endurance, memory/learning improvement, and may provide immunologic effects** 



What our customers say about our products

  • "...These pills go further than just energy and concentration, which they offer in spades. They actually give me a sense of well being. As someone who grew up taking Adderall daily for school, only to quit later in life, I find the Good Morning Pill to be a healthier, safer, and more manageable alternative." - Matthew, Amazon reviewer, on our original Good Morning Pill
  • "...This product helped me stop drinking coffee. I'm a past "Starbucks Guy." Everyday spending $3 dollars. I can feel the Caffeine when I take this and I feel more awake and ready for any question you can through at me. With problem solving this is a great tool. For about 33 cents a pill... I seriously win on this one. Recommend for a college student and business professional." - T. Arnold, Amazon reviewer, on our Good Morning Pill Turbo
  • "The pill gives me the boost to get going in the morning. The caffeine isn't over powering and there is no jitters associated with the caffeine, just a lift. I love it." - Susie, Amazon reviewer, on our Good Morning Pill Turbo


Why we're using IndieGoGo

We've taken to IndieGoGo to launch the new smaller 60-count bottle of our GMP Liquicaff. We've been selling 250-count bottles since early 2014 with a great response from long-time Good Morning Pill customers and new users alike, but not everyone wants to buy a year's supply of a product at once. 

Beyond the smaller size, and the fun of a crowd-funding campaign, we hope this campaign will allow us to scale up our business further. Like Amazon.com (or a less-naughty Wal-Mart), we believe in passing along our incremental savings to the consumer - that means that higher volumes for us equals cheaper products for you. In that spirit of savings, the products in this campaign are offered at prices at least 20% lower than our Amazon.com listings (and shipping is free!).

We're also hopeful that any attention generated by this campaign may help us make inroads with brick & mortar and online retailers, allowing us to bring our product (and the associated savings!) to many more potential customers that we do not yet reach.

Lastly, we have some crazy new product ideas in the pipeline. They'll probably hit the market eventually even without any extra IndieGoGo boost, but funds from this project will allow us to innovate faster and farther than we otherwise would.

    The Impact

    Let's be real - a caffeine supplement isn't going to save the world. But here are the impacts and implications GMP Liquicaff has for you, America, and the planet:

    You: 
    • Save up to $1,000 per year versus the cost of energy drinks, coffee, or shots
    • Save one day of your life each year avoiding the Starbucks or convenience store checkout line (at 4 minutes per day, every day)
    • Keep your teeth white, and keep your bladder empty
    • Get an awesome boost of energy to power you through your day
    America:
    • Support small business! Beyond just us (Perfect Day Nutrition), you'll be helping our manufacturers, two lovely businesses based in Pittsburgh, PA and Farmingdale, NY (Long Island)
    The World!:
    • Coffee, energy drinks and energy shots waste a lot of resources - water, metal, and plastic - and result in litter in our streets and trash in our landfills. Choosing the GMP is a small way to help reduce such waste. 


    Risks & Challenges:

    Not many - we've been selling our Original formula since 2011, our Turbo formula since 2012, and our Liquicaff formula since early 2014, and our customers love our products and value our customer support. 

    However, if the campaign is extremely successful, there may be some delay in shipment. (If you'd like to get product immediately, please support this project by selecting an Amazon coupon code reward - your order will ship quickly & hassle free, backed up by Amazon's world-class logistics.)


      Other Ways You Can Help

      Spread the word! Not everyone loves caffeine, or some people just prefer a morning coffee, afternoon Monster or a Red Bull at a nightclub. That's fine (we're partial to Dunkin when we drink coffee, and sometimes a Monster and vodka is necessary to keep the night going) - but please feel free to help us out by spreading the word to your caffeine tablet-taking friend that there's a better alternative out there.


      International shipping

      International supporters are welcome! But, unfortunately, international shipping is expensive and not included with the listed perks. Please add an additional amount to your contribution to cover the costs of shipping, as detailed below:

      • $3 for international shipping of a sample pack
      • $10 for international shipping of a 60-count bottle
      • $20 for international shipping of a 250-count bottle or the Family Pack
story_txt:
Improving Caffeine: Introducing GMP Liquicaff.
Caffeine is nature's performance-enhancing drug, but consuming caffeine can be a downer. You're probably already painfully aware of the drawbacks of typical caffeine products:


Coffee: Home-brewed takes time, coffee shops are expensive; your pearly whites eventually look like the "before" mouth in a teeth whitening commercial; you blow your big moment in an important meeting because you're focusing on not peeing your pants.
Energy drinks: Expensive; tastes like chemicals because it's made from a lot of chemicals; contains a mountain of sugar or artificial sweeteners; people might mistake you for an X-Games groupie.

5 Hour Energy: Tastes so bad, it's marketed as a selling point; More expensive than angel tears on a per-ounce basis (shots cost up to $5 each).

Caffeine tablets: Cheap, but with mediocre results; pressed-tablet delivery format may contain buffers and stabilizers, and may be slower-acting. Plus, plain-caffeine formula is less effective than energy blends at providing long-lasting, sustained energy.


So what's the alternative? Good Morning Pill Liquicaff.



We're Perfect Day Nutrition, and since 2011, we've been making energy vitamin supplements to provide people with the energy they need without assaulting their wallets. Our first product was the brainchild of two college roommates who loved (and needed) caffeine, but wanted to spend money on beer, not energy drinks.

Fast forward 3 years: we've sold millions of capsules of our Original and Turbo (extra strength) formulas, but we're about to further improve the caffeine game by launching our third product, the GMP Liquicaff. We've taken everything we've learned from our first two products to formulate the best energy supplement on the market. So what makes the new GMP Liquicaff so special?



Liquid-capsule delivery format: We're the first company to put liquid caffeine in a pill, providing the fast-acting properties of liquid in a quick, easy, no-taste, no-calorie format. Plus, the sip of water you take to wash down a GMP Liquicaff won't have you running to the bathroom during a meeting or pulling over at the next rest stop.
More money in your pocket - The GMP Liquicaff costs between 20 and 40 cents per serving (depending on bottle size). That's barely more than a plain pressed-caffeine tablet, and up to 95% cheaper than your morning coffee, energy drink, or energy shot. Substituting one GMP Liquicaff per day (versus $3 for a typical energy beverage) can save you over $1,000 per year.
Cutting-edge formula providing added benefits: More than just caffeine (which comes from natural sources), GMP Liquicaff's liquefied formula includes four powerful herbal extracts to provide enhanced energy, metabolic, and mental benefits:



Guarana seed extract - natural source of caffeine, potentially providing additional weight management beneﬁts** 


Green Tea Leaf Extract - natural source of caffeine and an antioxidant, valued in Asia for providing many health beneﬁts**


Yerba mate - trusted South American herb with health beneﬁts that may include increased energy and focus, weight-management, and mood improvement** 


Elutherococcus senticosus - trusted Asian herb that may promote increased endurance, memory/learning improvement, and may provide immunologic effects** 










What our customers say about our products

"...These pills go further than just energy and concentration, which they offer in spades. They actually give me a sense of well being. As someone who grew up taking Adderall daily for school, only to quit later in life, I find the Good Morning Pill to be a healthier, safer, and more manageable alternative." - Matthew, Amazon reviewer, on our original Good Morning Pill

"...This product helped me stop drinking coffee. I'm a past "Starbucks Guy." Everyday spending $3 dollars. I can feel the Caffeine when I take this and I feel more awake and ready for any question you can through at me. With problem solving this is a great tool. For about 33 cents a pill... I seriously win on this one. Recommend for a college student and business professional." - T. Arnold, Amazon reviewer, on our Good Morning Pill Turbo

"The pill gives me the boost to get going in the morning. The caffeine isn't over powering and there is no jitters associated with the caffeine, just a lift. I love it." - Susie, Amazon reviewer, on our Good Morning Pill Turbo







   Why we're using IndieGoGo
We've taken to IndieGoGo to launch the new smaller 60-count bottle of our GMP Liquicaff. We've been selling 250-count bottles since early 2014 with a great response from long-time Good Morning Pill customers and new users alike, but not everyone wants to buy a year's supply of a product at once. 

Beyond the smaller size, and the fun of a crowd-funding campaign, we hope this campaign will allow us to scale up our business further. Like Amazon.com (or a less-naughty Wal-Mart), we believe in passing along our incremental savings to the consumer - that means that higher volumes for us equals cheaper products for you. In that spirit of savings, the products in this campaign are offered at prices at least 20% lower than our Amazon.com listings (and shipping is free!).

We're also hopeful that any attention generated by this campaign may help us make inroads with brick & mortar and online retailers, allowing us to bring our product (and the associated savings!) to many more potential customers that we do not yet reach.

Lastly, we have some crazy new product ideas in the pipeline. They'll probably hit the market eventually even without any extra IndieGoGo boost, but funds from this project will allow us to innovate faster and farther than we otherwise would.


  The Impact Let's be real - a caffeine supplement isn't going to save the world. But here are the impacts and implications GMP Liquicaff has for you, America, and the planet: You: 
Save up to $1,000 per year versus the cost of energy drinks, coffee, or shots
Save one day of your life each year avoiding the Starbucks or convenience store checkout line (at 4 minutes per day, every day)
Keep your teeth white, and keep your bladder empty
Get an awesome boost of energy to power you through your day
America:Support small business! Beyond just us (Perfect Day Nutrition), you'll be helping our manufacturers, two lovely businesses based in Pittsburgh, PA and Farmingdale, NY (Long Island)
The World!:
Coffee, energy drinks and energy shots waste a lot of resources - water, metal, and plastic - and result in litter in our streets and trash in our landfills. Choosing the GMP is a small way to help reduce such waste.  

  Risks & Challenges:
Not many - we've been selling our Original formula since 2011, our Turbo formula since 2012, and our Liquicaff formula since early 2014, and our customers love our products and value our customer support. 
However, if the campaign is extremely successful, there may be some delay in shipment. (If you'd like to get product immediately, please support this project by selecting an Amazon coupon code reward - your order will ship quickly & hassle free, backed up by Amazon's world-class logistics.)


  Other Ways You Can Help Spread the word! Not everyone loves caffeine, or some people just prefer a morning coffee, afternoon Monster or a Red Bull at a nightclub. That's fine (we're partial to Dunkin when we drink coffee, and sometimes a Monster and vodka is necessary to keep the night going) - but please feel free to help us out by spreading the word to your caffeine tablet-taking friend that there's a better alternative out there.

International shipping
International supporters are welcome! But, unfortunately, international shipping is expensive and not included with the listed perks. Please add an additional amount to your contribution to cover the costs of shipping, as detailed below:



$3 for international shipping of a sample pack


$10 for international shipping of a 60-count bottle


$20 for international shipping of a 250-count bottle or the Family Pack

story: Derby Days is a national philanthropy event held by most Sigma Chi chapters across the country. All proceeds are donated to Huntsman Cancer Institute, Sigma Chi's national charity. Derby Days involves friendly competition between sororities, competing to split the money raised with Sigma Chi.

story:
About Big Pulp

We publish fiction online for free. We pay our writers. You may see where we're going with this. 

Since 2008, Big Pulp has published some of the best genre fiction writers from around the world. Our zine is a modern, electronic version of the classic corner newsstand, where writers and fans could find pulp and popular fiction of all kinds - science fiction, adventure stories, horror, fantasy, jungle tales, mystery and true crime, romance, and super-hero sagas. We pride ourselves on offering the best of everything. 

Big Pulp has published long-time writers and award-winners, as well as new and emerging authors. Some of our writers have published hundreds of stories or poems, but many have received their first writing credit - and first payment - from Big Pulp. We choose writing based on the story, not on the byline. 

Big Pulp began publishing fiction and poetry online - completely free to readers - in March 2008. In December 2010, we launched a print version of the site, while continuing to publish work online, accessible to anyone with a computer. 

The Impact

Some of Big Pulp's funding comes from donations and advertising, but sales of our electronic and print editions are our lifeline. Without sales, we would no longer be able to pay our writers. 

We strongly believe that writers deserve to be paid for their work. We also believe that offering payment significantly increases the quality of work that is submitted to us for publication on our site and in the magazine. 

Even a few dollars means we continue to publish, writers continue to get paid, and our readers continue to have free online access to tens of thousands of words of great fiction and poetry.

What We Need & What You Get

$1200 will fund an entire issue of Big Pulp - contributor payments, a small print run, postage and web site costs. All our editorial work - site maintenance, editing and proofreading, sales - is done on a volunteer basis. Every dollar raised through the campaign will go back into running the site and paying contributors. No exceptions. 

We're not asking for you to give something for nothing. Every bit of funding - at every level - is a purchase of one or more editions of Big Pulp, and other goodies! 

400 e-book editions will fund an entire issue. Or 120 printed copies. 

We know we can find 400 readers! 

No $$$? No problem! 

We know that not everyone has dough to throw around to keep someone else's dream going. We've been there. But, it doesn't cost a dime to help spread the word! 

Can you help us find 400 new readers? Tell your friends! 

If you're a writer and want to help keep a paying market in print - tell your friends! 

If you're a fan of pulp fiction and want to continue reading great fiction and poetry online for free - tell your friends! 

The sharing tools make it easy to help spread the word through e-mail, Facebook, Twitter or your own web site. 

Tell your friends!

story:
Every war story is a ghost story. -Iraq veteran 

PTSD is a disease of time. -Allan Young, anthropologist, McGill University 

Why A Book About Post-traumatic Stress Disorder? 

PTSD seems to be everywhere these days. Who's got it? What is it? Is it contagious? Does Batman have it? What about John Goodman's character from "The Big Lebowski"? 

Jokes aside, PTSD is a serious mental health condition that affects approximately 15% of all combat veterans and almost half of all rape victims. An estimated 8% of Americans will experience PTSD at some point in their lives. That's 25 million people. And yet, there is no one book that captures the extensive history, science and personal experience of post-traumatic stress. 

The Evil Hours Project 

I've been interviewing PTSD experts from all over the world for a year now. I have recorded over 100 hours of interviews with combat veterans, rape victims, tsunami survivors, neuroscientists, psychiatrists, social workers, historians, mountaineers, political refugees, poets and philosophers. Drawing on my own experiences as a Marine and reporter in Iraq, my goal is to write a book that addresses the questions:What does it mean to survive? What does it mean to be haunted? 

PTSD is one of the defining disorders of our time and there are tens of thousands of people in the US who study and treat it. And yet, PTSD remains an enigma. As pioneering trauma theorist Jonathan Shay puts it, "PTSD can unfortunately mimic almost any condition in psychiatry."

Who is David Morris?

I’m a San Diego-based writer, teacher and photographer. I'm also a former Marine officer and from 2004-7, I reported from Iraq for a number of news organizations including Salon, PBS Newshour and the Virginia Quarterly Review. In Iraq, I spent months in some of the deadliest, most-contested areas of the country, places like Fallujah, Haditha, and the Dora neighborhood of Baghdad. In 2006, I was one of the first reporters the US military allowed into Ramadi, a town that was described as "the Chernobyl of the insurgency." 

I've also written for Slate, The Los Angeles Times, The Nation, Foreign Policy and The Surfer's Journal. I've received writing fellowships from the National Endowment for the Arts, The MacDowell Colony, The Norman Mailer Writers Colony, and the Pulitzer Center on Crisis Reporting. 

I first got interested in PTSD when I read a newspaper article about how some Iraq veterans felt "poisoned" by the war, as if it had fundamentally altered their existential position in the world. I am fascinated by this moral component of survivorship—how events in life can freeze us in time, seeming to render us unfit for the everyday world. This is essentially the same question confronted by Ishmael at the end of Moby Dick, as he looks out on the vast sea from Queequeg's coffin: How does one live in the aftermath of the impossible?

Here is a story I wrote that was included in The Best American Nonrequired Readinganthology, edited by Dave Eggers.

http://www.vqronline.org/articles/2007/winter/morris-jarhead-underground/

 

So wait, aren't there already like a million books about PTSD?

Yep, in fact, there are a lot of PTSD books out there, but most of them zero in on one specific area of traumatic stress, e.g. an exciting new treatment, or one person's journey through it. PTSD is a complex condition, and unfortunately, most people who study it are so busy that they don't usually talk with people outside of their individual discipline. Psychiatrists don't talk to historians, victims’ advocates don't talk to poets, neuroscientists don't talk to Afghanistan veterans. My goal with The Evil Hours is to bring all these voices together in a single volume and show more fully what PTSD is—what causes it, what it's like to live with it, and how it changes what we know about human identity.

One of the little known facts about PTSD is that it wasn't acknowledged by psychiatry until 1980. The fight to have it officially recognized by the American Psychiatric Association was the culmination of a decade-long campaign by a group of anti-Vietnam War veterans and activist psychiatrists. This group—Vietnam Veterans Against the War—fought against widespread criticism from veterans of other wars and the Nixon administration, which mounted an intensive surveillance and intimidation campaign against them. Drawing on new information gleaned from interviews and the archives of the Nixon Presidential library, The Evil Hours will tell their story for the first time.

Since 1980, scientific research into post-traumatic stress has exploded and our understanding of what causes it and how to treat it has grown exponentially. Today, PTSD has practically become the international lingua franca of human suffering.

The Evil Hours is under contract with Houghton Mifflin, a US publisher, and will be released in Fall 2014.

 

Wow, this whole thing sounds like a huge downer, why should I contribute?

You should contribute because chances are good that you know someone with PTSD, and a thoughtful, well-researched book on the subject can help to change the conversation. And also because PTSD is everywhere in our culture right now: in our movies, in the way we talk ("Dude, I think I just had a flashback"), in the way we think about stories and time and personhood.

PTSD has always been with us, but with the increased interest and funding generated by the War on Terror, we’re living in a golden age of trauma research, one that our tax dollars pay for and about which the average citizen knows almost nothing. That’s why a book like this is so important right now.

I have completed 80% of the research required to write this book. However, because of the scope of the project and delays in navigating the labyrinth of the Veterans Administration, the fact-finding process has taken longer than I originally anticipated. (As the sister of one Iraq veteran said to me, "Dealing with the VA is like growing orchids.") Your contribution will help me complete The Evil Hours.

Where Will My Money Go?

Your contribution will cover research expenses like travel and lodging, interview transcription, interview tape duplication (archival tapes are incredibly expensive), research book purchases, academic journal subscriptions, marketing, photocopies, office supplies, a scientific proofreader, and my "Friends of the UCSD Library" card privileges. If we raise enough money, I hope to travel to the International Society for Traumatic Stress Studies Conference in Philadelphia in November 2013, and possibly even to Israel to visit with the clinicians at NATAL, the Israeli PTSD nonprofit, and the UN Relief & Works Agency in Gaza.

story:
Short Summary

To help as many mothers as I can by giving away as many copies of my book:

Work Women Want: Work at Home or Go Part-Time as possible.

What We Need & What You Get

What the book is about:

After the birth of my daughter, I kept meeting other mothers who wanted to work at home. They were asking the same questions I had. How can I be there for my children and still make decent money? How can I work at home or go part-time? Which one is right for me? In my book Work Women Want I set out to find them an answer. 

I share my own journey making decent money from home, as well as my experience working part-time. I also share the stories of the women I interviewed who make family friendly money. More Importantly, in the book I help you find the right work for you.

I have spent the last nine months interviewing women and writing my book Work Women Want. I am self-publishing the book because that's what I do. I haven't even approached a traditional publisher. I have enough of my own money to pay for an eagle eye editor and a fabulous graphic designer. The book will be released May 1st 2013.

What I Need Help With:

But I would like to help as many other mothers as I can: I would like to give away 2000 copies with 500 print copies and 1500 e-book copies making up that total number. (Honestly I would love to giveaway even more than that!) 

Printing and posting 500 print copies of the book isn't cheap and it isn't the kind of money I have. It will cost about about $22 a book to print it and post it around the world. Sending e-books for all the different e-readers out there is so much cheaper but still does have a small cost attached.

I will use all the money raised here to send out free books to mothers. How will I choose the women who get them? One of the perks I'm offering here is a copy of the book so of course you will be first. Next I will give them to the people who subscribe to my blog at www.workwomenwant.com will get one and then I will contact  mommy bloggers to see if their subscribers would like a copy.

What You Get for Donating is:

$5 A lovely PDF file with a gorgeous Judy Garland quote" "Be a first rate version of yourself and not a second rate version of someone else." Lovely to hang on the wall!

$10 One e-book copies of Work Women Want when it is released May 2013

$25 Two e-book copies of Work Women Want when it is released May 2013: one for you and one for a friend.

$35 One print copy of Work Women Want when it is released May 2013

$40 One print copy and one e-book copy of Work Women Want when it is released May 2013

$50 My Making It Happen For You online course which includes a PDF workbook and seven video tutorials. The course takes you step-by-step to getting personally ready to work at home, finding opportunities and starting a business at home.

$75 One print copy and one e-book copy of Work Women Want and my Making It Happen For You online course which includes a PDF workbook and seven video tutorials. The course takes you step-by-step to getting personally ready to work at home, finding opportunities and starting a business at home.

$100 Two print copies of Work Women Want and my Making It Happen For You online course which includes a PDF workbook and seven video tutorials. The course takes you step-by-step to getting personally ready to work at home, finding opportunities and starting a business at home. Read the book and complete the online course with a friend. Giveaway the second copy and course to a friend.

$250 One print copy of Work Women Want, my Making It Happen For You online course and 45 minute Muse session with me on Skype. The course takes you step-by-step to getting personally ready to work at home, finding opportunities and starting a business at home. I will bring my experience and creative thinking to the Skype session to help you work out how to make money at home or how to negotiate a part-time job.

$500 Two print copies of Work Women Want, access for two people to my Making It Happen For You online course and 90 minute group Muse session with me on Skype so that you can bring a friend to the discussion. The course takes you step-by-step to getting personally ready to work at home, finding opportunities and starting a business at home. I will bring my experience and creative thinking to the session to help you work out how to make money at home or how to negotiate a part-time job.

$1000 Four print copies and four e-book copies of Work Women Want, access for four people to my Making It Happen For You online course, two x 45 minute Muse sessions with me on Skype to help you work out how to make money at home and get your plans in action with up to four people on the call. The course takes you step-by-step to getting personally ready to work at home, finding opportunities and starting a business at home.

The Impact

Once you have kids there are a lot of tough decisions that have to be made. A lot of parents - both moms and dads - give up their careers and don't make much money so they can be there for their children. I didn't write this book for every mother or every woman. I wrote it for the moms who are at home with their kids by choice or by chance and who still want and need to make some money. I want to help those women find ways to make some money and live the life they want for them and their children.

By donating you can help mothers do what sometimes seem impossible: have the time to take the kids to the playground and be there to pick them up after school but still make money and put food on the table.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate right now, no worries! Spread the word to your friends and family. Tell any parents you know who may be keen to work out how to make money at home or go part-time. 

Email your friends, family, any parents you know.

Spread the word for me on Facebook, Twitter, Google+ or whatever social media you love. 

Oh and there's the Indiegogo share tools as well!

Thanks for reading to the end. And thanks for your help in whatever way you can. I really, really appreciate it!
story_txt:
Short Summary
To help as many mothers as I can by giving away as many copies of my book: 
Work Women Want: Work at Home or Go Part-Time as possible.
What We Need & What You Get
What the book is about:
After the birth of my daughter, I kept meeting other mothers who wanted to work at home. They were asking the same questions I had. How can I be there for my children and still make decent money? How can I work at home or go part-time? Which one is right for me? In my book Work Women Want I set out to find them an answer. 
I share my own journey making decent money from home, as well as my experience working part-time. I also share the stories of the women I interviewed who make family friendly money. More Importantly, in the book I help you find the right work for you.
I have spent the last nine months interviewing women and writing my book Work Women Want. I am self-publishing the book because that's what I do. I haven't even approached a traditional publisher. I have enough of my own money to pay for an eagle eye editor and a fabulous graphic designer. The book will be released May 1st 2013.
What I Need Help With:
But I would like to help as many other mothers as I can: I would like to give away 2000 copies with 500 print copies and 1500 e-book copies making up that total number. (Honestly I would love to giveaway even more than that!) 
Printing and posting 500 print copies of the book isn't cheap and it isn't the kind of money I have. It will cost about about $22 a book to print it and post it around the world. Sending e-books for all the different e-readers out there is so much cheaper but still does have a small cost attached.
I will use all the money raised here to send out free books to mothers. How will I choose the women who get them? One of the perks I'm offering here is a copy of the book so of course you will be first. Next I will give them to the people who subscribe to my blog at www.workwomenwant.com will get one and then I will contact  mommy bloggers to see if their subscribers would like a copy.
What You Get for Donating is:
$5 A lovely PDF file with a gorgeous Judy Garland quote" "Be a first rate version of yourself and not a second rate version of someone else." Lovely to hang on the wall!
$10 One e-book copies of Work Women Want when it is released May 2013
$25 Two e-book copies of Work Women Want when it is released May 2013: one for you and one for a friend.
$35 One print copy of Work Women Want when it is released May 2013
$40 One print copy and one e-book copy of Work Women Want when it is released May 2013
$50 My Making It Happen For You online course which includes a PDF workbook and seven video tutorials. The course takes you step-by-step to getting personally ready to work at home, finding opportunities and starting a business at home.
$75 One print copy and one e-book copy of Work Women Want and my Making It Happen For You online course which includes a PDF workbook and seven video tutorials. The course takes you step-by-step to getting personally ready to work at home, finding opportunities and starting a business at home.
$100 Two print copies of Work Women Want and my Making It Happen For You online course which includes a PDF workbook and seven video tutorials. The course takes you step-by-step to getting personally ready to work at home, finding opportunities and starting a business at home. Read the book and complete the online course with a friend. Giveaway the second copy and course to a friend.
$250 One print copy of Work Women Want, my Making It Happen For You online course and 45 minute Muse session with me on Skype. The course takes you step-by-step to getting personally ready to work at home, finding opportunities and starting a business at home. I will bring my experience and creative thinking to the Skype session to help you work out how to make money at home or how to negotiate a part-time job.
$500 Two print copies of Work Women Want, access for two people to my Making It Happen For You online course and 90 minute group Muse session with me on Skype so that you can bring a friend to the discussion. The course takes you step-by-step to getting personally ready to work at home, finding opportunities and starting a business at home. I will bring my experience and creative thinking to the session to help you work out how to make money at home or how to negotiate a part-time job.
$1000 Four print copies and four e-book copies of Work Women Want, access for four people to my Making It Happen For You online course, two x 45 minute Muse sessions with me on Skype to help you work out how to make money at home and get your plans in action with up to four people on the call. The course takes you step-by-step to getting personally ready to work at home, finding opportunities and starting a business at home.
The Impact
Once you have kids there are a lot of tough decisions that have to be made. A lot of parents - both moms and dads - give up their careers and don't make much money so they can be there for their children. I didn't write this book for every mother or every woman. I wrote it for the moms who are at home with their kids by choice or by chance and who still want and need to make some money. I want to help those women find ways to make some money and live the life they want for them and their children.
By donating you can help mothers do what sometimes seem impossible: have the time to take the kids to the playground and be there to pick them up after school but still make money and put food on the table.
Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't donate right now, no worries! Spread the word to your friends and family. Tell any parents you know who may be keen to work out how to make money at home or go part-time. 
Email your friends, family, any parents you know.
Spread the word for me on Facebook, Twitter, Google+ or whatever social media you love. 
Oh and there's the Indiegogo share tools as well!
Thanks for reading to the end. And thanks for your help in whatever way you can. I really, really appreciate it!

story:
Meet SNURTLE!

Hi, my name is Baruch Inbar and I’m an artist and a writer from Los Angeles. SNURTLE is my first children’s book that I’ve written and illustrated. I have been dreaming for a long time to publish my first children’s book, and now it’s time has come!

About The Book

SNURTLE is the story of a very unusual character who is born to a mom snail and a dad turtle, into a strict and rigid society that does not embrace diversity and uniqueness. Therefore, SNURTLE and his parents are forced to leave their home and life behind, and embark on an epic adventure on their search for a new home and a loving community, that will love and accept them the way they are. Will they succeed? You can find out when you read the book!

I wrote this book, because I felt that there is a little SNURTLE deep inside each and every one of us – that part that wants to be loved and accepted for our uniqueness, no matter how strange or weird we may think we are…A message that goes well for both children and adults.

The book features spectacular 22 full color illustrations, and is written in whimsical, humorous and fun rhymes that the entire family will enjoy, including the in laws! ;0)

What I Offer & What You Get

I am offering you the opportunity to contribute and take part in the first LIMITED edition printing of the book in English, of 10,000 copies. I am committed to printing this book with the highest integrity and best quality I can! This first hard cover edition run of SNURTLE will be printed in the U.S, on a high quality, long lasting and durable paper.

My printing costs are quoted at $5.3 per book - which comes to total of $53,000 + tax (appx. $57,800) to print 10,000 copies of SNURTLE, on top notch art quality, archival hard cover 12” x 12” format. The rest of the funds that will remain after paying Indiegogo their share (appx. $5,000 fee) will be used to cover the costs of mailing and other expenses of the perks disbursement, promotion and online marketing of the book, sales and distribution and of the book online as well as other avenues such as book fairs, festivals and tradeshows.

If you look at the perks, you are getting a share and great investment in a really cool intellectual peoperty that will grow expedentially and turn into a global phonomena. Whether you contribute $5, or more, you are getting really cool stuff signed by yours very truly! 

But here is the biggest perk you get if you contribute $25 or more:

This is the ONLY first edition of the book that will be ever printed, numbered and signed by me. Once the book gets momentum, there is the likelihood that it will be picked up by a major publisher and reprinted in mass production. If you are one of the lucky ones who will get a first edition signed copy by me, you will own a valuable art collectible piece forever that will be worth much more down the road. A pretty good investment don't you think?...

What's Next?

This is just the beginning! The funding will be used to get the books out there into the world, and provided that we succeed at getting over-compensated, the extra money will be used to print additional books in other languages (already translated into Hebrew and Russian), and even turn SNURTLE into an interactive iPad book, animated film, online game, plush toys, clothing line and other cool stuff!

My commitement is to offer YOU, my dear backers a first exclusive preview and opportunity to take part in any new possibilities that will spring out of the book, and that way you will continue to grow your shares in this property. We are ALL making this happen together, and I am honored to give you a share in the success of SNURTLE as it grows!

Also, as stated in my video: after fulfilling the perks to you all, for each and every book I wil sell, I will donate one book to a foster child through the BLESS THE CHILDREN Project charitable foundation. This is super important to me, because I was a foster child myself, and I know how important the message of SNURTLE is for these kids...

I thank you SO MUCH for your support, and I wish you all: have a SNURTLEful day!

Cheers-

~Baruch Inbar.

 

HERE IS SOME MORE COOL ARTWORK FROM THE BOOK:

story:
Where We Go When All We Were Is Gone

 

As we proceeded through the serpentine inner loggia, a glowing passage spiraling towards the center of the complex, Reo and I stopped to gaze up at nearly every column––sculptured monoliths of regal men in robes and jewels, tribesman with ornate feathered headdresses, muscular warriors clad in animal skins holding shields at their feet, Roman centurions, Greek philosphers, a young man with a swastika on his uniform carrying a rifle. Did these people come to this place? I wondered. Were the builders still around to add onto the complex as our civilization grew? Perhaps the walls around us were alive in some way, aware of the world above, sprouting pyramids, adobe villages, and modern skyscrapers so gargatuan that they almost defied the world above. 

~

I watched my teenage daughter sleep via the spycam behind her dresser mirror. I waited for it, sitting in my locked office downstairs. It didn’t happen every night but, when it did, it began just after her eyes began to flit like frightened houseflies. She appeared to be fast asleep the whole time, unaware of what was happening to her, although I knew the exact opposite to be true. Her olive skin punctuated with the scars of a tomboyish childhood began to fade––erase until her skin had become a gelatinous membrane like the flesh of a jellyfish. The transformation radiated from her feet, creeping up her legs and torso in a sinuous path. Organs became masses of light. The heart, a tiny pulsar, streaming out rivulets of blood throughout her body the color of the aurora. 


Summary

In the not too distant future, Reo, the young daughter of two evolutionary geneticists, accompanies her parents on an expedition in the Amazon. Deep within an unexplored cave network, a massive temple complex that predates humanity glows in the darkness. It is here, surrounded by impossibly ancient colonnades and walls adorned with carvings of our history, that Reo dies, falling through brittle ground and into the primordial foundation of the temple. 

But years later, she is still alive, and only her father knows what is happening to her, how his daughter left the cave where he found her lifeless body. Meanwhile, the girl's mother conducts experiments on a history-altering discovery made in the caves where her daughter, unbeknownst to her, died, an experiment with ramifications which could change what it means to be human. 

What follows is a journey of one girl trying to discover who she is and where she fits into the world––during high school as the world is torn apart by failing ecosystems and governments, in the timeless consciousness of dreams and death, through post-apocalyptic streets, and in the back alleys of underground settlements.

This is a story of the fall and rebirth of family, self, and civilization, and the choices one girl makes in trying to give her family and the world a second chance.

 

[Key words/influences: H.P. Lovecraft, Stanislaw Lem, J.G. Ballard, Solaris, At the Mountains of Madness, The Drowned World, Post-apocalyptic, philosophy of the mind, shared consciousness, afterlife, evolutionary genetics, origin myths, identity formation]

 

What We Need & What You Get

The funding for this project goes towards additional research/ time/ preliminary marketing. Funds will also go towards limited edition print runs of stories, so folks can get a glimpse at the project and also a sampling of my other writing. These artfully designed mini-book/chapbooks (~40-50pgs) will include illustrations, author notes, and interactive features (i.e. surveys) designed to add to the main novel (e-book versions will also be available). 

***In many ways, this is an experiment in production, marketing, and publishing. Writers are having to become more and more entrepreneurial in the face of a changing publishing landscape. And as far as I'm concerned, interacting with readers and other writers throughout the process of creating only seems natural (and relevant to the world we live in). So, in other words, while I intend to pursue traditional publishing routes, expect to see self-published sections of the novel available in e-book format/ Amazaon singles as well.*** 

 

By Supporting this Funrdaiser, you will have the opportunity to:

1. Receive limited edition, artfully designed mini-books 

2. Become a part of the novel by submitting personal stories which will be fictionalized as events experienced in a shared consciousness. Your name may also be used for a character (should you choose).

3. Get insight into the writing and researching process via regular updates (which may include snippets, notes, email/skype exchanges). 

4) Support a writer (acknowledgments made in mini-book and website as a supporter). Some acknowledgemnets in the actual novel.

 

How your donation helps

Your support will help defray costs (i.e. help keep the shirt on my back) in both producing preliminary mini-books while securing the time and space needed to push the novel through completion and edits. This will be a long and winding road and your support will help me make the most out of every twist and turn. 

This novel is not only the story of a girl who saves the world but it's also the story of us. This campaign is just one of many ways I'll be reaching out to people to get the story out there and, perhaps more importantly, to hear the stories of others. 

Imagine yourself in a endless black void filled with millions and millions of people. What if you could hear their voices, feel their emotions, experience their memories like a movie projected in the ether? What would you share with the masses? What would we reflect on after our bodies have left us?

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I appreciate any support. Please help me spread the word by linking your friends who may be interested. For those of you that send over at least three people (but cannot afford to contribute monetarily), you'll get an e-book copy of a minibook. For those that have funded and send over at least three people, I'll give you an additional memory to be included into the book. 

Use Indiegogo's "Share Tools" to spread the word via your social network of choice. 

Check back regularly for updates and new info. 

 

Thank you!

 

About the Author

Sequoia Nagamatsu was raised in the San Francisco Bay Area and Oahu, Hawaii and was educated at Grinnell College in Iowa. A former large-scale event planner and endangered forest activist, he is currently pursuing an MFA in creative writing at Southern Illinois University – Carbondale. His work has appeared or is forthcoming in ZYZZYVA, The Bellevue Literary Review (New York University), West Branch (Bucknell University), The New Delta Review (Louisiana State University), Gargoyle, elimae, and One World: A Global Anthology of Short Stories (New Internationalist, Oxford). His story, The Silence of the Third Inversion, was named a finalist for the 2012 Third Coast Fiction Prize. He is currently working on a post-apocalyptic, family-oriented novel involving shape shifters and a short story collection revolving around unusual funerary practices, death, and the afterlife.

http://sequoianamagatsu.net

story:
"Censorship is telling a man he can't have a steak just because a baby can't chew it."
-- Mark Twain

Short Summary

We Believe Censorship Is Wrong ...
In January of 2011, a censored version of the Mark Twain classic, “Adventures of Huckleberry Finn” was announced. The publisher replaced the controversial 'n' word with the word 'slave' in an effort to appear more politically correct.

Unless, It Is Funny ...
After the news broke, I made a remark on Twitter about how replacing with word with 'ninja' would make everything far more interesting. A week later, my brother and I began an experiment. What began as a simple 'search & replace' became something far more complex -- it became a speculative, historical fiction novel. We released the first draft of the manuscript last year as an ebook on Amazon and Barnes & Noble. Now, in the tradition of Pride & Prejudice & Zombies, we're looking to expand the book into a deluxe hardcover, with an expanded focus on the world and its rich history.

And It Is For A Good Cause. 
Proceeds from the sale of the book will go towards protecting free speech and towards supporting the United Negro College Fund. Our hope is that we be able to help create more educational programs and promote more dialogue about censorship.  

 

Who We Are

I'm David Gallaher. I'm a New York Times best-selling editor and award-winning comic book author who has written for Marvel, DC, and Image Comics.

Helping me on the project is my brother Benb Gallaher, who is the owner of GOOD IDEAS ON PAPER, a full service proof-reading and editorial service company. 

What We Need & What You Get

As I mentioned, the first draft has already been completed and was released as an ebook last year. We're looking for funds to cover editing the revision, minor re-writing, printing, and distribution. Right now, the book is scheduled to be printed in New Jersey around early September. 

All contributors to the project will receive a copy of the revised ebook, formatted for the portable reading device of their choice. At higher levels, contributors will also receive a copy of the hardcover, signed editons, slip case editions, and limited editon library bound copies of the book. 

Why This Is Important

Ninjas are cool. More importantly though, censoring Mark Twain is the start of a deeply troubling trend in academia -- and in schools all over the country. It's important to stand up and fight for the freedom of expression -- with our voices and in print.

story:
Short Summary

Standard Edition Of Survivors & Bandits

Summary

Survivors & Bandits is a full length novel set in the world of DayZ. It’s a work of fiction that is a culmination of both my experiences and the experiences of people I’ve interviewed in DayZ. The first draft is currently at 95,000 words with the Act 1 sample provided coming in at 28,000 words – so it’s going to be big! I’ve been a writer for over seventeen years - writing novels, screenplays and television. This is my first Zombie fiction novel which my wife hopes will finally purge my constant discussions about the impending zombie apocalypse.

Cherno Journo is my DayZ ingame name and my pen name for this project. This is a standard edition of the DayZ novel without any bells and whistles unlike the previous campaign for the special edition.

The eBook version of Survivors & Bandits will be out before Christmas and will be a great gift for any DayZ fan. At this stage I can’t confirm a release date for the print versions as that will depend on contributor numbers and the printer’s deadlines. I know that if I wasn’t writing it I’d love it as a Christmas present so I’ll try my hardest to get all perks out for Christmas.

Samples

Downloadable samples of the first 120 pages for all major eBook readers can be found here. If your format isn't here then please let me know - I have tried to cover as many as possible.

If you are not sure about what format you need for your own device, consult Wikipedia to find it.

 

PDF (Almost all eReaders support PDF)

Kindle, Goole Play Books, (mobi reader format)

iBooks, Nook, Kobo (ePub Format)

 

Perks

$1 - Empty Tin Can

Although underrated in DayZ, the Empty Tin Can does allow you to distract Zeds.  Throw enough of them and you can kill one. This is the 'cool story bro' perk – if it took you three hours to read the sample that’s $0.33 per hour of entertainment. I’ll also send every Tin Can perk contributor a Cherno Journo DayZ wallpaper for their computer.

 

  $5 - Empty Whisky Bottle

I love how these can break a Survivor’s legs. The empty whisky bottle perk is the basic eBook, in the format of your choosing. You get the entire Survivors & Bandits novel to read while roaming the woods of Chernarus. 

 

$30 – Soda Can

Snap, hiss gulp… ahhhhh - thirst satisfied. The Soda Can perk is the paperback copy of Survivors & Bandits, shipped to your home. Shipping is included so I’m hoping I get more people from the US, Europe and Australia contributing and less people from the Galapagos Islands! You’ll also have a Cherno Journo DayZ wallpaper emailed to you.

  

So hurry up and take my money

Woah, not so fast! I want to give you something for free first. I’ve worked with my editor of over ten years on the first Act of the novel. This sample I’m giving you for free - so read it and then decide if you like the project enough to pre-order. The links are at the top and in the next section and I’ve covered off all the major eBook formats. If there’s a different format you’d like then let me know and I’ll see if I can create it for you.

There are just three things to remember with the free sample;

- It’s only a draft so anything could change - although I do doubt it as the whole first draft novel is done, but the thing about DayZ is that it’s brutal. I might need to kill off existing characters and introduce some new characters.

 - It’s the first Act. There is a lot of getting to know the characters. If you don’t know them then you can’t care about them, so I need to give you their backstory. Lots of the action, the vehicles and the really messed up stuff that DayZ is known for occurs in the second and third Acts.

 - It’s only the first 120 pages and full of spoilers. Act 1 ends on a small climax but the story is far from resolved and many questions are left unanswered. I recommend you read as much as you need to make a decision and then stop - save the surprises for your final read of the whole novel. 

Samples

Sample of the first 120 pages can be found here.

PDF (Almost all eReaders support PDF)

Kindle, Goole Play Books, (mobi reader format)

iBooks, Nook, Kobo (ePub Format)

 

Love The Novel but Strapped for Cash - Then Let the World Know (not the cash part of course)

I hope you’ve enjoyed reading the sample as much as I’ve enjoyed writing it. If you do, then share the love! Let all your DayZ friends and fans of Zombie fiction know. Send the sample to anyone. It is copyrighted so you can’t take any part of it and reproduce it, but I give you my permission to share the whole file, unedited, with the world.

There's also all the usual social media channels. I’m on all of them, so we can tweet #DayZNovel @Cherno_Journo, you can 'Like me' or subscribe to my YouTube channel. I’d love to hear what you think.

Or find me ingame and let’s talk on 'direct'. Just remember I’m friendly, I’ve never killed a person as Cherno Journo even when I’ve been fired upon.

TL;DR  Awesome DayZ Novel. Read the Sample and judge for yourself.
