story:
Summary

Matthew 4 – As Jesus was walking beside the Sea of Galilee, he saw two brothers, Simon called Peter and his brother Andrew. They were casting a net into the lake, for they were fishermen. “Come, follow me,” Jesus said, “and I will send you out to fish for people.” At once they left their nets and followed him.

Fuse Concerts was founded by Brian and Andrea Sawyer for the sole purpose to expand the Kingdom of God through the gifts of song and spoken word. The ministry is completely, top to bottom, staffed by volunteers with NO salaries.  It is a not-for-profit organization (5013c has been submitted and awaiting approval). All of the financial risk falls directly onto Brian and Andrea. Why are they doing this? Simply put, because God asked them to. In Matthew God asked Peter and Andrew to drop your nets and follow Him. They didn’t say, let me pray about it or can I get back to you in a few days?  No, they IMMEDIATELY dropped their nets and followed Jesus. This is what Brian and Andrea have done with Fuse Christian Concerts. They are walking out their faith.

What We Need & What You Get

My goal by running the Amica half marathon is to provide Fuse Concerts with at least $10,000 in financial support. In return you have the ability to invest in the Kingdom of God and a Christ-centered ministry that is spreading the Good News throughout New England.

The Impact

  • God continues to be glorified through the Fuse ministry
  • Hearts are transformed and lives changed
  • Souls are won for the Kingdom of God

Testimony from the 2012 FuseFest: David Frey from Sidewalk Prophets led the Director of Security for the Pawtucket Red Sox to the Lord and the angels in heaven rejoiced.

Other Ways You Can Help

First and foremost, pray, pray, and pray some more. As the Fuse ministry grows we will no doubt encounter the schemes of the wicked. Pray for discernment. Patience to wait for God’s plan to be revealed and the resources to keep the Fuse ministry running strong.

Secondly, purchase tickets to the Fuse ministry events. The sooner you purchase tickets the better. As you might imagine running events like ConnectFest require a great deal of money upfront for deposits and equipment rentals. So the sooner that tickets are purchased relieves a great deal of stress from the ministry. Since we are a not-for-profit we will do our best to contain costs and offer you affordable events where you can express your love of Jesus Christ.

story:
The Official book cover for "Cosmic Callisto Caprica & The Missing Rings Of Saturn" The cover was provided by Maya Kern 

Cosmo and her friends,(from right to left) Vicki, Patty and Martha.
Art provided by Kristin Murphy

Cosmo is a bright young lady who loves to solve mysteries! She lives on the moon and she's studing to be a space detective. The Rings Of Saturn will be here first case as a space detective.

The setting for my story is retro futuristic with elements of the 1950's but in space. Oh did I mention that  there are martians in the story and that they face discrimination.

You can read an excerpt from "Cosmic Callisto Caprica & The Missing Rings Of Saturn" here

What We Need & Why

 

  Art provided by Catia Moreia
Is there anything more worse than reading a story with tons of spelling errors and huge grammar issues!?!? By hiring an editor to look over my story I can present a well polished story to you. Copyrighting my story will ensure that I will have full ownership of everything that I have written down.
What the heck is an ISBN you ask. An ISBN is a book number. It helps book stores to identify a book. A title alone is not enough. Every book has one. Having my own purchased ISBN instead of having one assigned to me will give me more ownership of my works.
What's In it for You!
Super Cool Space Swag

story:
Martial Arts and Budo

I love the martial arts, and I have a particular passion for Japanese martial arts, or budo. I've been doing budo, both modern and classical, in the US and Japan, for 30 years. Even with the internet though, really good information on the traditions, training and thinking in martial arts is hard to find.

After 3 decades training in the US and Japan doing Kodokan Judo, Shinto Muso Ryu Jo, Muso Jikiden Eishin Ryu Iai and Shinto Hatakage Ryu Iai Heiho, I've started to explore the world of martial arts practice though in my writings. My goal with this campaign is to publish an anthology of essays that will be be worth reading for anyone who is interested in martial arts, whether beginning student or seasoned veteran. I want to help people find quality information about the martial arts.I love budo and believe martial arts training can benefit anyone. I want to share the beauty and power and incredible potential for development that martial arts practice offers.

Contributing to this project will make solid, accurate information about the martial arts available to help counter the wealth of garage circulating on the internet. The essays provide more than just answers. They are built around good questions to ask yourself when exploring the martial arts and their meaning. What is the purpose of martial arts practice? What qualities are we trying to develop in our arts and in ourselves?

The book will include the following essays:

  • Do You Have To Study In Japan To Understand Budo
  • Etiquette: Form And Sincerity In Budo
  • Sensei, Kyoshi, Hanshi, Shihan: Budo titles and how to use them, or rather, how not to use them
  • What Is Martial Arts Rank?
  • Zanshin
  • Do vs. Jutsu (道対術）
  • What Kata Isn't
  • Trust In the Dojo
  • Training, Motivation And Counting TrainingTime In Decades Instead Of Years
  • The Most Effective Martial Art
  • The Dojo As The World: Learning To Deal With Violence And Power
  • Budo And Responsibility
  • Investing In Failure
  • The Spirit Of Learning
  • Training Hard And Training Well Are Not The Same Thing
  • When It Comes to Training, Fast Is Slow And Slow Is Fast
  • Getting Out Of The Comfort Zone
  • There Are No Advanced Techniques
  • The Most Essential Principles In Budo: Structure
  • The Most Essential Principles In Budo 2: Spacing
  • The Most Essential Principles In Budo 3: Timing
  • The Only Things I Teach Are How To Walk And How To Breathe
  • Budo Expectations And Realities: Understanding The Limits Of What We Study
  • Will Budo Training Make Me A Better Person
  • Budo Professionalism
  • Budo Training And Budo Philosophy
  • How To Adapt An Art To Fit You
  • Is Kata Too Rigid And Mechanical



+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++


How are we going to do this?

The difficult part is that publishing costs money. This is where you can help, and get something in return. First, the totals:

  • Editing. Making a professional book requires professional editing. Professional editing is going to run around $1,250.

  • Professional cover. Designing book covers is not something we learn while writing or hanging out in the dojo. I would like to have a great cover design so you're not embarrassed to have people see you with this great book. $500

  • Publishing the books is the single biggest cost. To do paperback and ebook with photographs will run about $4,500

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this page with anyone you know who is interested in the martial arts. I sincerely hope this book with contribute to growing a healthy, active and knowledgeable martial arts community.

Please share this on Facebook, Twitter and other social media.

About The Author

The Budo Bum is better known as Peter Boylan  He has been been training in Japanese martial arts since 1986.  He started in Kodokan Judo, where he has attained the rank of sandan.

While living in Japan in the 1990s, he stumbled upon the classical Japanese martial arts of Iaido and Jodo.  He began practicing Muso Jikiden Eishin Ryu Iaido with Takada Shigeo Sensei in 1993, and started learning Shinto Hatakage Ryu Iai Heiho from Kiyama Hiroshi Sensei in 1998.  He is currently focusing on Shinto Hatakage Ryu Iai Heiho.  While practicing these koryu arts, he has also trained in the Seitei Iaido of the All Japan Kendo Federation, reaching the rank of godan (5th degree black belt). Kiyama Sensei has licensed Peter to award certification in Shinto Muso Ryu.

In 1994 he was able to start training in Shinto Muso Ryu Jodo and the standard jo kata of the All Japan Kendo Federation with Tatsuro Hashimoto Sensei and Matsuda Shihan.  Since then he has reached the rank of yondan in the Kendo Federation standard jo kata.  He is also the translator of the English edition of the book “Jodo” by Yoneno Kotaro and Hiroi Tsunetsugu. He has received the Shomokuroku license in Shinto Muso Ryu from Kaminoda Tsunemori.

After living in Japan for 6 1/2 years, he moved back to the USA in 1999.  He returns to Japan at least once a year to train with his teachers and get advanced instruction.

story:
MY STORY ---I spent over nine years flying for the U.S. Air Force, most of them onboard a flying gas station called a KC-135 refueling jet. See pictures of the inside and outside of the plane here. 

I'm a military veteran who attended the University of California at Berkeley on an Air Force ROTC scholarship. After graduating and becoming a military officer, I love being part of an aircrew and later an instructor navigator. I have lived on and visited four continents. As I speak at events around the country, I am often asked about that part of my life. My three young children and their friends also love to hear the stories of my life in the military. 

My team and I have created an Amazon bestseller, a book that is now in the process of securing a production deal to become a documentary. It also received three different honors at the International Latino Book Awards in New York City. This Amazon bestseller is titled "Latinnovating: Green American Jobs and the Latinos Creating Them." This book was launched in 2011 at Stanford University at the Silicon Valley Latino Leadership Summit. This first book has led to many invitations to speak around the country. It has helped me build a huge network of supporters of the unique content produced by our small publishing company, Gracefully Global Group LLC. This will be our first children's book!

With a career as a professional product marketer in my tool belt, I look forward to leading the strong marketing push for "Good Night Captain Mama" as I have done for Latinnovating. As the mother of three who all attended our local Parent Participation Preschool where I worked once a week, I have seven years of direct experience reading to children ages three through six, the intended audience for this book. We have set up a basic website for this new book that you can see here:  http://www.goodnightcaptainmama.com/ My author biography is here: http://www.latinnovating.com/index.php?p=graciela-tiscareno-sato

 

WHY IT'S IMPORTANT TO ME --Getting this first children’s book funded is important to me for three reasons: 

First, this book (and the series I’ve planned out) was inspired by a conversation with my preschool-aged son the first time he saw me wearing my military flight suit. It was the night before a Veterans Day event at his sisters’ elementary school. My curious child ripped the Velcro-attached patches from my flight suit one at a time, and asked about the meaning of each. As I answered his questions in the simplest language possible, I wondered how many other children share his curiosity about the colorful military uniforms and insignia they see on TV, at parades, on military installations and elsewhere. When he said “Good Night Captain Mama,” I knew I had to write this book.

Second, I researched available books for children about military service and found there are hardly any that speak to the youngest child, the preschool to kindergarten population. I see a need for this book in our nation’s preschools and kindergarten classrooms, so that Veterans Day means something to them besides a day off.

As one of the few Latinas that has ever worn a military flight suit in service to this nation, I want to use this book to shine a bright spotlight on the many Latinas serving in today’s military. They must be recognized for their service and sacrifice, because they can then serve as much-needed role models for today’s modern young Latinas

The books I did find during my research were mostly NOT written by veterans. I feel very strongly that a book written by a mother who is also a veteran would sell very well, because it simply is more authentic coming from first-hand experience. My hope is that in sharing the 800 words of this children's book with young kids, they can begin to appreciate the unique pride associated with military service in the USA.

Lastly, applying lessons learned from creating and launching our first book, we want to have all production costs funded ahead of launch for our first children’s book. These startup funds will cover the cost of hiring the illustrator, the layout and design team, the initial print run and very importantly, the marketing campaign and launch tour which will be national in scope. We are planning to launch this unique children’s book in Washington D.C. at an important military memorial on a key holiday.

 

WHAT YOU ARE HELPING TO CREATE AS A SUPPORTER --By funding this campaign, you will bring an important contribution to our nation’s preschools, kindergarten classrooms and homes. For subsequent years as the children celebrate Veterans Day, teachers and parents will have a sweet, simple, highly visual story to tell through the Good Night Captain Mama book you are helping to create!

 

WHAT IF WE DON’T REACH THE ENTIRE GOAL? –Should we fall short of the $40,000 goal, the funds we will receive will pay for all production costs (cost of illustrations, cover design, layout, proofs, etc) so that a physical product will come to exist. We will simply order a smaller initial print run of books and start taking preorders sooner to be able to produce more books to get into national distribution with existing wholesale partners. We will scale down our launch tour plans to fit the smaller budget.

 

The Impact--If you help fund Captain Mama, you’ll be joining a winning team. See, I’m not a newbie author anymore; we have created an Amazon bestseller, a book that is now in the process of securing a production deal to become a documentary AND a three-time award winner at the International Latino Book Awards in New York City. We will not rest until this book too becomes a bestseller and an award winner. YOU will know that you were there in the very beginning making it all possible! If you’ve never had bragging rights that you helped to fund a bestselling, award-winning book, here’s your chance!


Other Ways You Can Help--Text for Your Social Networks.  If you can't support this project with funds, can you please invite your social networks to take a look at the rewards and participate? Can you please post/email the following text to groups and friends? 

On Facebook: My friend and award-winning author Graciela Tiscareno-Sato is crowd sourcing a very creative and sweet children’s book called “Good Night Captain Mama.” She’s got some terrific and original rewards for you if you participate. Will you please visit www.indiegogo.com/CaptainMama, learn more and support this future bestseller?

On Twitter? Here’s text to tweet:  Support a future bestselling children’s book by award-winning author @GraceTiscareno, get cool rewards!  www.indiegogo.com/CaptainMama

Any noise and buzz you can make to inform people about our campaign would be greatly appreciated. If you let me know what you did that resulted in someone supporting and funding us, you'll get yourself a gift as a way for us to say thank you! Please remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!
story_txt:
MY STORY ---I spent over nine years flying for the U.S. Air Force, most of them onboard a flying gas station called a KC-135 refueling jet. See pictures of the inside and outside of the plane here. 
I'm a military veteran who attended the University of California at Berkeley on an Air Force ROTC scholarship. After graduating and becoming a military officer, I love being part of an aircrew and later an instructor navigator. I have lived on and visited four continents. As I speak at events around the country, I am often asked about that part of my life. My three young children and their friends also love to hear the stories of my life in the military.   My team and I have created an Amazon bestseller, a book that is now in the process of securing a production deal to become a documentary. It also received three different honors at the International Latino Book Awards in New York City. This Amazon bestseller is titled "Latinnovating: Green American Jobs and the Latinos Creating Them." This book was launched in 2011 at Stanford University at the Silicon Valley Latino Leadership Summit. This first book has led to many invitations to speak around the country. It has helped me build a huge network of supporters of the unique content produced by our small publishing company, Gracefully Global Group LLC. This will be our first children's book!
With a career as a professional product marketer in my tool belt, I look forward to leading the strong marketing push for "Good Night Captain Mama" as I have done for Latinnovating. As the mother of three who all attended our local Parent Participation Preschool where I worked once a week, I have seven years of direct experience reading to children ages three through six, the intended audience for this book. We have set up a basic website for this new book that you can see here:  http://www.goodnightcaptainmama.com/ My author biography is here: http://www.latinnovating.com/index.php?p=graciela-tiscareno-sato
 
WHY IT'S IMPORTANT TO ME --Getting this first children’s book funded is important to me for three reasons: 
First, this book (and the series I’ve planned out) was inspired by a conversation with my preschool-aged son the first time he saw me wearing my military flight suit. It was the night before a Veterans Day event at his sisters’ elementary school. My curious child ripped the Velcro-attached patches from my flight suit one at a time, and asked about the meaning of each. As I answered his questions in the simplest language possible, I wondered how many other children share his curiosity about the colorful military uniforms and insignia they see on TV, at parades, on military installations and elsewhere. When he said “Good Night Captain Mama,” I knew I had to write this book.
Second, I researched available books for children about military service and found there are hardly any that speak to the youngest child, the preschool to kindergarten population. I see a need for this book in our nation’s preschools and kindergarten classrooms, so that Veterans Day means something to them besides a day off.
As one of the few Latinas that has ever worn a military flight suit in service to this nation, I want to use this book to shine a bright spotlight on the many Latinas serving in today’s military. They must be recognized for their service and sacrifice, because they can then serve as much-needed role models for today’s modern young Latinas
The books I did find during my research were mostly NOT written by veterans. I feel very strongly that a book written by a mother who is also a veteran would sell very well, because it simply is more authentic coming from first-hand experience. My hope is that in sharing the 800 words of this children's book with young kids, they can begin to appreciate the unique pride associated with military service in the USA.
Lastly, applying lessons learned from creating and launching our first book, we want to have all production costs funded ahead of launch for our first children’s book. These startup funds will cover the cost of hiring the illustrator, the layout and design team, the initial print run and very importantly, the marketing campaign and launch tour which will be national in scope. We are planning to launch this unique children’s book in Washington D.C. at an important military memorial on a key holiday.
 
WHAT YOU ARE HELPING TO CREATE AS A SUPPORTER --By funding this campaign, you will bring an important contribution to our nation’s preschools, kindergarten classrooms and homes. For subsequent years as the children celebrate Veterans Day, teachers and parents will have a sweet, simple, highly visual story to tell through the Good Night Captain Mama book you are helping to create!
 
WHAT IF WE DON’T REACH THE ENTIRE GOAL? –Should we fall short of the $40,000 goal, the funds we will receive will pay for all production costs (cost of illustrations, cover design, layout, proofs, etc) so that a physical product will come to exist. We will simply order a smaller initial print run of books and start taking preorders sooner to be able to produce more books to get into national distribution with existing wholesale partners. We will scale down our launch tour plans to fit the smaller budget.
 
The Impact--If you help fund Captain Mama, you’ll be joining a winning team. See, I’m not a newbie author anymore; we have created an Amazon bestseller, a book that is now in the process of securing a production deal to become a documentary AND a three-time award winner at the International Latino Book Awards in New York City. We will not rest until this book too becomes a bestseller and an award winner. YOU will know that you were there in the very beginning making it all possible! If you’ve never had bragging rights that you helped to fund a bestselling, award-winning book, here’s your chance!

Other Ways You Can Help--Text for Your Social Networks.  If you can't support this project with funds, can you please invite your social networks to take a look at the rewards and participate? Can you please post/email the following text to groups and friends? 
On Facebook: My friend and award-winning author Graciela Tiscareno-Sato is crowd sourcing a very creative and sweet children’s book called “Good Night Captain Mama.” She’s got some terrific and original rewards for you if you participate. Will you please visit www.indiegogo.com/CaptainMama, learn more and support this future bestseller?
On Twitter? Here’s text to tweet:  Support a future bestselling children’s book by award-winning author @GraceTiscareno, get cool rewards!  www.indiegogo.com/CaptainMama
Any noise and buzz you can make to inform people about our campaign would be greatly appreciated. If you let me know what you did that resulted in someone supporting and funding us, you'll get yourself a gift as a way for us to say thank you! Please remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
This is an idea that has been close to my heart for a very long time.

From a personal aspect, there was a time when I never understood the concepts of mental health. It’s very easy to say or do something wrong when that understanding isn’t there. As I have grown seeing those closest to me suffer from anxiety, depression, OCD, and a whole host of other mental health issues, it has made me want to write these children’s stories to create awareness and I hope that with your help, it will be possible to spread this message as far as I am able.

Mental health has always been a taboo subject that people don’t seem to be willing to discuss. People don’t feel like they can open up about their issues and those that do can feel marginalised which can lead them to say nothing more. I want to be a part of the movement that’s opening up the floor and saying: “We need to start talking about this now”.

This is the grand scale dream.

A basis of understanding is needed right from our development stages. A basis that allows for both awareness of oneself and understanding of others that could be suffering. These issues need to take centre stage at an earlier level in order to break its archaic and needless taboo, allowing for an emotional and mentally aware society.

This collection contains 7 short stories, each aiming to open up the conversation around an aspect of mental health, from anxiety and panic disorders to depression, written in an accessible way for children (or adults) through character and story arch to hopefully encourage an enriched emotional development. These stories are written and I plan to self-publish them on the amazon kindle platform at the beginning of March. The money raised here will go towards the promotional material needed to spread the message.

There are battles people are going through that you may never suspect. I’ve written these stories to try and do my part for the people who are suffering. For the people that don’t think they are good enough or don’t understand what’s happening to them. For those silently coming face to face with their mortality and wondering why. I would just like to say that you are loved. You are needed. And even at your weakest, there is a strength in you that can be found when the nights look their bleakest.

 

What will the money help with?

The money gained from this campaign will be used towards promotional materials:

  • Flyers
  • Posters
  • T-shirts and hoodies
  • Prints
  • Physical copies of the book

I will also be putting together a street team to help me promote around Hull, Leeds and York city centres.  I plan on reaching out to the local cafes, bookshops and restaurants in the area to identify any sort of partnership that could be created to help spread awareness (even if it's as little as having my flyers on the side for people to pick up on their premises). This list includes:

  • Cafe Gelato
  • The english muse
  • The Board Room
  • Zebra
  • Scribes
  • Madisons
  • Tessie's
  • Zoo Cafe
  • Cafe One 11
  • Lydia's
  • The Boathouse
  • Pie
  • Waterstones (Hull City Centre)
  • WHSmiths (Hull City Centre)

It is the beginning of what will be an ongoing process and any help would be deeply appreciated.

Please don't forget to check out the list of perks I have put together.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

There are also plenty of other ways you can help, the main one being simply to spread the word. Please feel free to share this campaign on your facebooks or recommend it to your friends and family if you believe it is something they would be interested in.

Don't forget to follow me on Twitter to get regular updates on my progress! It's a new twitter so I don't have many followers at the moment so please come keep me company.

https://twitter.com/Reckless_Winter

story:
About the Book

Dawkin: A Tall Tale is a science fiction western novel that takes place in 1887, in an alternate universe America. The story follows a young alien farmer and his bull mastiff who must travel across the U.S. to save the love of his life!

My name is Massimo Marchiano and I am the author of Dawkin: A Tall Tale. I wrote this book in dedication to my dog, Diesel, who passed away from cancer in 2016. I’ve always had an idea for an adventure book in my head, but it was not until after his passing the idea really started forming in my mind. I also wrote this because after growing up and seeing so many sequels, reboots, remasters and remakes, I feel that you, the reader, deserve an original story.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will have fun and discover the importance of friendship. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to escape from the real world and enjoy a wholesome story about friends trying to reach a common goal. You will learn alongside Dawkin, the titular protagonist, that the need for others is a very important one.

The story: In an alternate universe, arable farmland is less abundant while oil is closer to the surface, making it easier to extract and use. While this has led to technological advances, it has not made life easier for those trying to survive. In 1869, things become more difficult when an alien race known as the Void crashes on Earth. Although humans and Void get along peacefully for the most part, tensions run high between them. The story follows a young Void who loses his family in a tragic incident in his childhood. He is then saved by a human, who teaches him how to farm, survive, and live life on Earth. Eventually, the young Void names himself after the human who raised him, Dawkin. During his years at the farm, Dawkin tames the magnificent beast, Brutus, a bullmastiff who plays an important role in the story. Dawkin even falls in love with the farmer's daughter and gets his blessing to ask for her hand in marriage. But, when a mysterious tragedy occurs, he and his dog embark on an adventure of a lifetime.

​Reasons I think you will like this book!

  • It’s a story of adventure, where the characters experience beauty through overcoming adversity.
  • Dog owners will love the dynamic duo that is Dawkin and his dog, Brutus.
  • The Alternate Universe setting makes the story more unique in many areas (mannerisms, clothing, geography, creatures, etc.).
  • Science Fiction fans will like the alien race, as well as their backstory.
  • Western/Frontier fans will enjoy the use of real locations, setting, and dialogue between characters.

Dawkin: A Tall Tale speaks to dog owners and adventure lovers who understand how important the need for others is. We may think we have things under control, but in reality, we are helpless without those around us.

Ultimately, I hope that Dawkin: A Tall Tale inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

  • There are times I think I can do it all on my own, but is that really the truth in life?
  • What lengths would I go to for the people I care for? Is it really best to push away those who care for me?
  • How can we reach our own goals in life by helping those around us?

I am interested in exploring and discussing these questions and more with my readers! I think these questions can open our eyes to realize the value in those around us.

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2020
  •  The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this winter

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book.
  • Your name will appear in a Special Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).
  •  Early access to the Introduction of my book and some additional sections of my manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • The opportunity to give me feedback before the book is published.
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book.

And more...

About the Author

Massimo Marchiano earned his bachelor’s degree Magna Cum Laude in Media Studies and Production from Temple University in May 2020. While COVID-19 has affected the job market and his plans to move west to a bigger media industry, Massimo spends his time as a freelance videographer and camera operator, producing promotional videos for local businesses.

Massimo wrote this book as a tribute to his dog, Diesel, who passed away in 2016 from cancer. He also wrote this book because, after growing up and seeing so many sequels, reboots, remakes, and remasters, he believes that you, the reader, deserve something original.

By day, Massimo is a pencil-pushing content creator who has directed, hosted, produced, written, and acted in multiple projects. By night, he’s a video-game playing, manga-reading, meme enthusiast just looking for inspiration to share with others.

For more information you can connect with Massimo at masmarch97@gmail.com and on the following social media platforms:
Instagram - https://www.instagram.com/massimo_author/
Twitter - https://twitter.com/massimoM_author
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished product to the backer, specifically in mailing the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies into the campaign within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. Please use #DawkinATallTale and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Massimo Marchiano

story:
The mystery behind our new children’s book.

Who’s the family in that strange clip from the Secret Passages show? It’s us! David and Kelly Sopp, and our boy. We have a little company called Wry Baby, and we’re the authors of several best-selling books including Safe Baby Handling Tips, Safe Baby Pregnancy Tips, and The New Parents Fun Book. And now, we're excited to reveal our newest children's book, "A Future just for You."

After years of researching (okay, stalking) the great baby mystic Mysterio on his travels, we have just completed our story about the living legend. In this enchanting picture book, we reveal how Mysterio uses the incredible mental powers of his mind to predict children's destinies for curious parents. You’ll love turning each page of this magically illustrated tale. How does the story end? Let’s just say that Mysterio has a prediction for YOUR child's future, too.

Perhaps you already know about Mysterio from his popular, future-predicting baby T-shirts (see the Perks below!). Or maybe you are discovering Mysterio’s mystical powers for the very first time today. Either way, we hope you'll become a part of his story by supporting the first printing of "A Future Just for You!"


Take a peek inside...

"A Future Just for You!" is a 28-page paperback book featuring pen and ink illustration by David Sopp. The book was conjured up by David and Kelly and written in a whimsical, poetic style that children love. Your support helps us afford the sheet-fed, litho printing (not cheapo digital printing) of 3,000 books in the USA.



Why are successful, published authors doing a crowdfunding campaign?

Because "A Future Just for You!" is the debut book being published and marketed by just little ol' us. Why? We wanted greater freedom to be truly original – creating a unique story we believe folks will really enjoy. Unfortunately, small companies like ours don't have access to tons of capital like the big guys do (everything we make is completely self-funded). 

Your support supplements our first offset printing of 3,000 copies. Contributions above and beyond our goal will be used for marketing expenses so that curious parents everywhere can get to know the legend of Mysterio. Not to mention, discover their child’s amazing destiny!

As if discovering your child’s destiny from an ancient manuscript conveyed by a great mystic isn’t enough... 

Yes, there's way more. We're thanking our fun supporters (both individual fans and retailers) by offering all kinds of other exclusive, magical perks! So if you're trying to decide whether to buy a peppermint chocolate latte today or help fund our book, think no further! That latte may deliver 400 delicious calories, but it will not predict your child's amazing future! 


The Mystic Chart to Completion!


Un-Foreseen Metaphysical Forces!?

Fret not, friends! 3,000 books are being printed, no matter what level of funding we receive. Mysterio's amazing baby shirts are already made and waiting to be levitated into a shipping box. So all books and perks are expected to ship to our supporters on December 15th.  Could a celestial phenomena occur that delays your shipment? Sure, however Mysterio does not foresee that. 



Thanks from the bottom of Mysterio's silken robes.

Inspiration and originality depend on people like you. Thank you for supporting a creative idea and helping us bring the pages out of that dark, musty cave and into the light. We are are forever appreciative.

Even if you can't support our new book financially, you can support us socially! Please Tweet, Pin, Like and Share our efforts on your favorite forms of social media. Good karma will surely surround you!
story_txt:
The mystery behind our new children’s book.
Who’s the family in that strange clip from the Secret Passages
show? It’s us! David and Kelly Sopp, and our boy. We have a little company
called Wry Baby, and we’re the authors of several best-selling books including Safe Baby Handling Tips, Safe
Baby Pregnancy Tips, and The New
Parents Fun Book. And now, we're excited to reveal our newest children's book, "A Future just for You."

After years of researching (okay, stalking) the great
baby mystic Mysterio on his travels, we have just completed our story about the living legend. In this enchanting picture book, we reveal how Mysterio
uses the incredible mental powers of his mind to predict children's destinies for curious parents. You’ll love turning each page of this magically illustrated tale. How
does the story end? Let’s just say that Mysterio has a prediction for YOUR child's future, too.



Perhaps you already know about Mysterio from his popular, future-predicting
baby T-shirts (see the Perks below!). Or maybe you are discovering Mysterio’s mystical powers for the
very first time today. Either way, we hope you'll become a part of his story by supporting the first printing of "A Future Just for You!"


Take a peek inside...
"A Future Just for You!" is a 28-page paperback book featuring pen and ink illustration by David Sopp. The book was conjured up by David and Kelly and written in a whimsical, poetic style that children love. Your support helps us afford the sheet-fed, litho printing (not cheapo digital printing) of 3,000 books in the USA.








Why are successful, published authors doing a crowdfunding campaign?
Because "A Future Just for You!" is the debut book being published and marketed by just little ol' us. Why? We wanted greater freedom to be truly original – creating a unique story we believe folks will really enjoy. Unfortunately, small companies like ours don't have access to tons of capital like the big guys do (everything we make is completely self-funded). 
Your support supplements our first offset printing of 3,000 copies. Contributions above and beyond our
goal will be used for marketing expenses so that curious parents everywhere can
get to know the legend of Mysterio. Not to mention, discover their
child’s amazing destiny!
As if discovering your child’s destiny from an ancient manuscript conveyed by a great mystic isn’t
enough... 
Yes, there's way more. We're thanking our fun supporters (both individual fans and retailers) by offering all kinds of other exclusive, magical perks! So if you're trying to decide whether to buy a peppermint chocolate latte today or help fund our book, think no further! That latte may deliver 400 delicious calories, but it will not predict your child's amazing future! 












The Mystic Chart to Completion!




Un-Foreseen Metaphysical Forces!?  
Fret not, friends! 3,000 books are being printed, no matter what level of funding we receive. Mysterio's amazing baby shirts are already made and waiting to be levitated into a shipping box. So all books and perks are expected to ship to our supporters on December 15th.  Could a celestial phenomena occur that delays your shipment? Sure, however Mysterio does not foresee that. 
  Thanks from the bottom of Mysterio's silken robes. 
Inspiration and originality depend on people like you. Thank you for supporting a creative idea and helping us bring the pages out of that dark, musty cave and into the light. We are are forever appreciative.Even if you can't support our new book financially, you can support us socially! Please Tweet, Pin, Like and Share our efforts on your favorite forms of social media. Good karma will surely surround you!

story:
Sunday, April 3, 2016  -----  We've reached my goal, thanks to our awesome “crowd” of 231! Thanks to each of you for your generous support. The campaign now remains "In Demand" so that you can still donate or choose any of the perks here.  Need a book for someone else? An art print of a journal entry that’s made on a letterpress? I’m still accepting donations because my original goal and budget didn't include  Indiegogo’s administrative fee (5%) or the Paypal or credit card fees. So, funds raised above the goal will help cover these and marketing for the book.

Now, on to tell you about my project!...

The Far Field Stories Project started when my father, Ken Hypki, rediscovered his 1952 farm journal, kept the first full year that he and my mother Roberta embarked on the dream that brought them together. The journal chronicles an almost forgotten piece of American history that helped shape the country, as returning WWII veterans were encouraged to start farms with GI loans from the federal government.

For Pa, as a first generation Polish immigrant, to own land was an opportunity of epic proportions. And so, on Far Field Farm, Wisconsin, these two intrepid “city kids” staked their claim to a small, hilly, rocky piece of the American dream with 12 dairy cows. Sixty-five years later, and still on the farm, they have come to love and respect the land that they call home. My project is a book about that story and I need your help to finish writing it this year.

The Far Field Stories will be a mosaic of photographs, stories and nuggets I call “prize gems”from Pa's journal. I hope it will inspire others with the values and life lessons from my parents that have held me in good stead to this day: overcoming hardship, living with uncertainty, cultivating hope, helping neighbors and working hard. My travels, studies and life in Baltimore City have lent me a perspective from which I see that Ma and Pa’s reverence for the earth and wise stewardship of the land are important concepts to be lived now, at a time of global environmental crisis. I believe these ideas have broad appeal to city folk, country folk, or those like me with one foot in each of those worlds.

For 10 years, I’ve been trying to write this book in the cracks between making a living as a community artist, nonprofit consultant and teacher. I’m a third of the way through and I’ve set a goal to finish it in 2016! Would you help? Your contribution will give me time to write, to cover expenses and to actually publish the book! Please help me launch The Far Field Stories Project for those who love Far Field Farm, and for a new generation of farmers and doers and dreamers.

~To learn more about the project and my personal motivations for writing this book, visit my website: http://www.farfieldfarmstories.com . 
~To receive my short essays about Far Field Farm, nature conservation and the process of writing this book, Click Here to Follow My Blog .
 

What I Need & Where the Money Goes

My fundraising goal of $21,600 is broken down this way:

Funds raised above my original goal of $21,600 will go toward marketing costs for the book and the administrative fees charged by Indiegogo, your credit card company or PayPal.

The most important way to support this project after making a donation is to send an EMAIL to friends and to post it on Facebook!

 

PERKS:  You'll Receive Amazing Perks for Donating!

Perks are tokens of my appreciation for your donation at different levels. I've enjoyed creating beautiful thank-you gifts relating to the farm.

Once you click "CONTRIBUTE," you can enter any dollar amount you like. You are not limited by the dollar levels of the perks! NEED HELP? Don't let this site frustrate you! Contact me; I'll walk you through it!

Note: your donation is NOT tax-deductible.  It will go to me as an individual and I will be taxed on it as I would for any other income. The “perks” offered are thank-you gifts for donating at different levels. Their value is significantly less than the amount you donate. And that’s the whole point! The additional funds will enable me to WRITE and finish the book by the end of this year and publish soon thereafter. For example, if you make a $75 donation, you’ll receive a book when it is published, as a thank you for supporting my writing process. Once on the market, though, the cost of the book will be less than the $75 donation made to my campaign.

  • Challenges of the Project

    •  

    The biggest challenge for me is finding uninterrupted time to write. Writing does not come easily, and it takes me a long time to compose poems and stories. That makes it difficult to do in the midst of my busy Baltimore city life. Your donation will contribute to four months of focus, enabling me to “grind it out,”  to immerse myself in the project, to emerge with a manuscript and then publish it!

    Other Ways You Can Help

    There are many ways to contribute.

    • Help get the word out and make some noise about my campaign! Crowdfunding campaigns work when the multiplier effect kicks in and friends-of-friends start hearing about the project. Please use the Indiegogo share tools at the bottom of the page to spread the word!
    • Know people who "aren't computer-y sorts?  Have them contact me at far_field@me.com and I'd be happy to tell them about the project, send them info by regular mail and help them donate offline.
    • Do a  fundraiser for the book among your friends! I'd be happy to do a mini-reading from the book-in-progress for a group you bring together in Wisconsin or Maryland.
    • Send people to my website to learn more: http://www.farfieldfarmstories.com
    • Sign up for my blog at www.farfieldfarmstories.wordpress.com to receive updates and small essays about topics related to Far Field Farm.
    • If you have photos of Far Field Farm, especially older ones, please contact me!

    If you have problems using this site, contact me and I'll help you with the process: far_field@me.com .

story:
Short Summary

Have I got you hooked yet?
Want more?
Yes!
Then let's GOGO! bring this new book to market.

Today you are requested to embark on the next chapter of my self-publishing story with me. Some amazing students have already given the story of Lil' Phyllis Meets Her Book Fair Fairy an unanimous thumbs up. Also, I have there reviews written in their own hand. Lil' Phyllis seems to be the type of character readers want to see. The first book was a 32 page picture book with the story written in verse. Lil' Phyllis Meets Her Book Fair Fairy is a chapter book so it is a story told differently from the first. Hopefully, the readers can take it with them beyond their current grade level.

 

Wait a minute, I have go to stop to appreciate all those votes of confidence from all my original Indiegogo book project contributors from 2013. Also, I would like to take advantage of this platform, to give thanks to the Most High.  

Your help made "Lil' Phyllis Loves to Laff" really able to reach more readers. In addition, there were many teachers, librarians, moms and dads, and especially the bright enthusiastic students who have bought a copy to read, enjoyed, and share with it others. I Love you all.

Click image to view a reading of "Lil Phyllis Loves To Laff".

 

This Is What's Next
Now let's do it again. The next project is a chapter book with about 100 pages . 

"Lil' Phyllis Meets Her Book Fair Fairy"
Click to preview it here.​

Because "Lil' Phyllis Meets Her Book Fair Fairy" is a chapter book this time around, there are three times as many pages and a lot more words. I am excited to share this original tale with a fun plot line. It has been in the works for about two years. The story is written needs , but needs a little editing work. Calling all editors!

What We Need & What You Get


Whatever money we raise, I will also add to it from my personal moneys.

The goal is to raise $1,355.00 in 30 days!! However, the more money raised beyond the stated goal the more books that I am able to purchase. The reader gets a greater the value . That is because each copy of the book will cost less. 

Please see the Printer's quote in the price chart below:
Prices 9,25% Sales Tax NOT Included In Prices Below

$1,355.00 / 100 Qty. Books

$1,731.00 / 150 Qty. Books

$2,313.00 / 250 Qty. Books

$3,525.00 / 500 Qty. Books

$6,145.00 / 1,000 Qty. Books

The way printing works is the more prints one orders, the lower the final price. This is good for two reasons. First, the more books printed the better. Second, the less money it costs even better because You get more value.

In the  printer's quote above, it is easy to see how the price get better the more book I have printed. $1,355.00 is what we going for. But, remember, the more You all fund the better value for everyone.
For example, if together, we were to raise $6,145, each book would cost only about $6.
That is a great improvement on $13. per book printed. And better for the readers too.
The goal is to get the best quality printed book possible, yet get the best price possible for the customer. My Los Angeles based print shop provides both. Also, they give really good customer service to their clients. I want to be as transparent I can. So, I am showed You all how my printers actual quoted me for my print order for "Lil' Phyllis Meets Her Book Fair Fairy".

Wow, what a difference your contribution can make!
With Contributors that are passionate about this project and believe that it's more than possible, it will be easy to publish and share my new story.

We have done it before, so lets do it again. But better.

Thank You All.

Below are some other expenses associated with book publishing. However, the hoped for, $1,355.00 will ONLY covers 100 book prints. 


Professional copy-editing ( If you are one or know someone how is good at it, please reach out )
Copyright with Library of Congress
ISBNs
Book distribution
Promotion
Press release

I will be taking care of the above list 

Don't forget to check out my amazing Perks?!
These perks are my small way of saying thanks.
Just click the Perks tab to view them all.

The Impact

The of any creative work is not always predictable. But, fortunately, I see the impact publishing and sharing my books has had almost daily because I worked with students at an elementary school in San Diego, CA for over ten years.

Specifically because I worked in education, I was able to see how students respond to my book.  I saw the immediate impact of my first book, "Lil Phyllis Loves to Laff", which was first published in 2013. The children smiled and were excited about reading it and became more interested in writing themselves. Even today, I see that my book still challenges students to think and comprehend better. Also, my book has helped teachers to reach their students in different ways. I see how teachers have applied my book's theme to their Arts Integrated Curriculum. This is important to me because part of my Special Education duties were to be in the classroom helping students develop better reading skills, habits, and a love for learning from books.

You can make an impact as well with a contribution to my Indiegogo crowd funded campaign. I hope you fund my next book project and help me publish, print, and distribute my chapter book, "Lil' Phyllis Meets Her Book Fair Fairy".

Thanks!

Risks & Challenges

I only risk failure if I do not risk failure and do my best.

Other Ways You Can Help

Okay, Thanks to all you for bring to it! But if you just can not make a $ contribution ( which is completely understandable) but you still want to make an impact, here are some ways you can:

My book project is also seeking

  • Professional copy-editing ( If you are one or know someone how is good at it, please reach out )
  • Word of mouth ( Please share the link to my campaign )
  • Share! Share! Share!

And that's all there is to it.

Peace and Blessing Everyone.

story:
Resumen

 
  • Soy Cecilia Velasco, crítica literaria y gestora cultural, entrevistadora inquisitiva, bebedora social y cultora del arte del crochet y profesora de letras de larga data. Siempre me he movido en ambientes culturales, periódicos y revistas... Tras engendrar estrés y fatigas resultantes del escaso reconocimiento al trabajo intelectual, y un poco saturada de jefes y directores, he decidido crear una revista de mujeres (más los dispuestos a participar) críticas, destinada a todos los lectores ávidos de literatura y arte.
  • Quiero hacer una revista en línea en la que se aborden temas relacionados con la literatura, sobre todo (y sus vínculos con el arte moderno y el cine) de aquí, de allá y de todas partes desde una perspectiva que no rehuya la polémica ni el debate, sino que los alimente; una revista en la que hablar de género y feminismo sea un signo de modernidad y humanismo.
  • La ayuda de mis colaboradores posibilitará compartir con los lectores nuevas maneras de leer y de abordar críticamente la literatura, alejadas del status-quo y de las voces autorizadas de patriarcas jóvenes y viejos. Se posibilitará acceder a textos escritos por apasionadas lectoras y escritoras, por desenfadadas y audaces voces pertenecientes a todos los géneros.
  • Tan solo $500 de arranque servirá para solventar gastos, como pago de dominio, servidor y reconocimientos a colaboradores iniciales. Este rubro servirá para sustentar, inicialmente, tareas de investigación y producción de la revista.
  • Recompensaré a los colaboradores haciendo constar sus nombres en la revista como madrinas y madrinos fundadores. Con el tiempo y las aguas, y una vez consolidado el proyecto, habrá nuevas recompensas.
  • Si no logro reunir la cantidad deseada, con lo recaudado organizaré una mesa redonda con invitados especiales y todos quienes hayan colaborado con la campaña. 
  • Hace falta hablar de las artes de manera más académica, pero contemporánea. Las revistas locales tienen una aproximación superficial, y el discurso académico sólo se dirige a un público especializado. 
  • Impulsar un proyecto como este abrirá un espacio democrático, plural y humanista. Hablar de la palabra que reflexiona nos hace personas más inteligentes y argumentativas. 
  • Proyectos, como "La Palabra Encendida", en la que dialogaba con autores contemporáneos en vivo, recibió mucho público y fomentó la crítica especializada e independiente de cualquier círculo tradicional.
  • Este proyecto necesita de tu generosidad y fuerza. Con el suficiente apoyo, se puede convertir fácilmente en una realidad.
 

 

 

Riesgos y desafíos

 

El riesgo es permanente. Este no es un juego ni un hobby. El discurso y el mundo literario está encerrado entre los muros de una tradición atávica, y las novedades no despuntan. Necesitamos de crítica comprometida con asentar fundamentos, pero independientes de cualquier presión de los círculos de poder cultural. 

 

La posibilidad de fracasar es constante, por eso este apoyo es sólo un inicio para probar el valor de mi propuesta. Este es un emprendimiento nuevo para mí, en el que ofrezco mi nombre y credenciales. El éxito resguardará mi reputación; y el fracaso, el aprendizaje. La tarea que me propongo es constante. Repetiré los intentos de cualquier otra manera que incorpore pequeñas donaciones.

 

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

Si no puedes colaborar con dinero, me encantaría recibir tus artículos. Es importante que me envíes un resumen de máximo cien palabras a este correo: macevean@gmail.com. Puede tratarse de crítica literaria o artística a manera de ensayo, o un relato de ficción, o tu poesía, o tus cuadros, o fotografías, o vídeos, o música (2 min. máximo, con un enlace a una plataforma). 

También puedes ayudarme difundiendo mi campaña a través de tus redes sociales y círculos de amigos. Aprecio además tus opiniones –envíalas al e-mail escrito más arriba.

 

Y eso es todo.
story_txt:
Resumen 
Soy Cecilia Velasco, crítica literaria y gestora cultural, entrevistadora inquisitiva, bebedora social y cultora del arte del crochet y profesora de letras de larga data. Siempre me he movido en ambientes culturales, periódicos y revistas... Tras engendrar estrés y fatigas resultantes del escaso reconocimiento al trabajo intelectual, y un poco saturada de jefes y directores, he decidido crear una revista de mujeres (más los dispuestos a participar) críticas, destinada a todos los lectores ávidos de literatura y arte.
Quiero hacer una revista en línea en la que se aborden temas relacionados con la literatura, sobre todo (y sus vínculos con el arte moderno y el cine) de aquí, de allá y de todas partes desde una perspectiva que no rehuya la polémica ni el debate, sino que los alimente; una revista en la que hablar de género y feminismo sea un signo de modernidad y humanismo.
La ayuda de mis colaboradores posibilitará compartir con los lectores nuevas maneras de leer y de abordar críticamente la literatura, alejadas del status-quo y de las voces autorizadas de patriarcas jóvenes y viejos. Se posibilitará acceder a textos escritos por apasionadas lectoras y escritoras, por desenfadadas y audaces voces pertenecientes a todos los géneros.


Tan solo $500 de arranque servirá para solventar gastos, como pago de dominio, servidor y reconocimientos a colaboradores iniciales. Este rubro servirá para sustentar, inicialmente, tareas de investigación y producción de la revista.
Recompensaré a los colaboradores haciendo constar sus nombres en la revista como madrinas y madrinos fundadores. Con el tiempo y las aguas, y una vez consolidado el proyecto, habrá nuevas recompensas.
Si no logro reunir la cantidad deseada, con lo recaudado organizaré una mesa redonda con invitados especiales y todos quienes hayan colaborado con la campaña. 
Hace falta hablar de las artes de manera más académica, pero contemporánea. Las revistas locales tienen una aproximación superficial, y el discurso académico sólo se dirige a un público especializado. 
Impulsar un proyecto como este abrirá un espacio democrático, plural y humanista. Hablar de la palabra que reflexiona nos hace personas más inteligentes y argumentativas. 
Proyectos, como "La Palabra Encendida", en la que dialogaba con autores contemporáneos en vivo, recibió mucho público y fomentó la crítica especializada e independiente de cualquier círculo tradicional.
Este proyecto necesita de tu generosidad y fuerza. Con el suficiente apoyo, se puede convertir fácilmente en una realidad.
   Riesgos y desafíos
 
El riesgo es permanente. Este no es un juego ni un hobby. El discurso y el mundo literario está encerrado entre los muros de una tradición atávica, y las novedades no despuntan. Necesitamos de crítica comprometida con asentar fundamentos, pero independientes de cualquier presión de los círculos de poder cultural. 
 
La posibilidad de fracasar es constante, por eso este apoyo es sólo un inicio para probar el valor de mi propuesta. Este es un emprendimiento nuevo para mí, en el que ofrezco mi nombre y credenciales. El éxito resguardará mi reputación; y el fracaso, el aprendizaje. La tarea que me propongo es constante. Repetiré los intentos de cualquier otra manera que incorpore pequeñas donaciones.
 Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar
Si no puedes colaborar con dinero, me encantaría recibir tus artículos. Es importante que me envíes un resumen de máximo cien palabras a este correo: macevean@gmail.com. Puede tratarse de crítica literaria o artística a manera de ensayo, o un relato de ficción, o tu poesía, o tus cuadros, o fotografías, o vídeos, o música (2 min. máximo, con un enlace a una plataforma). 
También puedes ayudarme difundiendo mi campaña a través de tus redes sociales y círculos de amigos. Aprecio además tus opiniones –envíalas al e-mail escrito más arriba.
 
Y eso es todo.

story:
This book is a satirical look at suicide that is used as a deterrent to actually ending your own life. I have lost friends and family members to depression and have created a funny way to help people.

In order to publish this book myself, I need help.
I need funds to cover the publishing costs of my book. I want to self publish and promote through local book signings and conventions. All contributors will be given rewards!

story:
Human and Earth Rights

A digital Book for the iPad containing all the human rights declaration articles together with videos, beatuful images, quotes and texts from all time human rights champions

     

UPDATE

We have received support from the outstanding music band Rumspringa! The band is now one of our Champion supporters, and their music will be the soundtrack of our digital book project for human rights.

Rumspringa have a big history of support for the Human Rights cause. They have already provided support to the awesome animation created by Seth Brau – a video on The Universal Declaration of Human Rights – http://youtu.be/hTlrSYbCbHE. Minds Awake by Rumspringa is the official soundtrack.

We are very looking forward to work with them on creating much more value for Human Rights activism.

Thanks guys!

PROJECT PURPOSE AND DESCRIPTION

“Human rights” have become, arguably, the two most evocative and powerful words in global political discourse. The power of human rights to transform societies has already been witnessed within many formerly authoritarian regimes, from the military juntas of South America, through to apartheid South Africa and the breakup of the former Soviet Union.

Those who would seek to continue to exercise power to the detriment of those over whom they rule have good reason to fear these two words.

However, we believe that what can be discerned and identified simply by reading all of the treaties, covenants, conventions and instruments which comprise an ever-expanding body of law, is just not enough to understand what human rights are and what they require in order to be adequately protected and promoted.

On the other end, the aim to enlighten those who have yet to benefit from a sufficiently enlightened education in order to overcome an ignorance of the moral authority of human rights, run a very real risk of being rejected as the more recent manifestation of arrogance and hypocrisy if it is not characterized by intellectual honesty and a willingness to accept some unpalatable truths about the world in which we live, shining a light into places which many of us have preferred to avoid.

Human rights evoke a shared human condition and their essence is to provide a common language for humankind, breaking down the walls which divide us in order to reduce, and hopefully eliminate, systematic human suffering.

This is where our project ambitiously settle its purpose

A naked visual language combined with memorable quotes from worldwide recognized champions of human rights, poetry and critical writings, historical media and actual reports, to start an “inner” and hearth-to-hearth dialogue about values such as respect for others, dignity and tolerance, drawing out skills such as critical thinking, cooperation and the ability to stand up for our rights and those of others.

We follow our purpose whit a great relief that a profound change in the heart of one individual can be the start of a process of change in the destiny of whole societies, and eventually the entire world–a transformation from hopelessness to hopefulness, despair to courage, dependence to interdependence, solitude to harmony, from war to peace.

This project has been started entirely from scratch, by a single person, from concept, to research, copywriting, artwork and implementation. I am joining in to make it possible and take it to the next level.

Our plan is to release it on the AppStore during the month of September 2012, so we need to get to work fast. We need the help of 3 more people to take care of web coding and indesign layout making, a necessary skill set to create beautiful things.

We will look for contributors, authors, photographers and help on content if we ecceed the amount of 10,000 $. Every dollar exceeding this initial amount will be used to pay for the work of human rights champions.

The App will be released for free on the AppStore worldwide and so will stay as long as it last.

You can find the preliminary version of the Human and Earth Rights App, which is participating in the Mag+ Magnify your World design contest, following this direction http://www.magplus.com/magnify/contestants/hr/

How to preview what we are working on

Download the .mib file to your desktop computer and follow the instructions to install the Mag+ Reviewer App (found on the AppStore)

iPad 1 and 2 MIB (122MB):
https://dl.dropbox.com/u/1322276/com.theprintlabs.com.HER.9.mib

iPad Retina MIB (245MB):
https://dl.dropbox.com/u/1322276/com.theprintlabs.com.HER.8.mib

Instruction on how to review the .mib file can found here http://www.magplus.com/how-to-review-an-unpublished-app-remotely/

Get in touch in case you need our assistance to install or use the preview

Perks

The Human Rights champion poster

The Human and Earth Rights poster proof

The Human and Earth Rights poster proof

story:
What Am I Asking?

I'm asking for your help to create, edit, and publish "I Am An Islander," my first collection of Island-themed humour. The book concept has been accepted by Acorn Press, and is already slated to hit the presses in late spring 2012. So the published result will exist soon, by hook or by crook, I kid you not.

In a nutshell, what I'm asking is for interested people to pre-buy the book. Or optionally, be upsold on other related creative pieces. The advance funding will help me get across the final hurdle, and when the book hits the stands in June, you receive it in your mailbox first, wrapped in gratitude.

To create the book, I need to take a chunk of January and February out of my business, and help support the contributions of a dedicated editor (David Malahoff) and a talented artist (Daniel Ledwell). For less than the cost of a bridge trip, you can help me bridge this gap.

Your help will allow me to collaborate with these excellent people, across the first weeks of 2012, and take the final focused time to collect and edit the written pieces.

The end result of your help? A far better book, which you've graciously purchased a couple of months early, you savvy individual. You're actually saving yourself, in many ways, from reading a shabby collection, put together on a too-short shoestring.

What's the Book About?

I've been building and writing toward the collection "I Am An Islander" for four years.

Since 2008, Iâ€™ve been writing and producing radio columns for CBC. Iâ€™ve written more than 60 columns, on topics ranging from a PEI childhood to married life, from internet technology to holiday gift suggestions. This collection will pull together the best and freshest of that lot.

Another main plank in this collection will be re-workings of stage material Iâ€™ve developed. For the shows â€œThe New Potato-Time Reviewâ€ and â€œCome All Ye," I created pieces blending comedy with slideshow graphics, many of them â€˜explainingâ€™ PEI to the audience. The book will feature a selection of this graphically-accompanied material, too, which will add some interesting visual variety.

Add rants from "The Debaters," and some sketches and scribbles never seen before, and you have the gist of "I Am An Islander." Think of it as a highly-selective creative yardsale, where I'm only putting out in the front yard the stuff that makes it worth stopping the car. Actually, that sounds very un-Island as a yardsale, but I want to save you the trouble looking through garbage.

Where's the Funding Going?

This book project is happening, and will continue to happen if this campaign gets even part-way. It all helps.

Your support is not all going to feed Patrick at â€œthe Sobeys.â€ 25% of these funds will be subsistence for time out of my business, rather than accepting support from the good-intentions-paving-company at VISA.

The rest will allow me to properly support the time of other creative professionals, to make the book better. I work for myself, and appreciate what it takes to make a month add up. When I collaborate with other people, I try to pay them respect, and a living wage.

I'll be working with David Malahoff as an editor and creative advisor. Iâ€™ve collaborated with David since 2006, to develop my comedy writing. Among other credits, he produced Arthur Blackâ€™s CBC show, â€œBasic Black,â€ and helped guide that radio hostâ€™s columns to book form.

David has supported this project without issuing any quotes or submitting any invoices. However, I want to underwrite as many of his hours as I can, across a couple of months of concentrated work, which will cut into typical work days.

I'll also be working with the artist (and my brother), Daniel Ledwell. Daniel will be creating original canvases for the front and back cover, and some illustrations between them. He's a talented guy, and Mom thinks he's working too hard and shouldn't dress like a hobo. So I'd like to make sure that his time is supported, or I'll hear it.

What Do You Get?

You will have my abundant thanks, for starters. But 'thanks' is between saintliness and write-off in the dictionary, so I'd like to make sure you can experience my gratitude in some concrete ways, too.

I think the support packages deliver you some good stuff, in return for your much appreciated pay-it-forward.

Basically, each of the support packages adds one new item to the jolly swag pile. These items are:
  • A pre-buy of the book, available June 2012
  • A professional copy of the DVD animation "Think Like a Fish," created by Daniel and Patrick Ledwell
  • An original, comfortable "I Am An Islander" t-shirt
  • Signed, limited edition prints of book illustrations
  • Ticket packages to the Charlottetown Festival show, "Come All Ye," running July to late August 2012
  • A custom comedy performance for the group or charity of your choice

All packages include shipping and handling. Either shipping to you by mail, or handling it directly to you, while my footling holds your front door open. All merchandise (including the book) will be available and will ship in June 2012.

How Else Can I Help?

If you have a minute, could you forward this campaign to anyone you think might be interested in the book, maybe with a whiff of context? You could use The Twitter or The Facebook, or other on-line services that Islanders preface with a superfluous 'The.' Or The E-mail works not too bad, either.

Your support will make me feel as awkward as this previous block of writing, and awkward is my sign of sincere appreciation. Thanks for considering some support.
