, video games and RPGs. In this section they’ll find  everything that’s new and exciting in the
games world.
•   Exhibitions
Here, different exhibitions are set up to not only
allow guests to exhibit their works of art, but to also offer a section
dedicated to emerging artists. Talented 
individuals, including those from outside Calabria will be given the
opportunity to showcase their talent and creativity. In conjunction with
illustrations and comics,  ample  space will be given to modellism:  scale model landscapes and figures,
historical representations, Comic Art recreations  and much more .
  
•  Cinema
This section will show films for all age groups -
starting from the early afternoon  until
the late evening, a large variety of film styles and genres will be shown.  There will even be space for  new movie releases and ‘must watch’ classics.
•  Stands
In this section visitors will be able to meet all our
invited artists. Artists will be on hand to answer questions and inspire
others. In addition, comic store owners, libraries and publishers will showcase
the latest trends and of course, items will be available for sale. 
•  Workshops and meetings 
In this section meetings and workshops involving our
invited artists  will be organised. Comic
schools, illustrators, inkers will share their personal experiences. 
•  Live
The Live section is the most eclectic of the event.
Different events take place throughout the day, from  medieval combat /armor games, to music
concerts of cartoons cover bands. The final day is where the cosplay contest
will be held.




Visitors have FREE ENTRANCE – a big difference from
other similar events run globally.   





 

10.000,00
€  is what we need  to continue this incredible event and realise
our ambitions. 
We want LameziaComics&Co to remain available to
everyone, whether if children or adults, as we believe  as all cultural events  should be accessible. 







Whilst reading about LameziaComics&Co has been
helpful in itself, for those supporting us financially, we have a special
programme of recognition offers – to say THANKS! 

5 € - Supporter Beginner Level
A special thank you from the organising team for your
generous support in making this event possible
10 € - Supporter Standard Level
You’ll be a main character during the event. A banner
with your name/photo will be displayed at the entrance. 
15 € - Supporter Expert Level
Saying ‘thank you’ sometimes just isn’t enough: a
banner with your name/photo will be displayed at the entrance and your name
will be published as a supporter in our official social network media so all
our fans can  see you.
25 € - Supporter Master Level
Supporter standard Level + Supporter Expert Level 
Your contribution will be even more visible -  you can also wear it! A limited number of 400
specially designed t-shirts with different colours and an original design will
be provided to you for your support with our 
crowdfunding ambitions.
80 € - Fan Lunch Level 
Supporter Standard Level  + Supporter Expert Level 
YOU’LL HAVE LUNCH and spend some time together with
the invited artists of this VI edition and the president of ATTIVAMENTE !! ( on
Saturday 13 )
100 € - Fan Lunch Level 2
Supporter Standard Level  + Supporter Expert Level 
YOU’LL HAVE LUNCH and spend some time together with
the invited artists  of this VI edition
and the president of ATTIVAMENTE !! ( on Sunday 14 )
500€  -  Platinum Supporter 
You are one of us!!! 
This  event is your event! Your
name  will be on all banners in the
convention and in all advertising materials both paper and digital.  
We thank you from the bottom of our heart … to
make  our ambitions come true!  






We know that not all of you could  contribute financially today, so instead
please share what you see and look for updates on what’s happening with our
social network. 
There will be a surprise also for you!!!!

story:
PSA: the work includes a lot of images containing blood, so it's definitely not for the squeamish and may be triggering to some :( 

 

Smol Summary

This project was birthed from another zine I created titled Himitsu. Himitsu is the Japanese word for secret, written as ひみつ. Himitsu was a zine where people, mostly young women, would tell me secrets of theirs, both anonymous and known. They shared their experiences on love, hurt, relationships and the like. 

Scorpion is the bigger and better version of Himitsu. Scorpion explores the horror genre alongside these stories on love and hurt. Juxtaposing images of young women covered in blood, looking bad ass as hell alongside interviews where they talk about their broken hearts and secrets. 

Scorpion is my child and like a shameless pageant mom, I want to share it with the world. 

 

What I Need & What You Get

For a broke art student, I have quite big plans for Scorpion. All the funding (£500) will go towards printing the first 100 copies of Scorpion, as well as posters of images within the work. 

Many of the people who contribute WILL receive copies of the thick a** zine & I also plan to have a solo exhibition in the month of December and the zine will be available for purchase their as well, along with other goodies e.g stickers, posters, you name it (which will also be available to contributors here). 

If I do not reach my goal, I will still print copies of the zine, but possibly around 50 or less, which will still be available to contributors and also for purchase at the end of the year. 
 

The Impact

Scorpion is really a zine made for women and by women, although men it's for you too, but the content within it is to empower women. The media is somehow always out to get women, pitting us against each other, telling us what's "right" for us or how we should act. This zine is basically saying to hell with that, we can do and act however we want to. We can be hardcore as hell and also vulnerable in the same breath and that's what I'm exploring within this project. 

 

Risks

There are very few risks or challenges at the moment regarding the publishing of the zine. The only challenge really is seeing as this my first zine I will be self publishing, I will be handling everything on my won. If all goes well,  it should be published by November and out for shipping by December and early January. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're unable to contribute, that's A-okay, sharing the word on social media will help a bunch. Instagram, facebook, Tumblr, heck even Myspace. I would greatly appreciate that.

story:
The lives of future generations, the economy and survival of the planet depend on the next generation's ability to succeed. 

“Your work is going to fill a large part of your life, and the only way to be truly satisfied is to do what you believe is great work. And the only way to do great work is to love what you do. If you haven’t found it yet, keep looking, and don’t settle. As with all matters of the heart…you’ll know when you find It.” — Steve Jobs

My Story

I am a recipient of the Fellowship of Man Award for being an entrepreneur in the arts. My life's work and passion is in helping marginalized youth develop their creative potential. Through my extensive research, and vast experience as an arts administrator for over 30 years, I discovered that the working world of the future will require all of us to be more entrepreneurial, work independantly, collaboratively and creatively.

This book provides the information needed to function in this new world of work.

I intend to use the concepts from this book once published to further develop videos, an audio book and a special mentorship and training pilot program for disadvantaged youth in downtown Toronto and other neighbourhoods through NewArts a non profit organization.

We Need

We need $1,500 to have my final draft edited by a professional, design a book cover, convert and upload my files on Bookbaby who will distribute to all the major ebook retailers including Amazon, print one hundred hard copies and cover costs for a book launch.

As a contibutor you can be aknowledged in the credits, receive free copies of the book at our launch, or have the book mailed to you and get the first copy of the ebook, get invited to the launch and be introduced to the audience.

If I am unable to reach my entire goal I will determine if there is enough to do at a minimum upload the ebook to Kindle for distribution on Amazon, if all else fails the money will help NewArts a not for profit organization continue to develop new arts and emerging talents.

Impact

With my connections to youth organizations and through the ebook's wide distribution on all the major ebook retail sites, this book will reach countless individuals to help them develop their creative potential, live healthier, and productive lives in the new world of work. The skills they will aquire can be applied to solving many of our worlds problems.

All my life I have lived the life of being an artreprepreneur, both as a perfomer and an arts administrator, I have walked the walk and know how crucial this information is and it's not being taught in our traditional schools.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can also help by sharing my campaign with others spreading the word and sharing through your social media sites. You can also comment on my drafts which I will publish along the way and pass on your email to me so you can stay in touch with other NewArts developments.

story:
Hi my name is George G A Wensley. I am an author who lives in Tonbridge, Kent the garden of England UK.

I am relaunching Text: Murder & Prose, Photos and Poems with new publishers (New Generation Publishing.) The purpose of this project is to cover the publishing fees and to promote my book sales.

A little about Text: Murder, A beautiful German girl is murdered on the sea front of Eastbourne, A British detective inspector and a Polish boarder guard, have to learn to work with each other and solve the murder. This is the first in the Rialto Trilogy. Next year a small 5 to 7 minute trailer will be produced on Long Beach LA.

A little about Prose, Photos and Poems. a lot of it is based on my course work for my certificate of creative writing from the university of Canterbury. It explores my moods and has some photography which I use as inspiration for my work.

I hope you enjoy the read and the perks.

*

Next year in February I shall be crowd funding a movie trailer for Text: Murder with the title don't go. It will be 5 to 7 minutes long with some cute visual effects. Produced by Kevin S Michaels. To be shot on Long Beach LA County CA. 

If that is successful we will produce the 45 minute script I have either in the United Kingdom or USA or both.

story:
¿Qué?

«Mucho, todo, nada» ahonda en eso llamado demostración por contraposición, en lo que no deja de ser una oda contra el pragmatismo materialista que nos rodea... en un tono desenfadado y sin pretensiones de sentar cátedra, pero sí de entretener aportando un mensaje.

Hay experiencias que demuestran que la felicidad no es tenerlo todo, sino valorar lo que los demás te dan. Esta historia atrapa al lector y lo acompaña de los Estados Unidos a Ghana, a lo largo de un libro que enseña como aquellos pequeños detalles, insignificantes para algunos, pero tan importantes para otros, se convierten en sonrisas llenas de ilusión que valen mucho más de lo que algunos pueden pagar.

Dos realidades para tomar conciencia de lo que nos rodea y aprender a apreciar lo que afortunadamente nos acompaña en nuestro día a día. Una lectura que invita a reflexionar y pretende inspirar a los más jóvenes a crear su propia aventura.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una joven editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el emplear una campaña preventa para valorar la aceptación y viabilidad de cada título.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy se nos presenta Laura Romero.

Del 4 de noviembre de 1990, licenciada en Publicidad y Relaciones Públicas, feliz por naturaleza, tozuda de remate y escritora por sorpresa, nací en Barcelona a las doce menos veinte de la noche, pero no acostumbro a trasnochar. Tengo un Máster en Dirección de Comunicación, así que hablar es lo mío, hasta con las paredes si cabe. 

Millennial con todo lo que comporta, perfeccionista, impaciente y algo maniática. Trabajo en una agencia de publicidad y por las tardes descargo adrenalina contra un saco de boxeo.

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 800€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cincuenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán como ayuda para sacar adelante esta primera edición de Mucho, todo, nada que saldría después a la venta.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona a la autora, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Laura Romero vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

story:
Over the course of my time as a student pastor, parents often ask, “What resources are available to help my student read the Bible?” And while there are certainly no shortages of “youth devotionals,” very few resources do an adequate job of actually helping students engage with Scripture. Frustrated by this void, I created Experience Scripture: a 30 day experience through portions of the Bible that will help students engage Scripture themselves.

 

XP Scripture was founded on four principles:

  • XP Scripture is deeply committed to the Biblical text. All too often, adolescent devotionals are not anchored in Scripture and therefore read like self-help manuals. While XP Scripture will supply a 300 word “commentary” on the daily Scripture reading, the tool only works if the student first starts with reading a substantial portion of God’s Word themselves. The priority of this tool is to help students develop a lifelong habit of reading God’s Word.
  • XP Scripture is accessible. To a twelve year old, a 365 day commitment is overwhelming, and the sheer volume of pages can squander excitement from the outset. But a resource that is accessible, 75 pages long, and spans the course of a month is within the grasp of a student. Students will feel a sense of accomplishment when finished and propelled to pursue future study.
  • XP Scripture is beautifully designed.  Gone are the days of clipart and stock images of strangers. The middle school eye is becoming increasingly sophisticated; students must be proud of the look and feel of their book.
  • XP Scripture integrates study with reflection. It will function as a hybrid journal and devotional. The design allows space, right within its pages, to help students understand where Scripture and daily life intersect.  

XP Scripture needs your support:

As we raise capital to fund the following areas of the project, I invite you to consider making an investment in me and in XP Scripture:

  • Design:  I have written the first installment of XP Scripture: a 30 day experience through the Gospel of Mark. I believe the content is helpful, but I need to hire a designer to turn my Word document into the resource I have envisioned.
  • Marketing and promotion: Once this resource is completed, we will face substantial costs in order to make pastors, leaders, and parents aware of XP Scripture.

 

I would be honored if you would help us raise the funds needed to make XP Scripture a reality. If you have any questions or comments, please do not hesitate to reach out to me. The Lord has clearly placed the vision for this project on my heart, and I am grateful that you would consider supporting me as I step out in faith and complete this project. I look forward to hearing from you!

story:
Story of My Book

The People Behind the Animals is a book focusing on the lesser-known fields of veterinary medicine as well as incredible stories of people around the world working with animals in different ways.

My name is Abby Lipiner and I am the author of The People Behind the Animals. I wrote this book because there are people doing amazing things with and for animals every day that no one is talking about. I think it’s important that their stories are told and that animal lovers learn about the different ways they can work with animals.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that wanting to be a veterinarian does not have to limit you to the standard private practice work with dogs and cats and that if you love animals, there are ways to help them outside of committing to the years of schooling that becoming a veterinarian requires. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for animals and the veterinary industry in you. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you find the right outlet for your love for animals and even create a new one if it doesn’t yet exist.

In this book, you'll learn about veterinarians that chose a non-traditional line of work and different people and organizations that are working with animals in ways we could have never imagined, including:
  • How Dr. Karen Phillips discovered her love of shelter medicine and was inspired to open her own farm animal sanctuary, Hope Haven.
  • How Paul Barton turned a passion for music into a source of love and calmness for elephants in Thailand who have lived lives of loss, abuse, and neglect.
  • How one man’s love of rats led to the foundation of an organization, APOPO, dedicated to saving human lives through the use of landmine and tuberculosis detection at the hands, or paws, of rats.

You will love this book if you want to become a veterinarian or even if you just love animals.

The People Behind the Animals is a non-fiction book that speaks to aspiring veterinary students and all animal lovers who are looking at the different areas of veterinary work and awe-inspiring ways that people work with animals around the world for the first time.

 

The Book - The People Behind the Animals

The book is written in 3 Parts...

Part 1 contains the introduction + additional chapters 1-5. These chapters focus on the evolution and domestication of animals as well as the evolution of a rapidly growing field of veterinary medicine. This section also dives into the first kind of nontraditional animal work, the ways that animals are trained to help humans. You will read about therapy and service animal programs falling outside of the typical service dog mold and the important work APOPO’s HeroRats are doing overseas to protect and save lives.

Part 2 contains Chapters 6-9. In this section, you will read about veterinarians who went outside the stereotypical cat and dog family practice route. These veterinarians work with all different kinds of animals in both traditional hospital and non-traditional outdoor/wild settings like the Gorilla Doctors who dedicate their lives to saving mountain gorillas; the most endangered subspecies of gorillas.

Part 3 contains Chapters 10-12. This section looks beyond the world of veterinary medicine and focuses on other ways people are helping animals. In these chapters, you’ll learn all about different animal sanctuaries, the healing power music has on animals and all about Steve Irwin and his family’s work.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in July of 2020
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for my Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this summer
When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

 

About the Author


Abby Lipiner is an aspiring veterinary student majoring in natural sciences with minors in chemistry and administration of justice from the University of Pittsburgh. During her junior year, she interned at the Lozito Laboratory where she oversaw husbandry of the lab’s reptiles and amphibians. In addition to volunteering with various animal rescues, she also volunteers at different animal hospitals. An animal lover since birth, she can still recall correctly diagnosing her guinea pig with pneumonia when she was nine years old after reading every book she could find on guinea pig health when her pet started to seem sick. She was born to be a veterinarian; it just took some time for her to figure this out.

She wrote this book because she has a passion for exotic animals and wants to share it with other people. There are so many extraordinary people helping animals that aren’t getting the attention and appreciation they deserve; she wants to share their stories.

For more information, you can connect with Abby at abby.lipiner@yahoo.com, @abby_lipiner on twitter, and as Abby Lipiner on Facebook.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. Please use #ThePeopleBehindTheAnimals and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Abby
story_txt:
Story of My Book
The People Behind the Animals is a book focusing on the lesser-known fields of veterinary medicine as well as incredible stories of people around the world working with animals in different ways.My name is Abby Lipiner and I am the author of The People Behind the Animals. I wrote this book because there are people doing amazing things with and for animals every day that no one is talking about. I think it’s important that their stories are told and that animal lovers learn about the different ways they can work with animals.My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that wanting to be a veterinarian does not have to limit you to the standard private practice work with dogs and cats and that if you love animals, there are ways to help them outside of committing to the years of schooling that becoming a veterinarian requires. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for animals and the veterinary industry in you. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you find the right outlet for your love for animals and even create a new one if it doesn’t yet exist.In this book, you'll learn about veterinarians that chose a non-traditional line of work and different people and organizations that are working with animals in ways we could have never imagined, including:
How Dr. Karen Phillips discovered her love of shelter medicine and was inspired to open her own farm animal sanctuary, Hope Haven.
How Paul Barton turned a passion for music into a source of love and calmness for elephants in Thailand who have lived lives of loss, abuse, and neglect.
How one man’s love of rats led to the foundation of an organization, APOPO, dedicated to saving human lives through the use of landmine and tuberculosis detection at the hands, or paws, of rats.

You will love this book if you want to become a veterinarian or even if you just love animals.The People Behind the Animals is a non-fiction book that speaks to aspiring veterinary students and all animal lovers who are looking at the different areas of veterinary work and awe-inspiring ways that people work with animals around the world for the first time.
 
The Book - The People Behind the Animals

The book is written in 3 Parts...Part 1 contains the introduction + additional chapters 1-5. These chapters focus on the evolution and domestication of animals as well as the evolution of a rapidly growing field of veterinary medicine. This section also dives into the first kind of nontraditional animal work, the ways that animals are trained to help humans. You will read about therapy and service animal programs falling outside of the typical service dog mold and the important work APOPO’s HeroRats are doing overseas to protect and save lives.Part 2 contains Chapters 6-9. In this section, you will read about veterinarians who went outside the stereotypical cat and dog family practice route. These veterinarians work with all different kinds of animals in both traditional hospital and non-traditional outdoor/wild settings like the Gorilla Doctors who dedicate their lives to saving mountain gorillas; the most endangered subspecies of gorillas.Part 3 contains Chapters 10-12. This section looks beyond the world of veterinary medicine and focuses on other ways people are helping animals. In these chapters, you’ll learn all about different animal sanctuaries, the healing power music has on animals and all about Steve Irwin and his family’s work.

story:
Story of My Book

The Power of Infinite Potential is about the endless possibilities that exists for everyone, when we discover our purpose and activate our potential.

My name is, Camille McCallum, and I am the author of The Power of Infinite Potential. I wrote this book because I wanted to explore what it meant to live life on purpose. In the process, I discovered how to maximize my potential and minimize my fear.

In reading this book, my hope is that you will recognize the infinite potential that exists within your life, grow in your purpose, and achieve personal success. I will share with you the same sort of excitement I feel when I look out into the world through the lens of infinite potential.  The transformative power of potential evidenced in the natural world is present and available in all of us.  Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to reach it!

In this book:

  • You will receive advice from Ambassador, Jeanne Phillips, on how to navigate the career landscape.
  • You will hear how “purpose introduced herself" to Chase Consumer Banking CEO, Thasunda Duckett.
  • You will learn how I developed the theory of “infinite potential”, and how it changed absolutely everything. 

You will love this book if you find inspiration in the world around you, and are interested in using your gifts to help others.

The Power of Infinite Potential is a non-fiction book that speaks to college students and working professionals who are looking at developing their purpose and maximizing their infinite potential for the first time.

The Book - The Power of Infinite Potential 

This book is written in 3 Parts....

Part 1 contains the Introduction + Chapters 1-3. It introduces the theory of infinite potential, highlighting how you can use purposeful development to achieve personal success.

Part 2 contains Chapters 4-7. We break down the origins of purpose, and help you find it hiding in plain sight. This section will give you insight into your innate purpose and highlight stories of people who have found and are living on purpose.

Part 3 contains Chapters 8-10. In this section of the book, we discuss success, and what it looks like for you. We focus on success as a personal pursuit, absent from greed and ripe with abundance.

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December, 2020
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this Winter

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish

A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book

Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)

Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback

The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover

I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share the experience of writing my book

And more...

About the Author

Camille McCallum is an entrepreneurship advisor at Southern Methodist University, and the founder of education non-profit, Model the Way. Model the Way seeks to transform communities through entrepreneurship education and focuses their work on equipping highschool students with the knowledge and resources to become financially independent innovators and problem solvers.

Camille felt a calling when she founded, Model the Way, and she felt that same calling when she began writing this book. She wanted to explore more of those innate feelings that draw out the best in all of us and help us strive to do more for others.

In her spare time, Camille loves to surround herself with family and friends. She’s always ready for a new adventure with the people she holds dear.

For more information you can connect with Camille at camillem@modeltheway.org and at @camilleviviana on all social platforms.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #powerofpotential and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,

story:
Nu expanderar vi!

Fyra år efter tidningens grundande har tidningen växt så mycket att vi har behov av en gemensam redaktionslokal. Nya Dagbladet når idag tiotusentals unika läsare varje månad och växer på alla områden.

För att fortsätta att växa och utmana den politiska korrektheten och granska makthavare behöver vi din hjälp!

Stöd vår insamling till en redaktionslokal. En gemensam arbetsplats skulle öka effektiviteten ordentligt för tidningen och möjliggöra mer regelbundna produktioner av både artiklar, radio och webb-tv. Ökad professionalism och regelbundenhet är viktigt för att kunna nå fler läsare.

Med ditt stöd kan vi bekosta hyra, inventarier, radioutrustning med mera.

Vårt mål är att samla in 50 000 kronor för att kunna finansiera uppstarten av detta viktiga steg.

Var med och stötta det nya alternativet inom svensk media, ge ditt stöd, stort som litet!

Varför Nya Dagbladet?

  • Gör helt unika artiklar och reportage med små medel som inte ens stora medier förmår
  • Når tiotusentals unika läsare varje månad
  • Unik bred profil med starkt varumärke
  • Drivs av idealister som tror på samhällsförbättring

Vi gör skillnad!

Nya Dagbladet har avslöjat missförhållanden, granskat medier och politiker, avslöjat matfusk och oseriösa företag, granskat övervakningssamhället, dubbelmoralen i invandringspolitiken och mycket mycket mer!

Sprid ordet!

Berätta om tidningen och vår insamlingskampanj till vänner och bekanta. Sprid kännedomen så att fler kan hjälpa till att bidra i kampanjen.

 

Sverige förtjänar ett bättre medieklimat - se till att det blir verklighet idag!

story:
Creating a kids property isn't as easy as it seems. Everybody has an idea for a kids book, don't they? But if you consider the sheer amount of submissions to the actual amount of kids books that get published every year, it's quite the contrast. Thousands of submissions compared to hundreds that "may" see print.

I created Banana Tail back in the late 1990s with my dear old departed dad and he's never gotten to see that his son, me, developed his idea into a beloved children's book series for those familiar with it. I started out submitting Banana Tail to staples in the children's book market like Little Golden Books, Little, Brown, and Simon & Schuster and got very close to getting a contract with a few of them. It was eye-opening to say the least, but these "near misses" helped me realize I had something worthy.

I pressed forward and with the help of my lengthy career in comic books and some name recognition, I was able to get some support from comic book and review sites that saw one of their own branching outside the world of superheroes and into unfamiliar territory. 

And now, here we are 17 years after self-publishing the first title in a series of books I had imagined in the world of Banana Tail. I have produced four Banana Tail books that have been sold through Barnes & Noble, as well as comic book stores around the country. Banana Tail's stable of books ranges from the original comic-sized picture book titled Banana Tail to the most recent Halloween-themed BOOnana Tail's Halloween Special (see below). Diamond Distributors added a "spotlight" to the BOO comic and helped it get more notice and sell quite well. BOO was developed to grow with young readers that had the earlier storybooks read to them as toddlers. I've taken Banana Tail and Friends outside of the publishing realm and have created t-shirts, coffee mugs, BBQ aprons, superhero prints and jigsaw puzzles featuring the characters.

The series also includes Banana Tail's Tales and Activities book and Banana Tail's Colorful Adventure (Image Comics) computer-generated hard cover. The first two books focused on Banana Tail himself and Reena, the young mood color-changing rhino. Rounding out the trio of best friends is Tic Tac, the plaid zebra featured in Banana Tail and The Checkerboard Jungle.

~~~

PLEASE NOTE: IF YOU DON'T SEE AN ITEM YOU MIGHT BE INTERESTED IN, CERTAINLY ASK ABOUT IT. IF IT'S MANAGEABLE, IT'LL GET DONE!

 

Least I forget... A few years back I created a Banana Tail art portfolio enlisting some of today's top illustrators. Comic legend WALTER SIMONSON leads the way with an illustrated and hand colored Banana Tail and Tic Tac. Following Walter is top cover artist Greg Horn, luminaries Jim Calafiore, Shawn McManus, Sara Richard and Kristen Sorra. I tell you this why? READ ON...

*BONUS NOTE* Pledges OVER $30 will automatically receive the unsigned "suitable for framing" Banana Tail print portfolio.

Pledges over $50 will receive the "signed and numbered" Banana Tail print portfolio. LIMITED to 100 signed sets.

Banana Tail portfolio...unsigned

Walter Simonson signed example...Limited to 100

So, if you and your kids have been following Banana Tail since its inception or are new to the kids property, here's your chance to continue following his adventures or maybe pledge for the series of books and catch up to what many fans have been enjoying for the past 17 years!

BOOnana Tail comics (w/variant covers) were available through comic shops and got "spotlit"

The original book SPOTLIGHTED in Diamond catalog... 2003

Some testimonies!

“Her favorite book! My 3 year old daughter loves this book. The pictures are wonderful, much more interesting to her than most children’s book illustrations, and the text is great, too. She has several hundred books and loves many. Every night, she gets to pick 3 stories to have read before she sleeps. This is the first time that she wanted me to read one story 3 times. Get it. Now.”

— Anonymous Mother

~~~~

“Author Mark McKenna has created unique colorful characters with telling expressions in his book Banana Tail; capturing both my imagination and the imagination of my six year old son. McKenna not only takes us on an wondrous adventure in this story, but reminds us of an important moral–acceptance.”

— Jennifer O’Connor
        Reporter
Warwick Valley Dispatch

~~~

“I need to purchase 7 more copies of Banana Tail to give as Christmas presents. My daughter Erin does not go crazy over many books or videos. She has Banana Tail up there with Elmo. When I went on the Banana Tail website at home, Erin went crazy! She wouldn’t let me close out of it and when I did she cried for 5 minutes. I think that’s a great sign. She loves it…maybe even more then Elmo. She never went to bed clutching an Elmo book before! Congrats on your characters having such an impact on my daughter, as I’m sure they will on many other children.”

— Debbie Magsamen
        The Mother of Banana Tail’s #1 fan

~~~

Check this 37 second film out created by the team who brought you Banana Tail's Colorful Adventure...Full Sail University!!

SUPER HERO PRINTS!

THE OTHER BOOKS!

The CGI illustrated Banana Tail's Colorful Adventure

Tales and Activities

The BOOnana Tail Halloween Special cover #1

Boo Cover #2

BOO Cover #3

The original storybook

Sketch Covers

Risks, Challenges, CoVid-19 Updates & Indiegogo

Banana Tail and the Checkerboard Jungle is my 5th Btail project and I've had very little concerns with risks since I've been successful at crowd funding my past projects. Unfortunately, due to CoVid-19, I had a brief setback getting this funded on Kickstarter in April and did not meet my goal. After allowing some time to pass and letting the world return to some semblance of normal, I relaunched on Kickstarter a few weeks back and have managed to reach my goal with time remaining! Now that we have met our goals on Kickstarter, I wanted to give Indiegogo patrons the chance to get early access to Banana Tail and The Checkerboard Jungle as well as some new rewards I'm only making available on Indiegogo. Subscribe to my campaign and follow my Facebook page, Mark Mckenna Art, for updates and potentially some new rewards.

*Fulfillment dates are all tentative around what happens with CoVid-19 in the coming months. I will keep everyone apprised to the best of my abilities.
story_txt: Creating a kids property isn't as easy as it seems. Everybody has an idea for a kids book, don't they? But if you consider the sheer amount of submissions to the actual amount of kids books that get published every year, it's quite the contrast. Thousands of submissions compared to hundreds that "may" see print.I created Banana Tail back in the late 1990s with my dear old departed dad and he's never gotten to see that his son, me, developed his idea into a beloved children's book series for those familiar with it. I started out submitting Banana Tail to staples in the children's book market like Little Golden Books, Little, Brown, and Simon & Schuster and got very close to getting a contract with a few of them. It was eye-opening to say the least, but these "near misses" helped me realize I had something worthy.I pressed forward and with the help of my lengthy career in comic books and some name recognition, I was able to get some support from comic book and review sites that saw one of their own branching outside the world of superheroes and into unfamiliar territory. And now, here we are 17 years after self-publishing the first title in a series of books I had imagined in the world of Banana Tail. I have produced four Banana Tail books that have been sold through Barnes & Noble, as well as comic book stores around the country. Banana Tail's stable of books ranges from the original comic-sized picture book titled Banana Tail to the most recent Halloween-themed BOOnana Tail's Halloween Special (see below). Diamond Distributors added a "spotlight" to the BOO comic and helped it get more notice and sell quite well. BOO was developed to grow with young readers that had the earlier storybooks read to them as toddlers. I've taken Banana Tail and Friends outside of the publishing realm and have created t-shirts, coffee mugs, BBQ aprons, superhero prints and jigsaw puzzles featuring the characters.The series also includes Banana Tail's Tales and Activities book and Banana Tail's Colorful Adventure (Image Comics) computer-generated hard cover. The first two books focused on Banana Tail himself and Reena, the young mood color-changing rhino. Rounding out the trio of best friends is Tic Tac, the plaid zebra featured in Banana Tail and The Checkerboard Jungle.~~~PLEASE NOTE: IF YOU DON'T SEE AN ITEM YOU MIGHT BE INTERESTED IN, CERTAINLY ASK ABOUT IT. IF IT'S MANAGEABLE, IT'LL GET DONE! Least I forget... A few years back I created a Banana Tail art portfolio enlisting some of today's top illustrators. Comic legend WALTER SIMONSON leads the way with an illustrated and hand colored Banana Tail and Tic Tac. Following Walter is top cover artist Greg Horn, luminaries Jim Calafiore, Shawn McManus, Sara Richard and Kristen Sorra. I tell you this why? READ ON...*BONUS NOTE* Pledges OVER $30 will automatically receive the unsigned "suitable for framing" Banana Tail print portfolio.Pledges over $50 will receive the "signed and numbered" Banana Tail print portfolio. LIMITED to 100 signed sets.Banana Tail portfolio...unsignedWalter Simonson signed example...Limited to 100So, if you and your kids have been following Banana Tail since its inception or are new to the kids property, here's your chance to continue following his adventures or maybe pledge for the series of books and catch up to what many fans have been enjoying for the past 17 years!BOOnana Tail comics (w/variant covers) were available through comic shops and got "spotlit"The original book SPOTLIGHTED in Diamond catalog... 2003Some testimonies!“Her favorite book! My 3 year old daughter loves this book. The pictures are wonderful, much more interesting to her than most children’s book illustrations, and the text is great, too. She has several hundred books and loves many. Every night, she gets to pick 3 stories to have read before she sleeps. This is the first time that she wanted me to read one story 3 times. Get it. Now.”— Anonymous Mother~~~~“Author Mark McKenna has created unique colorful characters with telling expressions in his book Banana Tail; capturing both my imagination and the imagination of my six year old son. McKenna not only takes us on an wondrous adventure in this story, but reminds us of an important moral–acceptance.”— Jennifer O’Connor        ReporterWarwick Valley Dispatch~~~“I need to purchase 7 more copies of Banana Tail to give as Christmas presents. My daughter Erin does not go crazy over many books or videos. She has Banana Tail up there with Elmo. When I went on the Banana Tail website at home, Erin went crazy! She wouldn’t let me close out of it and when I did she cried for 5 minutes. I think that’s a great sign. She loves it…maybe even more then Elmo. She never went to bed clutching an Elmo book before! Congrats on your characters having such an impact on my daughter, as I’m sure they will on many other children.”— Debbie Magsamen        The Mother of Banana Tail’s #1 fan~~~Check this 37 second film out created by the team who brought you Banana Tail's Colorful Adventure...Full Sail University!!SUPER HERO PRINTS!THE OTHER BOOKS!The CGI illustrated Banana Tail's Colorful AdventureTales and ActivitiesThe BOOnana Tail Halloween Special cover #1Boo Cover #2BOO Cover #3The original storybookSketch CoversRisks, Challenges, CoVid-19 Updates & IndiegogoBanana Tail and the Checkerboard Jungle is my 5th Btail project and I've had very little concerns with risks since I've been successful at crowd funding my past projects.
